You can find better quality LED TVs but not one this size for the cost. I also own a 50" Samsung LED set and love it as well but this large 60" screen will blow you away. Wifi setup is easy and works without any hitch. I can easily stream digital content from Netflix and Amazon's Video service.Amazon's delivery service is fabulous. Second time I've had a TV delivered by them and very happy with the care and knowledge my delivery guy demonstrated.Recommended this set highly!My tips:You can download a full user manual PDF from Vizio's website. Helpful if you want to tweak your TV settings deeper than listed in the setup guide. Manual is nicely setup and easy to use.Delete any apps on the bottom screen main menu once you decide which ones you are not likely to use. Will make it easier to scroll through any favorites. Manual will show you how.I did also use the picture settings another reviewer has kindly listed here. While they are good, I still like to set the picture quality to "VIVID" which makes the image brighter and sharper. Which is what makes an LED set so great...in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Television!!!
Reviews.Author: BradyFeldhaus
Reviews.Content: When i bought this television it was only 1000 bucks... a 60 inch for a 1000 bucks with a great picture, clear cinematics, and gamer mode for my xbox and ps3... Yes, and thank you!On a side note it also has 4 hdmi inputs... which is 1 extra then you'll usually use. This is a "badass" television for it's price... but I would recommend the 4 year warranty plan just because it's good to have peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: Panel failure before 60 days
Reviews.Author: Hoover
Reviews.Content: I bought this T.V. in October for 999.00$ then a month later it was everywhere for 690.00$. If that wasn't frustrating enough after about 40 days my T.V.  picture went out.I was out of the thirty day return window to Amazon so I contacted Vizio, to there credit there customer service was good and they sent me another T.V.The delivery company they used were much better than Amazons they actually came in set up the T.V. and took the old one away.The company Amazon used sent only one guy and he was trying to carry the box by himself up my stairs so I gave him a hand and he seemed like he was in a rush but atleast he helped me get the T.V. out the box before he left.T.V. REVIEWThe T.V. out of the box didn't have the greatest picture the colors were kinda off and they didn't seem naturalThere was significant back lighting bleed through during start-up but it wasn't noticeable while watching programs except very slightly during real dark scenes.I also had the lip synch issue which was really bad on certain channels. I bought a AVR ( receiver) and ran everything to my receiver then from the receiver to the T.V. . This seemed to have improved/fixed the lip sync issue but this isn't practical for everyone.I decided to try some picture settings I found on AVS FORUM after a little adjusting I was satisfied with the picture quality.BOTTOM LINEIt is unacceptable for a T.V. to fail within 40 days, Lip synch issues are unacceptable, bad internet apps/ processing slow. It is a new model T.V and the complaints are just starting to role in on the picture failure many are experiencing, I have a feeling this is gonna be a widespread problem and even though they gave me a new T.V. I'm just not comfortable with what to expect from a reliability standpoint.

Reviews.Title: Worked fine for a few months
Reviews.Author: A Music Addict "Rory"
Reviews.Content: I had no issue with this TV until a few weeks ago, when it started shutting itself off at random times, and it is making a popping noise when it turns off, like the speaker popping, or perhaps some kind of electrical short.This has nothing to do with overheating or anything like that, the TV could be off the whole day, I come home from work, turn it on, and it happens 5 minutes later.I unplugged the TV because I'm concerned it might cause a fire, and I am currently waiting for a response from Vizio for my RMA.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv
Reviews.Author: Sports fan
Reviews.Content: I am not one to write reviews on products but I am so impressed by this tv that I had to share my thoughts on how great this tv was! I'm a big movie and sports buff, so you can assume that I am very picky on the color and color accuracy on anything I watch. I just like the thought of knowing that I can watch football and see that the field is green and not some dark algae color like on some tvs. I read some reviews on cnet stating that the color isn't as accurate on panasonic brands and sharps which have a higher price tag. While that is somewhat true, if you read the reviews from others, if you set the color right, then you won't have to worry about the color. Just follow what one reviewer put on here or go to cnet for the color accuracy. The profile for this tv is so thin and the bezel is almost non existent! My friend was wary that I went away from the samsung and lg tvs. I have read reviews from all over and they all say it is a good value and I must say that it's true! You not only get a quality HDTV but a bargain! I already have a friend thinking of buying one now becausehe saw how beautiful the picture was once we set the color following cnets settings! Can't recommend this tv more! If you're in the market for a tv at the one grand price range then I say go for it! Just know that spending too much on an HDTV now would be foolish anyways because the new wave of tvs like 4k or oled dispays are going to be the new generation of tvs. Of course since I do not have 27000 dollars for a 4k tv, spending a grand on this one with all it's features and picture quality, is a steal!! I hope this review helps

Reviews.Title: Video failed after 1 Month of use
Reviews.Author: Robert E Seter
Reviews.Content: I bought this same model TV from Walmart on Black Friday.  I started noticing the video and audio would be out of sink sometimes, but it seemed to be certain channels.  Then on December 27th the video just went out.  Tried unplugging the HDMI cable and reconnecting, nothing but sound still. I tried 2 other HDMI cables that worked fine on 2 other TVs I have and the same result.  After doing some reseach on the problem one of the boards has gone bad.  I am disappointed with Vizio for putting their name on this product.  I know I am not the only one that had this problem.  The only good thing I have to say about this experience is that Customer Service at my local Walmart did not give me a hassle about returning it on January 3rd.  If you bought one of these TVs throught Walmart between November 1st 2012 and December 24th 2012 and you are not wanting to deal with the warantee, you have until January 10th 2013 to return it to Walmart for a full refund or exchange (view Walmarts policy on returns online).

Reviews.Title: Straight badass TV
Reviews.Author: Srfnjoe
Reviews.Content: I purchase this tv at Sam because amazon was out at the time. Best TV for the price!! I had a 42 inch LCD before and this 60 inch LED Vizio blows it out of the water. Everyone that has seen it is in aah. The picture is amazing, and the look of the tv is stunning. My buddy that is all about electronics is jealous to the max. He has a 55 inch 3d sharp. After seeing my tv he is now in the market for a 65-70 inch tv.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck!...  But will need tweaking.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought my Vizio e601i-A3 at Costco for $759.  I like buying from Costco because of their vetting process, great return policy, and extra year warranty on most electronics (2 years instead of 1).From what I can tell, this model was launched in September of 2012 and had a few bugs for the first few months or so, but it looks like Vizio has worked them out and the models on shelves today are mostly fine...  Also, from what I have read, it looks like those who did have problems were taken care of by Vizio.A few months ago I bought a 55" JVC Black Sapphire from Costco for $679 and have been pretty happy with it and was planning to buy another for the den.  But when I got to Costco and saw the JVC and the Vizio next to each other, I couldn't help but notice how much more presence the 60" Vizio seemed to have over the 55" JVC for just $90 more...  So  I bought the Vizio.I am certainly not a huge technophile, but am pretty picky in general .  That being said, I think the picture quality of the Vizio  is excellent!  Not only that, but it is also highly adjustable and can be fine tuned to look it's best in it's environment.  There are a few preset picture modes, but I am sure you will find that adjusting the parameters inside those modes will yield noticeable changes that make sense.I was very impressed with the boxing...  The TV is completely protected in solid foam and is easily unpacked by releasing 4 cleverly designed latches on the bottom of the box which allow you to easily lift off the top.  (I also found that it is repacked just as easily... but more on that later.)Inside the box, the mounting base was neatly packed into grooves in the foam, as was the box containing the remote, mounting screws and power cord.  It does come with AAA batteries for the remote which is nice.The remote itself does feel a little cheap, but is perfectly functional and does have the handy QWERTY keyboard on back which makes entering information a little easier.  I do wish it was backlit, but for the price... who could complain?The TV itself is handsome and has a high end look.  The bezel is very thin, making this a sleek looking unit.  The bezel frame and mounting base are all black, offering a very clean look.  Upon powering up, it goes into a setup mode which is intuitive.  The startup time is pretty short.It has a few apps, but I only use Netflix.  Shows load very quickly with my cable internet.  The wifi receiver seems to be sensitive as it is showing full bars even though the TV is downstairs and the wifi transmitter is upstairs.There is one feature that this TV has that I hate, but can be disabled...  It is the auto adjust brightness feature that causes the screen to "blink" lighter and darker while watching.  It is meant to adjust the picture to best suit the ambient light in the room, but the adjustments are very noticeable, abrupt, and extremely annoying!  In fact, I called the "Costco Concierge" customer support line to see if there was something that could be done about it.  They could not explain why it was doing that because the help line worker had the wrong menu information for my model.  Since they could not tell me how to disable it,I assumed it was a bad unit out of the box and took it back to Costco for an exchange!I brought the second TV home and it did the same thing!  Ugh!  At this point, I was pretty disgusted that this feature could not be disabled, but I eventually figured it out and realized that the first TV was actually just fine.  The trick is that not only do you have to disable the auto brightness feature, but you also have to disable the brightness control in the advance menu.  After doing that, the issue went away.When I took the first TV back to Costco, I asked the lady at the returns counter if she saw many of these Vizios come back...  Her answer was "No...  But a lot of Samsungs do get returned with problems."  Interesting.Being a "bang for your buck" type guy, I could not imagine paying any more money for another set given the features and picture of this one!  It is well deserving of the overall rating it consistently gets of 4+ stars!

Reviews.Title: Fail for Netflix users
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: Great TV so far if you don't expect to use Netflix. Like many, many others, my Netflix app refuses to work.  The very first screen loads OK with the listing of the top half dozen or so most popular movies playing, but when I click the on-screen button to connect to Netflix the TV immediately provides a connection error and recommends me to Netflix's website slash tvhelp.  I've tried every recommendation on Vizio's website and the internet at large, including resetting the TV, the Yahoo apps, some CEC or something enabling/disabling. DNS changes, etc. Everything is a fail.  Since Netflix was one of the reasons I purchased the TV, this is a DOA issue for me. Kind of like having working sound on a TV. If it's advertised as doing it, but it doesn't, then it's unfit for its intended purpose.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality, Performance and Price
Reviews.Author: IssysDad
Reviews.Content: Great TV and features!  I sat in line for 6 hours on Black Friday 2012 and was 6th out of 20 to get this TV.  I got it home, out of the box and setup and was wowed by the impressive video quality.  At 52.5lbs, removal from the box is definitely a two person job.  The video quality is comparable to other units that I've paid thousands for.  True blacks, vivid colors and bright whites make watching my movie collection a blast!  With a thin flat glossy bezel that matches the base, the TV is ready for stand or wall-mount.  While on the base, the TV doesn't Pivot, which, in most scenarios isn't much of a loss.The built-in apps are just okay in my opinion, with some stutter or lag in the interface.  The apps are accessed by pressing the Vizio Internet Apps (VIA) button in the middle of the remote.  YouTube searches return a limited number of results with no option to load more.  Netflix and Hulu apps work okay, but I prefer the apps on my XBox 360 or Roku.  Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, and YouTube videos tend to buffer quite a bit using the built-in SmartApps.  Facebook and news apps also work well.  The Yahoo Widgets and available apps for download could use some diversity.  You also have a limited number of widgets/apps that can be installed at one time.  A built in USB media player works well for displaying photos and HD video loops or screensavers, or even movies (WMA/WMV/and some AVI/MPG).  I currently have this unit setup wired, but I've tried wireless as well.  Performance for me is basically the same on both.The built-in audio quality is quite good for a TV.  Two rear and two side HDMI ports, two USB ports and side located component/composite video inputs plus ethernet port, analog and digital audio inputs and VGA input provide plenty of connection options.  The remote control is a one-piece two sided unit that could use some improvement.  One side is a standard remote, while the flip-side is a QWERTY keyboard for typing text.  It feels solid and well built, however the small rubber buttons are not very sensitive, and aren't backlit.Getting the settings perfect for my environment and preferences took about 20-30 minutes with some HD source reference material.  Once set, the contrast and brightness work well and the colors are rich and vivid.  The 1920X1080 resolution and 120Hz refresh rate ensures optimal video and game quality.  Peripheral or off-axis viewing is also better than many comparable units.  This unit doesn't support 3D, but for us it's not really a big loss.When playing Video games, I noticed a perceptible "lag" where I would press my joystick and there would be small delay before my on-screen character moved.  I was dismayed and was worried that I'd have to take the TV back.  After some digging I found the solution to the problem.  First:  Switch to the input that the game console is located on.  2.  Press Menu >Picture> Picture Mode and change from 'standard' to 'game'.  3rd.  Press menu, choose the gear icon for 'settings'.  Move down to "Game Mode" selection and change from 'off' to 'On'.  Lag problem fixed.  It took me a few hours on forums to find out this undocumented fix.  Totally happy now!

Reviews.Title: Best cheap 60 inch gaming HDTV out there right now!
Reviews.Author: Brae L. Hulery "Braehole"
Reviews.Content: Not sure how many twitch gamers are looking at this TV but input lag time matters for FPS and online fighting games. This TV is the lowest (so far)for a 1k 60 inch HDTV in the great category at 31ms. Bad input lag means you or your kid will get shot before he sees it on the screen. Not fun for gaming if you have bad input lag, so if you or your kids play lots of games online check out these two sites to find a TV for both movies and gaming. Who wants buy a TV and not be able to use it for everything? Hope this helps you get your best bang for the buck! If you want an excellent category gaming TV get the Sony 55" KDL-55W802A at 17ms.With the new consoles coming towards the end of the year, marketing low input lag TVs and their gaming advantages could be a smart opportunity for a savvy TV manufacturer. I wonder if any manufacturer company guys look at these comments....[...][...]

Reviews.Title: Really good TV
Reviews.Author: Darkchylde "qdf1977"
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of research to get a new TV for my living room, my choices came down to the Panasonic 60" Plasma and the Vizio 60" LED-LCD TV. I chose this television. This review is based on my initial assessment of the television, as I've only had it for a day. I will update the review after some long term use.I chose the Vizio due to the fact that, even though the Panasonic was rated higher in terms of picture quality, unfortunately it only had 2 HDMI inputs. The Vizio has 4. Everything in my living room runs on HDMI (XBOX 360, Cable, and Blu-Ray), so that was a deal-breaker for me for the Panasonic. I read a lot of reviews for this Vizio and I bumped into a lot of complaints about the remote control failing and the screen going black after minimal use. Most of these reviews came from people who purchased earlier models. Vizio addressed this issue and let people know that models that had serial numbers "....WAN100... through ...WAN-800..." were susceptibe to failing, so when I purchased mine (at BJs Wholesale) I checked to see if the serial number was printed on the box. It was! I chose the television with the highest batch/serial number AWAY from the faulty ones, so I ended up getting a serial number in the range "...WAP300..." so I am confident I will not have a problem.Out of the box, I was quite impressed with how thin the set was, but I was also concerned at how small the base was. After installing the base, I found that it's pretty sturdy. It wobbles a bit when jumping around (I have the Kinect for the 360), but nothing that would have me concerned that it would tip over. The frame/bezel of the television is really thin, giving you more television screen (60.04" measured diagonally), but the downside to that is the speakers for the television are in back of the set. So if you don't have a surround sound system, the television sound will sound pretty cheesy. But I imagine that anyone in the market for a 60" TV probably has a good system in place.After connecting my cable, Xbox and Blu-Ray, I turned the TV on and it walks you through the setup which is really simple. MAKE SURE YOU CHOOSE "HOME USE" WHEN IT ASKS YOU. Your other choice is "Store". This tweaks all of the settings to give you the recommended store settings, which could be way too bright and sharp for your tastes. Choose home use and tweak your audio/video settings yourself. You can register your TV if you are connected to the internet via wi-fi or hard-wire. It was cool to use the QWERTY keyboard on the back of the remote control. There are a couple of bad things about the remote; The keyboard on the back of the remote doesn't include numbers, so if you have an email address and/or password with a mix of alpha-numeric characters, you'll get a little annoyed having to keep flipping the remote over to type in letters on one side, and numbers on the other. The other downside to the remote, is when you're using the keyboard you have to be careful because it's not bluetooth, and if you hold the remote too perpendicular to your body, it doesn't register your key presses. Not a huge deal, but it can be annoying for those who would do searches on the apps that come with/can be installed on the TV.Once the setup was done, and after some tweaking of the visuals, I must say that I was impressed. The picture quality was noticeably better than my 52" Sharp AQUOS LCD that it replaced. I wanted to see for myself about this "Soap Opera Effect" that is so polarizing with people. I turned on the Smoothing effect and turned it to the highest setting. I thought that it would be more annoying than it was. It did, in fact look like I was watching a soap opera on some shows, but my wife and I thought that it was pretty cool. To each his own. The good news is, you can turn it off if you prefer. We tested our Blu-Ray with a few different movies; Avatar, The Avengers and Finding Nemo. I must admit that, when watching Avatar, due to the smoothness of the motion and some of the shaky camera action, it was a little disorienting, but after a couple of minutes I got used to it. My wife even yelled, "Well, there. look. Sigourney Weaver is in my living room!" We tried The Avengers and Finding nemo afterwards and we were not disappointed. Absolutely beautiful. I'm sure that that there are TVs with a better picture quality, but not at this price-point and features.Some of you may have to adjust and/or your picture horizontally or vertically, which can be done in the menus, because the viewing area of the TV is larger than what the channel is projecting, so you may see a staticky digital bar on the edge(s) of your screen. Simple fix though, so don't panick.My only complaint about this TV is that you can notice some uniformity issues during pure black periods of viewing, like in between commercials, a pitch black room in a movie, etc. Certain areas of the screen look like a lighter shade of black than other areas. It doesn't bother me, but if you're used to plasma TVs and their near-perfect black levels, you'll probably find it a bother.Aside from a few little things, this TV is absolutely perfect for the price.

Reviews.Title: Love this T.V.
Reviews.Author: Grandma
Reviews.Content: It took us a long time to decide on a big screen TV but finally after much research we purchased the 60” VIZIO.  We held back writing this review just to be sure, so now after three months of use we are ready to say without hesitation  we would recommend this unit. Out of the box the picture quality is excellent but for the meticulous, just about every aspect of the picture and the audio can be customized.  One of the reviews on Amazon recommends the factory settings be changed for an even better viewing and listening experience. We have listed them here and would recommend you make the changes as well. The TV is light weight and has a very thin profile making it very easy to wall mount.  It has built in wireless and lots of apps. You can spend hours exploring all the applications, and you can add more. The remote has a full keyboard making surfing very easy.  Explore making the changes and you’ll see and hear the difference.  You can easily reset it back to the factory default settings if you want.PICTURE SETTINGS MENUPicture Mode - MovieBacklight -  53Brightness - 50Contrast - 75Color - 51Tint - 0Sharpness - 0SIZE & POSITION SUBMENUNo ChangeCOLOR TEMPERATURE SUBMENUColor temperature -  NormalRed Gain - 104Green Gain - 115Blue Gain - 130Red Offset - 129Green Offset - 130Blue Offset - 132ADVANCED PICTURE SUBMENUSmooth motion effect - OffReal Cinema Mode - Smooth [grayed out]Noise Reduction - OffMPEG NR - OffColor Enhancement - OffAdaptive Luma - OffFilm Mode - AutoBacklight Control - OffAmbient Light sensor - Off

Reviews.Title: Great for the price, but. . .
Reviews.Author: Cameron Gordon
Reviews.Content: This is the third Vizio I have purchased and never had a problem until now.I purchased this item just before the Super Bowl for a spectacular price and could hardly wait the 3 days until it was arrived. It was delivered on time, for free, and the drivers were helpful and professional. They informed me I would be unable to test my new TV until it came up to room temperature (3-5 hours)as it was winter in Chicago and the cold truck was below the ideal operating temperature. After a brief Google search I discovered that, sadly, they were right and I would have to wait to use it. Even powered off the TV looks great. Slim, sleek and shiny.When it finally came time, I turned on the screen and after a few minor adjustments, I was amazed by the picture quality. (A personal suggestion, turn off the "smooth motion setting" it creates a bizarre soap opera effect on everything.) Set-up was a breeze. Wi-Fi, digital cable, PlayStation and receiver were working together in no time. The included apps (Netflix, Amazon, etc.) run a little less smoothly than they do on my PS3 but they're not terrible and the included QWERTY keypad on the back of the remote makes the interface more enjoyable. There are 4 HDMI ports (more than most other 60') and you can name each of them on the TV so switching between inputs is super easy. The menu is not as intuitive as I would like but after you get used to it, navigating the settings is simple enough.There was one MAJOR problem, however. Once a day, at random intervals, the TV would just power down. It would always turn back on from the remote but, obviously, it was a nuisance. It happened across every type of use. Cable, PlayStation, native applications, everything. I tried a factory reset, changed outlets, surge protectors, and any settings having to do with power. No dice. I searched the internet and discovered that, although this was not a common problem, it was not unheard of. Many people had theories as to why this was happening, and suggestions on how to fix it, none of which worked.Realizing I was going to be unable to solve this problem myself, I emailed Vizio directly with a description of the problem. The next day they told me to contact Customer Service by phone. That annoyed me because I hate talking on the phone but, whatever. I called and spoke to an unbelievably friendly and helpful woman named Sandy who was in South Dakota. It was refreshing to speak with someone who not only spoke English but was pleasant and knowledgeable as well. I honestly cannot remember the last time I enjoyed dealing with a Customer Service Representative. She apologized, told me that Vizio was aware of the problem and that they would FedEx a new board to a local repair shop who would contact me to set up an in home appointment and take care of the problem.To my surprise, I was contacted that night by the repairman and informed that the service request was made and the part should arrive in 2 days. As promised he called back when he had the part and scheduled a time the very next day to stop by. The repair man arrived within the scheduled window, was polite and professional and in 15 minutes he was done.Since then, 2 weeks ago, I have had zero issues with my TV. I could not be more impressed with the way Vizio and the people they used, handled the situation. Although, obviously, I wish I had never encountered the problem in the first place, Vizio really showed me that they are a reliable company who stands behind their product and I will certainly buy from them again, when the time comes.

Reviews.Title: This TV rocks
Reviews.Author: BRUCE
Reviews.Content: I am thrilled to write this review, the Smart HDTV Vizio E60 60 inch LED TV is a powerhouse of a television.Built for the teckie in mind the TV is rich in features and apps. The Yahoo driven app platform gives the user a host of streaming internet content to enjoy.Let us start with the picture quality. The Vizio Smart HDTV E60 60 inch LED TV delivers a crisp display with vibrant colors and deep blacks. The 120Hz effective refresh rate and "smooth motion" projects a lifelike picture. Media from Netflix, Xfinity and played via the TV's USB port all looked stunning.The Vizio Smart HDTV E60 has Netflix, Hulu, YouTube and Crackle build in among other apps. If you are looking to deliver content to the Vizio Smart HDTV E60 via other methods it is more than easy.The Vizio Smart HDTV E60 is loaded with input options, four HDMI inputs, a component input for you old school folks, a VGA input for your PC and 2 USB ports. The USB ports automatically recognize music, photo, and movie media.  As I said earlier, playing a movie from a thumb drive looked spectacular. Even Netflix delivered from my Motorola Droid via mini HDMI cable looked decent. There is also an ethernet input allowing you to connect to your home network, a lightning fast wireless connection is also an option.The sound on the Vizio Smart HDTV E60 is not mind-blowing. While it is good enough for sports and TV shows, I found it lacking for concert video and music. There is a companion sound bar available for just under $200, though it really is not necessary. I would imagine anyone buying a 60-inch TV would be pairing it with a home theater system. The Vizio Smart HDTV E60 connects to your theater system via digital audio out (SPDIF) or analog RCA.The Vizio Smart HDTV E60 is becoming the number one purchased television in America. It is feature rich and smartly priced - I see this TV being a consumer favorite for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Blown Away!!!!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I am completely blown away by this television! I purchased it yesterday from Best Buy for $899 and I have been more than pleased with my purchase. The television looks even better at home than it does in the store. While at Best Buy I spent a lot of time going back and forth between the Vizio, Samsung, and the Sharp and the Vizio seemed to offer the best reviews as well as the cheapest price. While the Samsung smart tv might be appealing to the eye, it had the poorest reviews which is surprising for a television that costs $3k and up.I bought my first Vizio 32" about 6 years ago and still have it in one of my guest bedrooms. It still work the same as the day I opened it, so I decided to consider the same brand when looking for a 60". Overall I would have to say that I am more than satisfied with this tv.As far as screen quality and adjustments, I utilized the review provided on here by Kris and the picture quality is amazing. I however like that "soap opera" look so I do leave that feature on. Easy to turn off though.Also, make sure that your cable box is set to 1080p or 1080i. I forgot to check this until the next day and now the picture is even better!!The only con that I have found with this tv as of now is that the MGo feature does not work. Not sure really what it even is for, but a little obnoxious that there is a permanent button on the remote that will not do anything for who knows how long.And one more thing, I am pretty disappointed that the remote cannot be paired with any of my other devices such as my home theater system or even my cable box. So unfortunately, unless you want to lose the Qwerty remote, you gave to get used to using two or more different remotes. Of course it could be worse, but in my opinion a simple fix that they could have made in order for the customer to be completely satisfied with their purchase.Overall I would definitely recommend this television to anyone!

Reviews.Title: TV vastly exceeded expectations
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: We spent a long time deciding on a TV.  Ideally, we wanted a 65" 3D LED, but decided that the LED was the most important of these 3 and bought this at half the cost of a 65" 3D LED.  We figured we were primarily buying a size upgrade, but not much in the way of features.  This TV vastly exceeded my expectations.  With animated blurays like Harry Potter, Brave, or Lion King, my wife at first did not believe that the TV was not 3D even without glasses.  Even broadcast TV seems to have more depth.  Sometimes it feels like we are in the scene.  I am certainly not a videophile, but we are very happy with this decision.

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: Michael F. "Audio Guy"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 04/08/2013:I'm updating my review to 5-Stars because the issues I describe below seem to have subsided... every once in a while I think the A/V is slightly out of sync, but simply power cycling the television seems to fix it.AT the end of the day, I can't say enough. I could not have afforded a 60" LED Smart TV were it not for this Vizio... I really do love it.---------------------------------------------------Original Review (December, 2012):I really like this TV overall; for the price, it's tough to beat.However, there is an issue with audio and video getting out of sync by as much as a full second.  I called Vizio tech support and was told that this is a known issue for which they are releasing a firmware update."Great, how can I get this update?" I ask."We're pushing it out in batches of 1,000 at a time so as not to crash the server.  But we sold over 100,000 units on Black Friday alone, so I can't tell you how long it will be before you get it.""Oh, ok," I said.  "Can I just download the update via your website and install it myself?""No, sorry; it's not available that way."So, basically, Vizio knows there is an issue (a pretty major one, too), but they won't even make the firmware update available for manual install.  The TV will go to five-stars when this issue is corrected, but who knows how long that will take.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: poison
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV about a month ago.  Everything worked fine out of the box, easy setup.  I should note that I'm not a major cinephile or audiophile, just an average user who watches about 2 hours a day between me and the wife...but for us the picture is great.I used some picture settings from CNET that I found online and they seem to make a really good picture.  If you were inclined to use a video tuning DVD you could probably get it down to near perfect, but honestly I can't really tell that much of a difference anyway and it isn't worth my time.  When it turns on, it shows a black screen with the Vizio logo...from that screen you see that the blacks aren't 100% uniform, but I still think the picture is fine and my wife gave me a crazy look when I pointed it out.We use it for cable television, netflix, and dvds mostly. We just moved into a new house and wanted a bigger television for the living room. The Netflix app works great for us over a standard wifi connection with WPA2.  The youtube app works fine as well.  We don't really use the other apps that came with it so I can't really comment.  The remote with QWERTY keyboard works very well and is useful for searching movies and clips on youtube.We use an LG speakerbar with a wireless sub, so I can't really comment on the speakers at-length, but they seemed fine for a normal size living room when compared to other built-in speakers I've used.  If you're an average user who wants a good quality 60 inch TV at a reasonable price with built in netflix, amazon prime, and youtube you won't be disappointed.  If you're the over-the-top home theater keeping-up-with-the-Jones' type who wants a picture that is top of the line and has 3000 pixels per molecule, then this obviously isn't for you.  For our uses we are very happy with this purchase and would purchase it again.  I think it is a great smart television for the average user and sits at a nice price point.

Reviews.Title: Great 60 inch TV but not perfect...
Reviews.Author: TripMaker
Reviews.Content: So the TV arrived as scheduled, two delivery folks un boxed it, plugged it in and we made sure it turned on and the remote worked, that's pretty much all they will do. So the TV has a very good picture once you make the adjustments some other reviewer posted here. Wifi setup was pretty easy and seems to stay connected.. Netfix, Amazon Prime and You Tube seem to work quite well, but for some reason Hulu playback will stutter at times, not sure whats up with that, the Roku box and PS3 which are right next to the TV on the same wifi network never stutter on Hulu. The other issue I ran into was lip sync issue .. audio would get out of sync after about 2 hrs or so .. if you changed the channel and came back it was ok again for 1-2 hrs.. I was getting ready to send it back then decided to take the TWC DVR box off of it and use one of my other TWC HD boxes on it.. strangely the lip sync issue seems to have stopped.Currently I purchased a TIVo Premiere box and have not seen the lip sync issue so I have decided to keep it, but I see I have till Jan 31 st 2013 to return it, just in case.One more thing if you are watching the tv pretty much straight on the picture like I said is very good, but as you start viewing it from an angle the picture starts looking washed out, it does not have even remotely as good side view as the Plasma it replaced.. so something to keep in mind.I was not one of the lucky ones to get it at the Black Friday price, but it was 949.00 for  like two hours and did get it at that price, which compared to other smart 60 inch TV's is a pretty good price.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Marion Strong
Reviews.Content: recieved on 12-05-2012................hooked up 12-07-2012....................Quit working 12-27-2012. I have older tv's that are 20 yrs old that still work. What a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: went out ,but fast replacment
Reviews.Author: tracey edwards
Reviews.Content: bought the tv on black friday ,and on jan 20 the video just went out,called vizio and they said it was a light or something went out,so they swapped it out for a brand new one in less then a week,i love the tv i think for the price its great picture,and sounds good to im not a big tv guru so my standards are probly not the same as a tv fanatic but for the avgerage person this tv is good.just hoping not to have it go out again ,only downfall to my experiance ,scents i have had a vizio 42 720 plasma thats 6 years old and never had one problem.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Hertzler
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I preordered this product before it even shipped to Amazon, and got it ten days after we ordered it. The picture quality is unbelievable, along with the fantastic sound quality. The movement is very fluid and can take some getting used to because the quality is so brilliant. It even brings to life movies that were made decades ago. Blu-Ray looks beautiful, as well. The remote is very cool, and I love how you can just pop up Netflix whenever you feel like it. The edges of the TV are razor sharp and clean. Our living room has a lot of natural light and the picture adjusts beautifully...no glare. All in all, it's a beautiful TV and great entertainment piece. It even has a feature that isn't even available yet!

Reviews.Title: Exceptional value and quality
Reviews.Author: Pharmboy
Reviews.Content: This is the first TV I've every bought without looking at it first.  Walmart had for the same price but added sales tax and took two weeks.  Bought via Amazon Prime, so paid $0 shipping and received it 3 biz days after ordering.  We picked it up at the docks, since they can only give you a "range" for delivery, and that will vary depending on local truck line delivering, which isn't Amazon's fault.  I own two 42" Vizio TVs so trusted the brand enough to order sight unseen.  I use it 60% as a computer monitor in the LR, the rest for watching cable TV.The picture quality if flat out amazing.  Blacks are blacker than regular LCD, the color depth and saturation was perfect out of the box.  Works great with Amazon Prime free videos and Netflicks with easy setup.  DVDs look real like you are a part of the picture, with lifelike color and brightness.  The only think I noticed is that you see more artifacts with YouTube videos simple because the screen is so large, so flaws in the video are more obvious.Remote is quite good, with a keyboard on the back that doesn't get in the way.  Much more intuitive than previous remotes.  Setup and menu functions are WAY more intuitive.  Renaming the HDMI inputs as "Cable TV" and "PC" were simple and fast.  The whole menu system is an overlay to the TV, significantly faster and easier than just a couple years ago.  From the time I plugged it in to the time I was watching TV and using the computer was literally just a couple of minutes.  Using HDMI for both the cable box and the PC.  Speakers in the TV are much better than the 42" Vizio TVs I currently have, much broader output, less tinny.  Not great, but good and anyone that is an audiophile will have a full audio system anyway.  All and all, an exceptional value for the money.Follow up:Had for a while now, still love it as much as I did the first day.  The image quality is simply amazing.  Much easier to use menus, image quality is like looking through a window at the actual people.  Very happy I made this purchase.  Built in Netflix and Amazon Prime is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Good TV at amazing price
Reviews.Author: dsamuel
Reviews.Content: I got this TV from amazon. If you are looking for a Tv at great price, this is the TV for you. The display is really nice. Follow the CNET TV setting, you would get stunning picture. The apps are really good. It has DLNA, to play your home video content from your laptop or desktop wirelessly. The uniformity might be a small issue with this TV for some people, but understand that its a Edge-lit TV.

Reviews.Title: Great 60" LED TV except the 26 lines going across the top of the screen
Reviews.Author: T.M. Tolkien
Reviews.Content: I love Vizio LCD-LED TVs. I have two of them now, a 42" and 47" and they work great for dvd, gaming and pc office work. When I saw this 60" for under $1,000.00 I thought great!  I got it through Walmart as Amazon was out of it at the time.  I brought it home set it all up and it had a great picture and everything worked great.  Unfortunately, there where 26 thin lines going across the top part of the screen.  No matter if I was watching from my dvd player or computer they were there.  I kept it on for awhile thinking they might disappear, but they did not.  I turned on and off  several times thinking they might disappear, but no. I returned it to Walmart with a heavy heart. I might have just gotten a bad unit. I think I'll wait to see more reviews before trying to get another one.

Reviews.Title: Lipsync issues, then stopped turning on within a week
Reviews.Author: Jason Stokes
Reviews.Content: We purchased this a couple weeks ago, and got it from the excellent Ceva delivery service Amazon uses. After unboxing it and setting it up on the wall - very nice TV. It had great picture quality, little light bleed, and the imbedded Netflix app worked very well. The sound is a problem - constant lipsync issues with Time Warner cable and Netflix both - these are fixed by the lip sync timing function on the TV, but it's very frustrating to have to do that a couple times a week.Worse, less than a week after setup, it has stopped working and will not turn on at all. We've tried plugging and unplugging it multiple times, different wall sockets, the remote and the physical buttons, and it just wouldn't work. It's going back now.Pros:- Great picture quality, good blacks, little light bleed, etc. I was impressed, especially for the price.- Imbedded Netflix and Amazon apps work well- Thin bezel along with a thin TV gives it a stellar look against the wall. Very happy with that.Cons:- Lipsync issues. Ugh, I've never had this problem with a TV before and it was remarkably annoying. I'm very sensitive to this and it bothered me a lot.- No options for other apps to download- Weak DLNA function crashed frequently when grabbing items from my NAS. It couldn't handle the hundreds of videos on there, it seems.- Worst, it broke within a week. I have no desire to work with Vizio tech support to try to get it fixed - we went and got another TV instead.

Reviews.Title: Same problem....
Reviews.Author: Jessica M. Otteson
Reviews.Content: Sadly we have had our tv just over a month and are now experiencing the same problems many other reviewers have reported.Turned the tv on today and the backlight and sound work but there is NO picture.  We live in a very rural area and have a warranty through squaretrade I will be inquiring upon tomorrow.  I will update as soon as I know what is happening.  I would definitely consider the negative reviews before purchasing this TV.We did enjoy the size and the picture was decent.  I did not like how slow the remote was with the tv apps.

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY ANYTHING FROM TIGERDIRECT.COM OR VIZIO
Reviews.Author: DavidC
Reviews.Content: We received our tv today, 05/08/2014. We put it together, set it up, turned it on, and there's a dot on the upper left hand side of the screen. We called tigerdirect.com, who told us to call Vizio. When we called Vizio, they told us to we had to take 2 pictures of the tv and send a copy of the invoice. That's understandable. What I can't understand is what they told me next. They said they would look at the pictures and the invoice to see if this was something covered under the warranty. Seriously? I just got it today, not 3 months ago. This has been a nightmare, and I will NEVER deal with these people again!!!

Reviews.Title: does not currently work with amazon instant video and has a firmware issue
Reviews.Author: SM123
Reviews.Content: I purchased this two days ago and already experienced problems with two items: ) Amazon Instant Video does not work, it gives an error message "The Amazon Instant Video application is currently unavailable while we are working hard to bring you an updated, feature rich, application. For more details, please visit ...amazon web site...". I called Vizio and they told me to call Amazon, which I would think if they advertise the TV to be Amazon compatible, then they should manage the relationship and technical issues between Vizio and Amazon, not me! I called Amazon, and they told me I could try returning the TV and buying a new one 2) the online manual does not work, it only shows chapter titles. Vizio told me it would be fixed in a future firmware update.

Reviews.Title: 1 year, 2 months later - we have dead pixels.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: 2 months over the 1 year warranty, and we have a line of dead red pixels going across our TV. We contacted Vizio who said they could offer us a refurbished 55-inch TV for $550! The same TV on the Vizio website for $40 less! They also want us to ship back our 60-inch TV - probably so they can fix it and refurbished it and make money off of it. Completely ridiculous! I wouldn't pay another dime to Vizio. I'll never buy another product from this company again.

Reviews.Title: Not as crisp as i expected
Reviews.Author: jack wood
Reviews.Content: It is a very soft picture.  I have gone online and found several different methods for calibrating and none seem to give it a crisp picture.  The blacks are an almost washed out look not at all stark.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've Ever Owned
Reviews.Author: Puck the dog
Reviews.Content: Love this TV. App startup response is a little slow but that's a pretty minor concern. Once up, they work fast and seamlessly. You can control the YouTube app from your phone, which is pretty cool. I've also used Netflix a ton and Amazon streaming. Never had any freezing or stuttering. I have it plugged directly into the internet so I can't speak for the wireless connection. The sound is way better than I expected for this price. I have a surround sound system but usually don't feel the need to turn it on unless I want to crank a concert. I'm not a TV geek but the picture looks pretty dang sweet to me. When I got this, it was cheaper than any other set of this size with these features, so I'm very happy with this for the first month I've had it. The remote has a full keyboard on one side and has excellent range.

Reviews.Title: died after 10 months
Reviews.Author: Peoria AZ
Reviews.Content: Vizio has an open recall for a computer board inside these TVs - confirmed on the 60" 70" models.  Of the two I purchased, one went in a bedroom, one in the living room.  The TV in the bedroom was used the most - typically use computers in the living room.Blue screen this morning - no response from the remote.  Called Vizio - they confirmed that an issues exists.  Asked if I had proof pot purchase, I said yes.  Vizio says we will replace the TV.  Sounds good.Sent proof of purchase from Amazon's Amazon Warehouse Deals.  Vizio now says I must pay $75 for a repair and have a 90 days warranty on the TV.  Ouch.So I am awaiting the death of my other 60" Vizio TV and another $75 repair cost.  Never had a TV die in 35 years....suppose I Was due for a dead TV on the most expensive TVs ever purchased.Lesson learned?  Warehouse deals may be warehouse duds.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding picture, so easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Shawna Whiteaker
Reviews.Content: I bought the VIZIO E601i-A3 60-inch 1080p 120Hz Razor LED Smart HDTV (thought I'd include that bit as so many of the reviews were written for various sizes/models)  It took two of us to remove this huge TV from the boxes, but only took us about 10 minutes to completely set it up on it's stand (will have it mounted on the wall later this week).  My daughter had it calibrated and had checked out the Wi Fi connection for Netflicks within another 10 and we were watching a movie 20 minutes after we opened the boxes.  The picture is stunning and it's really easy for even a non tech savy person to change the settings.  I'll be sure to update if there are any problems in the future, but right now I am a VERY happy camper. :DOh, and Amazon included 1 month of free tech support and Square Trade offers a discounted tech support for set up.  Haven't needed either, but it's really great to know I'd have had help if I'd needed it.  Man, I lLOVE Amazon!!  :D  They've been so great with all the electronic stuff I've bought over the last few years, I won't buy them from anybody else now.  You just have to make sure the item is fulfilled and shipped by Amazon.  Happy Christmas, all you Amazon shoppers out there! lol

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Dillon M. Rice
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for less than $700 with amazon's lightning deals. All of the problems in the other 3-4 star reviews are present with the addition of one major issue. The processor for the "Smart tv" sucks. I run this through my computer with a mid grade video card and therefore I have little to no problems with the resolution or frame rate, but when I run Hulu, netflix, amazon instant video through the smart TV the frame rate and the processor lag sometimes.All and all, its a pretty good deal, but I expect I will have to replace it within a few years.

Reviews.Title: GOOD BUY
Reviews.Author: joe eldridge
Reviews.Content: EASY SETUP BUT TAKE TWO PEOPLE TO POSITION IT  DUE TO IT BEING SO LARGE.  IT IS EVERYTHING THAT I EXPECTED

Reviews.Title: What I expected
Reviews.Author: dominick austin
Reviews.Content: I was looking for value and had bought Vizio products before so I bought with confidence... I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Vizio makes a great TV
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I just got this 60 inch TV by Vizio. The picture quality is excellent. I usually use Samsung TVs because their picture is so good, but this TV is just as good. I like the way it changes channels much quicker than the Samsung also. The Smart TV feature is very well done. Netflix comes up with one button push and all of the Internet videos and YouTube are very easy to watch.you can even search through Internet programs while watching the TV.

Reviews.Title: it stopped working after only 4 months of very limited use !
Reviews.Author: Pamela J. Ray
Reviews.Content: I had this installed on the wall now I have to get someone to help me get it down so I can find the serial number on the back and contact vizio this tv was working great and I only used it for a short while everyday but it now has a black screen and will not work. I am going to contact vizio and pray it has a warranty but I know I would not buy this brand ever again.

Reviews.Title: No 3D Was Actually an Incentive!
Reviews.Author: MikeyrInKY "Mike"
Reviews.Content: This is arguably the best entry level 60" Smart LED/LCD HDTV on the market. Amazon sold me this great TV for less than a grand. The performance has been spectacular. I expected the HD content to look good and it has not disappointed, but the surprise is how well it does with SD content. I was unimpressed by all the 3D flat screens I've seen. In fact, one of them made me nauseated. As far as I'm concerned, no 3D was a plus!After winning a 40% off coupon from Square Trade, I got a 4 year warranty for about a hundred bucks. Now I have worry free enjoyment of my big screen tv.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E601i-A3 60-inch 1080p 120Hz Razor LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Shannon M. Sanders
Reviews.Content: this television is awesome love the remote with qwerty key board on the back side only flaw is the base of the tv and remote doesn't light up at night picture quality is fantastic had a plasma tv prior to this purchase and it looks just as good.

Reviews.Title: Fourth Vizio HDTV
Reviews.Author: E. Treants "tree"
Reviews.Content: TV Weighs less than 50 lbs so wall mounting was a breeze.just as well asWhy do you buy a TV?  For me it comes down to one word - Picture.  And this TV really does deliver in that category.  I always though I had a great Picture in 1080i and I did.  BUT this TV has 1080p and that is a world apart as far as clarity and wow!  The TV does not support 480i, but will support and switch automatically into 480p, 720p, 1080i and 1080p.  The biggest problem here is that knowing 1080p is out there, I have a really hard time watching some channels (networks) that are not broadcasting in the highest quality HD signals available.Sound - hey this is not my Bose Wave Radio/CD player.  It is a TV and has sound dependent on different broadcasters.  The built in Surround System does a very good job, but is not an Audiophile's dream system.  I can enjoy the sound of the Tenners on PBS just as well as Football or Wrecks at NASCAR.  If you want a better sound system, they are all over the place, invest in one, but this is more than adequate in my opinion.Internet Access:  Sure does have it and it works fine.  Speed of access is dependent only on the speed of your connection.  Mine buzzes right along and internet access is a lot faster than Direct TV.  Not as many "wait while buffering" messages.  In fact none while using internet access.Remote Control:  Really must have to access internet functions.  Cannot use to control Direct TV, so you will still have to have at least 2 remotes.  Backside of remote is QWERTY and used to enter information at times, not really that great but looks nice, can use the front just as well with a little more movement of keys.Last: Picture one more time.  Really Great Picture and REALLY BIG.  Went from 42 inch to 60 inch and it is a world of difference.

Reviews.Title: Problems
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: I bought my Vizio 60" E601i-A3 about a month ago. Since then I have stated to experience problems with turning it "on or off." Twice I have had to unplug it from behind to get it to turn off. Neither the remote or manual button worked. Also a couple of times it would not turn "on" until many tries. Also, while thinking I was gettting a good price thru Amazon, this was not true. Walmart, Target & K-Mart, all were selling for a $100 or more cheaper. Got caught with my shorts down on this one.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 60" LED Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Umpire.20
Reviews.Content: Purchase & Pricing –I purchased my TV on 11/21 and it was in stock.  Although I wasn’t able to get a Black Friday type price, Amazon did have a brief price change on their site.  It went from high to lower and back to high again.  I contacted Amazon asking about their price-matching because I saw a lower price at a “discount club”.  Initially the rep said I did not qualify since they (Amazon) had to add the “club membership of $40.00” to the club price.  That would have brought it back very close to Amazon’s price.  We hung up the call and within 2 minutes the rep called me back.  He realized that Amazon had made the price change I mentioned above and said I DID qualify.  He issued a credit to my account which was reflected within 24 hours.  I also got Amazon’s 2% bonus credited to me “for use on a future purchase”.  Shipping & Delivery –As an Amazon Prime subscriber I was offered delivery on 11/28.  Since Amazon also offered “white glove” delivery, with a scheduled date & time, I opted for it.  My TV was delivered on 12/1.  Although the delivery was about 1 hour late, I was still satisfied with it.  Sound –I was OK with the sound from the TV speakers but I certainly recognize that there are MANY better options.  Having them rear-facing dampens whatever comes out of them.  As a result, I added a sound bar to my setup.  I am using the Vizio SB4021M-A1.  It requires one optical connection and a power connection.  Now everything sounds GREAT.  Wall Mount –I opted for a wall mount from Monoprice(dot)com (less than $30.00).  It is a flush mount which can tilt some 15*.  With the TV mounted the front bezel is 4 inches from the wall.  The mount is “PID 4174” and is described as  “PREMIUM Adjustable Tilting 2.5mm Wall Mount Bracket for LCD LED Plasma (Max 165Lbs, 30~63inch) BLACK” on the web site.  This is one sturdy mount.  With a little help from the Mrs. it was installed & TV hanging in about 45 minutes.  Picture --I, like most users of this TV have played with the picture settings to obtain those which are ideal to me.  I have mine set pretty well, but I am still experimenting with them.  The quality of the picture and the colors etc. are just GREAT.  I’ve heard many people complain about theirs, but mine are all anyone could ask for.  Accessories --I have a Vizio sound bar model SB4021M-A1 attached.  I also have a Samsung Blu-Ray Disc/DVD Player model BD-EM57C attached to my TV.  I opted to use HDMI ports 3 and 4 for my connections.  (Some people had difficulty using HDMI 1 due to its ARC feature and they thought it was possibly their lip sync problem too).  Issues –Many people have complained about getting the BSOD (black screen of death) which led to repairs and or replacement of the TV.  I have not had such an encounter.I have had a minimal amount of lip sync, but the more I watch and pay attention, it appears to be a particular program on a particular network rather than a TV issue.  As a result, I have no complaint.The VIA bar (access to the SMART features) leaves a bit desired.  However, I didn't buy this TV to use it as a computer.  I've had no issues with any of the apps within the VIA bar, e.g. NETFLIX and others.  Conclusion –I would definitely recommend this TV to anyone looking for a 60” flat screen.  This TV replaced a Samsung 56” DLP set that was about 7 years old.  The picture quality is hands down better on the Vizio than it was on the Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Best 60" for the price!
Reviews.Author: R. B. Duncan
Reviews.Content: If you're an average TV enthusiast like me, then you don't need to pay $1500 or more for a 60" flat-screen.  This 120Hz Smart TV gives you a great picture, features like Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc., and a relatively thin frame for less than $900 (sometimes).  I got if for $888.  There isn't any other 60" with these features and quality for anywhere near that price.  Sure, if you want 3D or other high-priced features then this isn't the model for you, but if you just want to watch a nice large TV, you can't go wrong.  The bezel of this TV is thin as well as the depth.  Plenty of menu options to adjust the picture to your desired output.

Reviews.Title: This Set Is Awesome! Awesome! Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Hackman
Reviews.Content: UPDATED 04/15/2013 - I can not say enough great things about this TV set. I have now had this TV for over 2 months and can honestly say that I could not have a better picture if I would have paid 3 times the price! I do feel that your satisfaction with this unit is dependent on correct adjustment of the picture settings.  Below you will see my overall settings that I placed for the Vivid Mode:---Picture settings menu---Picture Mode: VividBacklight: 100Brightness: 19Contrast: 74Color: 59Tint: 0Sharpness: 14---Size & Position submenu---[no change]---Color Temperature submenu---Colour temperature: NormalRed Gain: 92Green Gain: 101Blue gain: 128Red offset: 128Green offset: 128Blue offset: 128--Advanced Picture submenu---Smooth motion effect: HighReal Cinema Mode: SmoothNoise Reduction: lowMPEG NR: LowColor Enhancement: Rich ColorAdaptive Luma: MediumFilm Mode: AutoBacklight Control: DCRAmbient Light sensor: OffLet me know what you think!Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money. . .
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Let me say straight off, I bought this locally and not from Amazon.  There was no difference in price and I wanted to see the floor model before I bought. But I like the Amazon user reviews, this is my 'go-to' site for user reviews so I want to contribute my experience with this TV.The 60 inch screen is BIG! Not TOO big, mind you, but big enough, and we have a large family room, I think. I'm glad I let my wife talk me out of that 70 inch screen.  It would have overpowered that room. I suspect you won't see many TVs much larger than 70 inches in size in the future, I can't imagine a room in a typical family home that could handle such a screen.  Remember, they look a lot smaller in the showroom! It replaced an old 48 inch 1st gen Panasonic rear projection HD TV that was showing its age (but was plenty big screen wise)Image quality and color is REALLY good, and I have not noticed the narrow angle of view issue that many reviews refer to and I think we have a wide viewing angle in our family room. Image quality is good EVEN when using 75 ohmn coax, IQ with the composite cables are at least as good as with coax.  We have digital, but not HD cable service, so I guess we get our signal in at 480p from cable, but the image is excellent, better than the old Panny.From other user reviews, I had done my research and was prepared to make the needed adjustments that would take care of any lip synch issues I might encounter.  However, I didn't have any lip synch problems.  I wonder if that issue is related to a certain brand or type of cable box.Netflix and Amazon have dedicated buttons on the remote so using them is EASY.  Netflix comes in at 720p as always, and the image is amazing on this TV. I don't use Amazon prime.Regarding the remote, it's pretty cool.  On one side, it is a standard remote with dedicated Netlix and Amazon buttons on the front, and on the flip side,it has a full QUERTY Chicklet type keyboard. On the keyboard side, there are also some gaming type control buttons.  You can download games from the app store (run by Yahoo on behalf of Vizio).  Other apps include Crackle, Hulu+, Vudu, etc. Pretty much similar in variety and in operation to the Roku store. More on this in a bit.The sound is typical tiny and tinny tv sound.  But in defense, the bezel (the frame) around the screen is only about 1/2 inch wide and an inch or so deep, not a lot of space for room filling speakers.  I think we will buy a sound bar for this set eventually.  But I have some spare higher quality PC speakers, in the meantime, I will look into hooking them up.Edit 1/15/13:I've tried to hook up my computer speakers to this TV only to discover that there is no 3.5 mm mini-plug outlet.  There are 2 RCA audio connections on the back and theoretically you can get a converter that converts to a female mini-plug, but Best Buy and HH Greg don't seem to carry them.  I guess I could order from Amazon or other internet vendor, but it seems kind of crazy to pay all that shipping if you don't have other things to buy.  I'll try Radio Shack across town later today.Major problem? No, but a bit of a pain, yes.  The 3.5 mini-plug socket should be part of any device with audio, in my mind.End of Edit:Set up was kind of odd. My Comcast cable box is considered an antenna source if using 75 ohm coax, but a cable connection if using composite cables on the same cable box. (My Comcast Cable box doesn't have HDMI).  The directions could have been clearer on this.I think the User Interface for set up is kind of complex and not very intuitive. I think it could be easier to use. As I said earlier, you have the ability to download apps to the TV from Yahoo even a few games and special Yahoo content apps, however that process seems kind of hidden.  Once you get to it, it works great and it's easy, but getting there is a tad difficult.  That being said, it is unlikely a child would accidentally get there and download something you don't want on your set.The wireless internet connectivity works pretty well.  My wireless router is about 40 feet away on the same floor as the TV.  Set up was relatively easy, but the TV set could be a little better in telling you the status of your connection. I had connected to my router on the first try, but hadn't realized it.  So I kept trying to complete the connection and it kept telling me that all it could find were my neighbor's networks.  Finally I realized it also kept telling me that the network I was on might be a bit slow.  (It isn't, trust me, this, I know) So I tried to get on to Netflix, and son of a gun! it worked!All the confusion aside, once you get the TV set up the way you like, the day to day operation is pretty straight forward and not difficult to use. But getting there could be easier.  Vizio needs to work on the out of box user experience I think.I feel I got a lot for my money, and I would buy it again.  If the users are tech savvy, then they should not hesitate to buy this TV.  But if the users need help setting up a regular tv then they will need someone to help them set this TV up for sure.  But like I said earlier, the day to day operation is pretty easy.  Even grandma should be able to use the set day to day (and even use Netflix and Amazon Prime!)I'm a happy camper with a HUGE TV.

Reviews.Title: Best deal for a TV this size and quality!
Reviews.Author: Jeff Reyes
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television for my parents as a Christmas present.  First off shipping was a breeze and the delivery men even set the TV up for my parents. The size and clarity of the picture are amazing for this price point.  I would recommend this TV for anyone looking to enjoy high definition at a fraction of the cost of a "big box" brand.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E6011-A3 60" T. V. 1080p  120Hz Razor LED smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Barbara C. Meredith
Reviews.Content: We really love this T.V.  The picture is so clear & bright that you can tell the color of everyone's eyes and background items clearly.  We ordered this T. V. through Amazon.com and were unsure as to what we would be getting.  We did not see this item in person, but heard that Vizio had a great clear picture, so we ordered it because it was on sale at Amazon.com.  Our order went right through and Amazon responded to our order by e-mail, informing us that delivery would be on a certain day by a certain carrier.  Delivery was free.  It came delivered right into our house on the day indicated.  The delivery person brought it into the house, unpacked it, and checked it out to make sure that it worked and no damage was done.  We were really pleased at how our order was handled by Amazon, and how fast our order was processed.  I would order again from Amazon.com without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: T. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I have been researching this tv for over a month and finally decided to buy it for my husband as a Christmas gift. It replaced our old school 32" tube tv. I was nervous that the tv would have some issues like other viewers have mentioned (light bleed, lines across screen, or lip syncing problems.) So far, it's perfect! Beautiful picture! Just crossing my fingers that it continues to work just as well for years to come. Totally worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Good for price
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Wolfram
Reviews.Content: Nice picture directly in front of the TV. But it fades out on a less than directly in front of the set. Cost is very good and the apps work, although the apps are slow operating if the side views were better I would give this a 4 star rating.I would recommend a purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Sharilyn K. Franzman
Reviews.Content: Really good color and great features.  Delivered into the house in perfect condition. Very pleased with this purchase!  Considering getting another for the living room.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: James Ballew
Reviews.Content: Excellant picture. Good sound. Easy to set-up  Great price for the value and quality. Have not used it yet but the internet connection looks interesting.  The shipper helped unpack and assure no dammage and that the TV worked properly.  Excellant experience.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Kidsnickers
Reviews.Content: This TV deserves five stars based on its cost and quality. The picture is stunning, bright, and sharp.  The 120hz helps with fast movement but still not as good as plasma which is still the best technology for sports.  Regardless, soccer, football, and basketball look great and I don't believe I am missing anything.  I am more than satisfied with this tv. The smart features are a plus but not a huge benefit as most everything seems to be connected but it is nicely tucked into a single unit. The contrast is fine.  I know some people have complained about white bleeding but I have not experienced that ith my set.In general: This is a great set. I would recommend it to anyone, especially at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Best value in its size.
Reviews.Author: Steelers4life
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item from Amazon and have had it for a while now. It has everything you could want but 3D. I'm saving for the new 4K resolustion technology, until those sets arrive with and are found as advertised, this set will get me by and then some. I've tweeked the settings and find that the video temp. control set to "cool" rather than "normal" makes those whites really white and skin tones more natural.My settings:Picture mode: NormalBacklight: 52 (Darkening the backlight 50 - 60 is the key along with keeping the brighness 50-60 as well to a film-like image to get great black level performance. Raising the backlight setting to 90+ will give you that LED "POP" that plasma can't achieve, but kiss your blacks goodbye).Brightness:50Contrast: 70 (Sharp clear whites/deep blacks)Blacks are the deepest you're going to find in a non local dimming LED set, making this an outstanding value.Color: 52 (As good as the top of the line Panasonic plasma VT series. Yes, I said VT series.)Tint:0Sharpness:2Color Temp.: CoolRed: 104Green:110Blue:128Red Offset:128Green Offset:128Blue Offset:128Smooth motion effect: Low (I don't notice the soap opera effect - picture to smooth unnatural)All other settings set to off.My Wife didn't want to spend more than a grand since she knows 4K resolution is right around the corner.For under a grand, this is the best value/perfoming set you're going to find. With all that being said, if your looking for 3D in the here and now, go for an LG which is using passive 3D glasses able to see only 540 to each eye rather then active 3D glasses Full 1080P to each eye Panasonic and Samsung use, but it's going to cost you plenty more. I may also add that passive 3D glasses are cheaper, lighter and also don't require a battery.The screen is a bit reflective, but less so than other LED TVs costing much more.As far as the brand goes, Vizio is considered on the lower end by enthousiasts. Judging by the performace of this set AFTER it is calibrated one can certainly argue that point.I'm hoping it is durable enough to get me by until 4K becomes affordable.I would recommend this TV, but the settings need to be tweeked or you'll be looking to spend hundreds more on another brand to match its size and specs.

Reviews.Title: Good product for the price
Reviews.Author: Sunny K
Reviews.Content: This is a good product for the price. Amazon provided a great carrier too. I highly recommend this product. It can hook with PS3, Wii, Apple TV, Blu Ray. Love it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Visio 60" LED Flat Panel TV
Reviews.Author: DK "Health Concious"
Reviews.Content: I have a 32" Vizio LCD TV and am very satisfied with the product.  So, when I saw the price on the new Vizio 60" Razor Thin set, I opted to make the purchase.  The picture quality is pretty good and it has hook ups for wi-fi, which interested me even more, because I can use my IPad with the TV.For the price, you can't go wrong.  I even called Vizio with a question, and their customer service was very helpfuland friendly. The only issue I have is with the remote.  The texting keys are on the backside, and sometimes when you hold the main part of the remote to change channels, you end up pressing those keys.  They should have made a sliding cover for remote.  Also, they don't have paper manuals anymore.  All instructions are programmed into the TV.  A hassle to lookup.Otherwise, a good set choice!

Reviews.Title: Crystal Clear Picture
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: I have had a few HDTV's in the past (37" LCD 720P, 42" LCD 1080P and 43" Plasma 720P) and the VIZIO E601i-A3 60-Inch 1080p 120Hz Razor LED Smart HDTV blows them all away.The picture quality is so incredible, it makes the movies almost look fake. I sometimes feel like I'm watching a play on broadway rather than an actual Hollywood movie. The clarity couldn't be better. I can literally see the pores on people's faces.All of my prior TV's, in my opinion, were thin enough. This TV is so thin, that in order to really get any thinner it would just have to be a screen and that's it. It's about an inch and a half thick.The sound quality is surprisingly not bad. Let's face it, you don't buy a TV for the sound quality. I mean where are they supposed to put the speakers in a TV that is an inch a half thick? Having said that, I can actually turn up the volume to where it's pretty loud (over half way) and it doesn't get distorded like all of my prior TVs did.The best part about the TV, in my opinion, is the fact that it's a smart TV. I love that I can listen to my favorite radio stations on Pandora or flip over to Netflix and watching a movie in stunning HD. I also love the fact that if I'm bored and want to search the web for funny or interesting videos I can do it right there on my TV on a massive 60" screen rather than my little 16" laptop. You can also browse Facebook and update your status on the TV as well.The setup is extremely user friendly. Within the same day, I was cruising through the menu and was pushing buttons on the remote without even looking. Speaking of the remote, it pretty much has every button that you would ever need to work the TV and all the aspects of the TV without being overwhelming and not being confused. You can go straight to Netflix with a push of a button as well as a couple of other applications. The only negative thing I have to say about the remote is that I can't program it to work my blu ray player (not that I'm aware of anyway).Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with my purchase. For the price compared to the larger named brands, you really can't beat it. The picture quality combined with it being a smart TV is an excellent duo. I would highly recommend this TV to anyone who is looking for the best.

Reviews.Title: WORKED FOR A TOTAL OF 42 DAYS!  (Screen Dead!)
Reviews.Author: Hyma
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get this for the "special price" on black Friday. Tv worked well right out of the box, not plasma picture quality, but for the price i wasn't complaining.After about a week i dealt with the audio sync issues and would have to turn it off/back on again.Now the screen is completely dead, the TV back light is on and power light is on, but NO PICTURE!**Thankfully Amazon is awesome and is exchanging, but I have had more issues with this tv in the first month and a half that i have with all my other tv's combined**

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS TV!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Scubafiend "scubafiend"
Reviews.Content: My old 32" tube died about 6 months ago and I had been thinking about replacing it with a large LED but just couldn't decide. I finally decided on this TV, and was just about to purchase and the price jumped $100 so I waited. Then it dropped again and I jumped on it and I'm SO GLAD I DID.I have Amazon Prime so the shipping cost me nothing. They delivered to my house, unpacked it, set it up, confirmed it was working, and would have removed packaging but I want to keep it for just a little while. Purchase and delivery were impeccable. No problems at all.So - the TV itself. OMG. The first thing I streamed from Amazon came across in HD and I literally was standing in my living room with my mouth open. Just amazing picture! I have since purchased a BluRay player - another thing I had been procrastinating on- and OMG again!!!! Worth every penny!!! I've used the Netflix and Amazon streaming apps and they work great. The remote is great - I have no problems with it. The display is sharp and brilliant even with the blinds open by it. The sound is good - particularly as compared to my Bravia. Note - I have not purchased the sound bar. I live in a condo and have to consider my neighbors so I won't really blast it but I haven't needed to put the volume above about 40.Hiccups -I think my wireless is a little fickle. If I stream to the Vizio, shut the TV off, and go to my Bravia and stream there, when I go back to the Vizio it takes a 2nd request for it to find my wireless. But it does every time. Honestly, I don't care enough about it to worry.I'm not wildly fond of the interface of the Amazon streaming app - it doesn't seem to have my watchlist unless I'm just missing something. The Netflix works fine with my queue.All in all - absolutely excellent purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great TV with a lot of features and CHEAP!
Reviews.Author: Howard P. Webb
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV on cyber Monday but through Walmart it was $300 cheaper at the time. I would have preferred Amazon but the competition had the better deal that day.The picture is unbelievable. At some times it looks almost 3D or that you're looking out a window instead of into a screen. I won't even consider another brand than Vizio after seeing this tv. As far as I can see the picture is as good or better than a Sony or LG or any other brand costing several hundreds more for the same size screen but fewer features or inputs.I only have 2 gripes. One is the sound. The volume range is 0-100 and I usually have mine set in the 40-50 range to understand what people are saying and i'm directly in front of the tv at 10 feet yet when I go into the adjoining rooms I hear and understand the speech much better? My guess is the ultra thin design just doesn't make for good speakers or speaker placement. It's like the speakers were put in facing the back or something. Lastly that on non HD programs I sometimes see thin white horizontal lines like bits of string at the very top of the screen that move left and right and change width with the movement of the show. This may be a defect with my particular tv I will be taking this up with Vizio support. But I can elliminate the problem by simply switching to the HD version of that channel...lines gone.
