And why would I want to watch/record a show in 480I if it's available in 1080I (cable DVR's display only 1080I to save bandwidth. To get 1080P you need Satellite DVR's I want G4 and AMC so I'm stuck with 1080I cable) anyways and 90% of what I watch is on networks with HD available.UPDATE: The white line issue was a senior moment on my part. This is my 1st Flat screen TV all I had to compare it with was PC monitors and my laptop. I was unaware you could adjust the screen left/right/up/down These features are greyed out and unusable on my PC monitor. moving the screen just 2 points vertical eliminated the white lines. So I am upgrading the TV to 5 stars.About support; Vizio is outstanding. I made a call when the tv arrived because it was very cold outside and wanted to know if I needed to let the tv acclamate to inside temp before turning it on. My wait time was less than 5 minutes and I actually got to speak to a very pleasant person who could actually speak ENGLISH for a change!!! No outsourced support with an Indian guy named "Bob" and an accent so thick you can cut it with a knife speaking through a crappy scratchy sounding headset. Clear crisp English that I had no problem understanding with my tinnitus. It was a pleasure to speak with them instead of a chore asking them to repeat every other word over and over again.UPDATE regarding support. I think it's also worth noting that Vizio reads customer reviews and comments and attempts to resolve any issue a customer puts in his comments at least on walmart.com. That just shows their level of commitment to their customers. I am just blown away by the quality of support I see and have received.I wish I could give this TV and Vizio a 4.5 out of 5 instead of just a 4.Because the white line issue was my ignorance and not the TV I raised my review to 5 stars. I don't like to give 5 star "perfect" reviews because so many customers default to 5 stars or 1 and that's an emotional reaction not an accurate rating of the product. Like it automatic perfect 5 one small issue and people hit it with a 1 out of anger not taking into account the good things about it or the issue could be with them and not the product as was with me an the white line issue. I would prefer to rate items like PC software is rated. I would give it a 96/100 because I'm still having audio issues with hearing but not understanding speech when I'm in front of the TV yet hearing it fine from the sides or rear of the set even from another room. I'm listening at 45 and my poor wife who's trying to take a nap is getting blasted with like a 75 in the bedroom 25 feet away. I'm no audiophile I just want clear sound so I don't do external sound setups nor do I need another remote to misplace. I may just get wireless headphones to keep the peace in the house :)

Reviews.Title: excellent tv with acceptable flaws
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV from sam's club before Black Friday! $698. The best price for 60 inch LED.1, smart TV, most time I can watch youtube and control it with my ipad or iphone, very convenient.2, TV can play movie/video file on through, although only mp4 is supported but you can change the file name to play other format file, like mkv, avi to mp4. But rmvb is not supported.3, remote control can input letters, but it si not very sensitive, you have to point to the tv to input. And the remote control doesn't have back light.4,  Like most tv speaker, the speaker is not very good, but I connect my computer speaker to the TV, much better, just 96 cents to do that.5, I cannot visit my computer through tv, I hope vizio can have apps to do thatupdate: find the method to connect to computer--> First, ensure you home network is ready to go with Internet access and a router that acts as a DHCP server. Your PC and HDTV should be  connected to the same router. This is needed so the PC and HDTV can discover each other, and allow content to be shared. Once this is  verified, you are ready to setup a DLNA media server.--> In Windows 7, open Windows media player (Start → All Programs → Windows Media Player)  In Windows media player go to stream → Allow Internet access to home media  Click "Link Online ID" in the ensuing popup.  Next, Internet Explorer will open a download page for Windows Live Essentials. Download Live Essentials to obtain the Windows Live ID  sign-in assistant.  Install Live Essentials and repeat step 2.  This time, you'll be able to sign in with a Windows Live ID, e.g. Hotmail account.  Once signed in, go back to stream → Allow Internet access to home media.  Click "Allow Internet access to home media" in the ensuing UAC dialog box.--> So far now we have enabled media player to share our files but still we have not given the rights to play media files. In order to do that,  click stream → select "automatically allow device to play media", this enables us to access files from our computer using DLNA.--> The next step is adding media files such as videos. To start, open windows media player and in the left pane select videos and right click  videos and click "manage video library".--> In the video library location you can select the folders and videos to the library, or you can copy & paste the files to the root directory  of the library. In our case we are copying the HD Avatar trailer to the root directory.--> then choose 'media', then you can find your computer, choose video or music

Reviews.Title: Vizio 60 LED TV is the Best Value for Money
Reviews.Author: Santosh
Reviews.Content: I wanted one from Amazon but even though I pulled the plug exactly the lightening deal timer turned "0" it said it was 100% claimed.Thank god I had a backup plan @ Walmart.I bought this TV on BF from Walmart. When I installed it I was greatly disappointed with the picture quality and were wondering if I did the right thing.I sat through the night and made some custom changes to the settings and that gave me some comfort but still weren't that happy till I saw the settings listed in AVS forum and amazon from CNET. that really changed the picture quality and looks pretty good.Pircture Quality - W/o going in to the technicalities all I can say is I love it...not as awesome as Samsung 8000 series which i say @ BB but that also sets you back $2500 even with BF deal..but I would say its pretty close IMO.Very impressed with the built in apps especially Netflix.It has practically made my apple TV redundant as I watch my netflix and youtube on the TV using the keyboard style remote.It makes my life so much easier than the crazy remote of apple of selecting and clicking each character at a time.Though I have noticed at times the netflix would stop saying its unable to connect not sure if its my WiFI network or the app itself.Remote-Pros-Its pretty good compared to other TV remotes that I have used earlier.Best part is the built in QWERTY on the backCons- Sometimes the remote when typing is not very responsive.It needs to have a real clear line of sight and I guess it needs to be pointed when typing and that could be inconvenient at times.Vizio apps - Loving it.Never imagined the beauty and ease of watching web videos on TV I like them and hope Vizio comes out with some more updates to the apps and we could somehow update the app base using the internet as we can do currently with Apple TV.If Vizio continues the way they are going I am POSITIVE they will very soon dethrone Samsung with the quality of there TV for the Price. As I best best Value for money and better than other more expensive TV from other vendors.

Reviews.Title: Avoid Vizio
Reviews.Author: stanleydelzim
Reviews.Content: This television has suffered from chip failure in a group of serial numbers (for example, LFTRNWAN 4520400) causing the screen to go blank while the sound continues and the back light remains.  It is a non-recoverable failure.  Vizio is aware of the problem and will replace or repair your television IF it is still under the one-year warranty; however, the process can take two or more weeks and relies on a third party company called Square Trade for a replacement or a local repair service if you chose that option.  Delivery is coordinated  by another firm called Manna Distribution Services who then farms out local delivery to yet another (local to your area) company....if this sounds likely to cause problems for you, it does!  My television failed in less than 11 months and I spent a significant amount of time trying to get the replacement delivered.  While Vizio had contact information for many of their customers of this unit, they made no attempt to inform them or replace the television and simply waited until they failed and the customer contacted them.  Obviously, purchase some other television (preferably not a Vizio) unless you enjoy endless hours on the telephone and waiting for delivery people.

Reviews.Title: Malfunctioned in 2 Months
Reviews.Author: RBC "RBCal"
Reviews.Content: This TV died within 2 months of purchase.  Not recommended due to it's unreliability.  The set has a nice picture but no TV should be this unreliable.I also want to warn people about the horrible customer service I experienced returning this POS.  Amazon guaranteed that the shipper would bring packing material.  However the shipper showed up an hour late and had no packaging material.  He ended up tying the TV to dolly.Do not buy this TV and avoid buying Amazon electronics!  Costco is a better choice for purchasing electronics.

Reviews.Title: Great tv, but not reliable.
Reviews.Author: bulldog2000
Reviews.Content: Great TV when working, but the screen failed after two months. I am wondering if this model has some reliability issues, so I did not exchange it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV with two quibbles...
Reviews.Author: C. DeBoer
Reviews.Content: I won't go into the technical stuff. Previous reviewers have covered everything and I used the settings they downloaded from CNET before I even tried to actually view programming on this wonderful television. The only tweak I made to those settings was a little more brightness because my living room is very well lit due to large, west-facing windows. This is my 3rd Vizio and I have never experienced a problem with them. The little 24" in my sun room is ideal. The 5-year old Gallevia 46" that had been in the living room is now in the master bedroom. Talk about an upgrade!!Now, to the quibbles. I absolutely hate the remote control. I realize that, in this smart phone world, most purchasers will not mind the remote. Count me out. I don't and won't have a smart phone, even though I have a perfectly serviceable cell phone. I tried the Vizio Co-Star video streamer and returned it because of the ridiculous remote. I'm 69 years old and have always been very comfortable with a standard 10-key key pad (telephone or calculator). Even those are becoming a little difficult to use as the arthritis in my hands (particularly my thumbs) becomes more pronounced. The tiny buttons on the remote are all but impossible for me to manage. It's not Vizio's fault. They've geared this device to a younger demographic and I understand that. Fortunately, the Gallevia's remote works perfectly well, is back-lit, and far easier for me to use thanks to the space between and around the buttons. I found one here on Amazon and have ordered it, so I'll have one for each of my "big" televisions. Unlike some who might downgrade a product because they dislike one aspect of it, I won't do that because it wouldn't a fair review.12-26-12...Near catastrophe yesterday when the grandchildren were visiting and rough-housing. One of them almost knocked the TV off the oak stand (yes, it was secured with earthquake straps). It swayed and twisted and I thought it was going to break off its actual pedestal, on which other reviewers have commented. For a TV this size, Vizio put little thought into its stand, which is smaller and lighter than the Gallevia's. I realize most people will probably wall-mount a 60-inch TV but I have no wall space for such an installation. Because of this near disaster, and the portent something similar in the future, this set is going back to Costco next week. No warranty would cover such a problem and I'm not going to lose $1,000 over what I consider a design flaw.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 60" tv Shutting off on its own
Reviews.Author: DC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Vizio 60" smart Tv at costco on 11/21/2012 and  I am returning it soon with the problems this set have turning itself off every 10- 20 minutes. I actually posted my brother in law at the remote at thanksgiving just to turn the TV back on when it would shut off..I contacted Customer service and they are sending out a new firmware for set within a week. If this does not work the set will be returned to costco. I have a warranty..Never again,

Reviews.Title: Dead in less than a year and they won't warranty
Reviews.Author: Don Mason
Reviews.Content: Had this tv about 10 months and it went black while watching it. There is a known problem with this tv posted right on their website with the screens going out but still having sound. They told me they won't warranty ANY online retail purchase and my local tv shop says it will cost more than a new one to fix so I'm out $1000.00. BEWARE of this company, I will never buy a thing from them again. Support was down right rude and unremorseful so don't believe their bologna about how dedicated they are to customer satisfaction on their website.

Reviews.Title: Totaled Itself After One Year
Reviews.Author: Blue
Reviews.Content: Like thousands before me, I was lucky enough to experience frustrating LCD display issues.The extra wonderful news? The issue occurred just one month out of warranty - and costs more than the TV costs to fix.So if you're looking for a $1000 disposable television that only needs to last a year, this is a great product. Otherwise, keep looking. Vizio's super special American based customer service team is a joke.

Reviews.Title: Loud static sound from speakers
Reviews.Author: Toddd L. Tomlinson "Todd Tomlinson, Author"
Reviews.Content: It started with infrequent static sound coming from the speakers and progressively got worse.  Static is so loud now that its hard to hear the broadcast sound.  Even when the volume is completely turned off the speakers still have static.  Even when I completely power the TV off the static sound continues for a few seconds.  Definitely my last Vizio product that I'll ever buy.  Before you buy read the reviews on the web.  Terrible customer support, frequent failures.  I should have purchased a Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great tv  if it worked
Reviews.Author: ckelsey
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I did not buy this TV from Amazon. The first TV I brought home and got mounted to the wall was great, until the second day, The TV froze and had no picture. A call to customer service suggested I could wait a week or so for a repair. Back into the box and back to the store we go! Second TV same problem!!! this time I waited the week for the repair. Technician could not fix the issue but was nice enough to report back to vizio he did not see a problem. After my third call to customer service I faxed them my paperwork from the tech. suggesting he thinks it might be the motherboard and the tv freezes. I then got a call from corporate. He told me he would need 24-48 hours to find out what is going on, I called after 24 hours to no avail, but said they would probably send another tech out. GREAT another afternoon of waiting for a service call. Long story short 10 days  6 calls and a service visit, and there has been ZERO progress in getting this issue fixed.

Reviews.Title: Love my vizio
Reviews.Author: big red
Reviews.Content: Thin set.. Amazing quality picture! We use our netflix on this set and other internet services! Would def buy again!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: William Segraves
Reviews.Content: This 60" Vizio TV replaced a 42" Vizio TV and I am very happy with it.  The colors are clear, sharp, and we haven't had any issues of any sort.  The apps interface in this Smart TV is kinda clunky and you have to constantly cycle through the line until you reach the app you want; fortunately, Netflix has its own button on the remote so we can get into our most favorite app very easily!I removed the stand and attached a wall mount bracket; the screws that come with the TV are too short so I had to use the screws that came with the wall bracket.  This TV only weighs 10 more pounds than the old 42" LCD TV it is replacing.  It was quite easy to heft the TV up and onto the bracket mount I have on the wall.I would definitely recommend this TV to anyone who wants to upgrade from their smaller TV.  It's not the higher 1200p, but the price is perfect!

Reviews.Title: AMAZING PICTURE
Reviews.Author: Bree
Reviews.Content: WE love our new TV! The picture is so clear it's as if we are watching it in 3D. I can see the wrinkles on actors faces....

Reviews.Title: Awesome Television
Reviews.Author: zurine corcorran
Reviews.Content: I am so happy with this new television.  The picture quality is excellent.  The capabilities of the smarttv are amazing. I really enjoy being able to hang from the wall. It takes our movie watching to a new level.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this TV.
Reviews.Author: Jake A Jessop
Reviews.Content: Love this TV. Smart TV features are great and very easy to use, great picture quality and sound. Very happy with purchase.

Reviews.Title: excellent picture
Reviews.Author: Arlene J. Bauduin
Reviews.Content: the tv is wonderful.  the first one didn't change the color and i exchanged it for another.  no problem with the exchange, amazon was so helpful to make the change as easy as possible.  the second one is terrific.  picture is amazing.  from now on, vizio is my choice for tv's.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Hubert F
Reviews.Content: I love when something works as advertised not more not less. Great picture, great price, works fine, relatively light weight.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: billy
Reviews.Content: Just picked this TV up a week ago to replace a 6 year old 46" Sony LCD, and I'm very happy so far.Picture quality is great with a lot of options for tweaking, though I am not all that particular. The one thing I did immediately was turn off Smooth Motion Effect/dejudder to eliminate the soap opera effect, which I find distracting.Connectivity is also a strength. It's surprisingly hard to find a budget friendly TV with 4 HDMI inputs these days (cable box, HTPC, XBOX, PS3), but this set had me covered.  I was also happy to see RCA analog audio outputs, which work well with my old receiver, so I can safely keep my 20th century audio rig running for another couple of years.The smart apps are neat. We've used the Netflix and YouTube apps quite a bit, and they are functional and convenient. The Netflix app crashed once on the first day we had the set, which caused the TV to power down, but haven't seen it since.The one flaw/minor annoyance that I've come up against is with playing video from my Plex media server using the built-in multimedia/DLNA app, which finds the media server but throws a "file corrupt" error when attempting open a video. There may be a workaround to get it working, but I have 3 other devices that can do this already, so definitely not a deal breaker.Overall, I'm very happy with the purchase. Going from a 46" TV to 60" set has been amazing, and I have no complaints about basic features, picture quality, or connectivity, which all I need. The addition of smart apps is gravy, as far as I'm concerned, and the ones I've used are functional enough (except for some issues with the DLNA video function noted above). So far, so good!

Reviews.Title: So far, so good.
Reviews.Author: TinkPA
Reviews.Content: Great HD picture and sound too, at a great price.  I also have a 55 inch Vizio 3D LED 240Hz which has worked perfectly for over 2 years, so I trust the brand.  But after reading the reviews on this model, I did buy an extended warranty just in case.

Reviews.Title: One year later, still great!
Reviews.Author: Ray
Reviews.Content: I bought this about a year ago and haven't had any issue. The colors are bright, picture sharp and menu's easy to use. The Smart features aren't as good as some third party boxes, and the speakers are so-so. I advise getting a couple hundred watt sound bar to go with the TV, and a dedicated Amazon/Netflix/Hulu/video box to stream content. For the price, I still haven't seen anything that compares.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Vancrizzy
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say about this TV.  Great picture and love the smart TV options.  We have had great success with WIFI on the device and use it to watch Amazon Prime videos and Netflix movies.  For the price I'm not sure there is a better option for a smart TV of this size and quality.

Reviews.Title: I love my Vizio!
Reviews.Author: Nathan Robinson
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the best 60" TV you can get on a budget.Pros:*Great Picture*Thin profile, attractive design.*Better built in speakers than most LED TV's*Low Price*Energy Efficient*Hulu Plus works better through the smart tv app than it does through my PS3Cons*Smart apps could use some work, a little clunky and outdated. There is also an annoying little bug where the vizio apps will cause the TV to kind of freeze up, where you cant change the volume or channel until you've turned the TV off and on again.I love this TV though! It has surpassed all my expectations, and made me a Vizio fanboy for life.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality Control
Reviews.Author: Candy McGhee "Candy"
Reviews.Content: Had the TV professionally mounted, connected and setup when it arrived.  2 of 4 HDTV ports did not work but I did not want to hassle with taking it off the wall and shipping it back.  2 days later the other two ports failed.  Returned the TV for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Chris E. Avis
Reviews.Content: Our first TV we got broke but VIZIO did replace it at no cost. So there's that. I'm just hoping the replacement doesn't break after the warranty expires. Otherwise, I've liked the TV and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Awesome
Reviews.Author: George Webber
Reviews.Content: This television was so simple to set up. I've read reviews of people having issues with navigating the menu system but, honestly, if you just read along it's fairly self-explanatory. Anyone with a moderate knowledge of computer and/or satellite menu systems can figure it out without even looking at the manual or set-up guide. The images are clean and sharp and I experienced no sound synchronization issues.Probably the only thing keeping this from a full 5-star rating is that the sound, when not hooked up to a surround system, really lacks any low end. My previous TV was a Toshiba CinemaView and I got accustomed to the relatively boomy bass from the much larger speakers, so trading down to thin bass response took some getting used to. Otherwise I'm very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted and more
Reviews.Author: Gene Marcum
Reviews.Content: Reviewed the specs and was priced good, I bought and when set up I found it to be better than my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, vibrant colors
Reviews.Author: J. Merrill "rollenrock"
Reviews.Content: I have been very happy with my purchase. I use it for xBox, DirecTV, and my Apple TV. I have never used the speakers because I have a Bose sound bar. I am looking at a 70", and will purchase another Vizio. The frame is small, it's is lightweight and flat, and lightweight. The blacks are black, the refresh rate is great for football and action movies. I wish I could eliminate the unused inputs so that when I move between HDMI connections I don't have to scroll through them all. No other complaints. I like that here isn't a light shining constantly whether it is off or on.

Reviews.Title: As rated by others
Reviews.Author: Hope M. Bird "htb"
Reviews.Content: So far matched with Dish HD.  Love the channels some when you watch you have to use the  wide button so you get the full use of the screen.  Other than that easy to set up.  Good picture.  Looking forward to watching the superbowl in HD.

Reviews.Title: love it but ...
Reviews.Author: James Lettermail
Reviews.Content: This tv is great overall, the picture is amazing and how thin/slim the case is. I like just about everything about it but last night after owning for a couple months I finally mounted it the wall turned all the lights off and turned on a blu ray. It was a darker movie and anytime the screen had mostly all blacked out screen I noticed some decent clouding I never notice before. I cant seem to get it off my mind now, I doubt ill go through the hassle of repairing/replacing it and I live with it cause honestly if you dont watch a completely black screen in a pitch black room you may never notice, I turn on a small accent lamp and turned down the backlight but if your looking for it you will notice it, hopefully I can get my mind off it and start enjoying this big beautiful tv. Even with the clouding I freaking love this thing!

Reviews.Title: User Manual Sucks - ARC explained
Reviews.Author: Paul B. Ulrich
Reviews.Content: This is how you make sure the TV will send an ARC signal on HDMI 1 to your sound system.  Click Menu on the REmote, Go to Settings, CEC settings, Go to CEC function, enable it.  Go to System Audio Control, set it to ON.You also have to set HDMI control to on on your sound system, but this instruction above was not found in the manual.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Neader
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas present for my husband and I use it more than he even does. Wonderful picture quality, and having the internet feature on the TV is perfect. Amazon Prime and Netflix just one button away is so easy. Would highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: jay m witkowski
Reviews.Content: TV came with no visible flaws. Excellent picture and sound. Able to access you tube and other preloaded apps. Great price. Would recommend Highly!

Reviews.Title: Poor poor backlight!!!
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I got a sweet deal on this TV, but the LED backlight was uneven at the bottom. You couldn't really notice when there was a full color picture or completely dark. But when there was black along the bottom edge and part of the screen was lit, you could see where a few LEDs were shinning and washing out the black.It would get 5 stars if I had not had the defect. The picture looked great otherwise.Amazon return assistance is great. I actually got someone on the phone who understood what the problem was and tried a few things to help. They didn't ask me to restart my computer or reset my router.Just be sure to inspect when they do the white glove delivery. Refuse anything that isn't perfect. I made the mistake of letting the driver talk me into accepting the TV and getting it returned later. That meant I had to be home twice, have the second driver inspect everything, and let the massive TV and box sit in my living room for another week.

Reviews.Title: Help Support Sucks
Reviews.Author: John E. Doyle
Reviews.Content: So far I like the picture on this TV. Real sharp and clear. The set-up was real easy for me. It's the apps that come with this TV. If you are into You-Tube forget about it. It don't work and it will never work on this TV.The buffering is the issue.The other app called web videos will work some of the time. If you think it's just me Google VIZIO TV ISSUES and you will come up with tons of sites to check out. The Netflix movies all work with this TV. At first I thought maybe it was my WIFI but nope. So the next day I hard wired the TV with the Ethernet cable and no go with You-Tube again. Made no difference what so ever.I did talked with Vizio tech support about the You-Tube issue and was told there was nothing that can be done about this problem. The tech gal I was talking to told me the same thing happens with her smart phone..like who cares lady. And she was not a big fan of You-Tube. The thing here is Vizio should not be advertising that you can use You-Tube on this TV. They have known all along about this problem and have done nothing to correct it.Only wish I  could give this two and half stars on the rating.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Purchase
Reviews.Author: Valerie C. Kashubara
Reviews.Content: This TV is absolutely fabulous with one tiny exception....the background music, etc., is too loud and I cannot figure out how to lower it so that I can hear the dialogue more clearly.  I am sure there is a way to do this, but I just have not found it yet.The TV was easy to set up with very clear instructions as to how to do it.So very glad I purchased this Vizio!!!

Reviews.Title: Only one issue with the TV
Reviews.Author: Saverio N. Paglioni
Reviews.Content: Everything is perfect with the exception of one item...the TV's Wi-Fi.  I streamed Netflix last night (I have a repeater hardwired into the television) and the "feathering" is very noticeable.  I then streamed Netflix through the Wii, and it was brilliant.  So, stream with a device not on the tv.Other than that, it's a fantastic television.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: James Boer
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 60" model to replace my old, failing 63" internal projection TV.  I have to say, I'm not going to miss those giant cabinets, since now I need to figure out how to dispose of that old monster.  The new TV looks splendid to me, although admittedly I'm not exactly a videophile.  I had considered a plasma, but I'm extremely happy that I decided against it, what with the dangers of burn in, additional weight, cost, and power consumption for a supposedly better picture that I'd probably never notice anyhow.  LED TVs make a lot more sense for most consumers, in my opinion.I really don't care much at all about the "smarts" of this smart TV either, since I'll always be connected to an Xbox and/or PlayStation, both of which function just fine as media centers, and which are typically much easier to control.  So, I'm afraid I can't comment on those, as I don't plan on ever using them.  For me, the TV itself is enough for me, and it's definitely of sufficient quality to earn it high marks.I had purchased this TV a while ago, and the price has plummeted since then.  I thought it was a good deal even near the retail price I paid, but now its an absolute steal.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade over 42" class LCD
Reviews.Author: Kerry in Cali
Reviews.Content: It was time to upgrade the 42" LCD, so I started looking at Black Friday specials. This was one of the advertised sets that checked all my boxes. I was hoping Amazon would match Walmart's $688 deal, but I found it at Best Buy delivered for $677, so I jumped on that deal. Very happy with this set so far. Picture is fantastic and have found the smart capabilities very convenient for both Netflix and Amazon Prime streaming. If you are looking to upgrade and are not concerned about 3D, I highly recommend this over more expensive options from Samsung and Panasonic.Kerry

Reviews.Title: Great TV with no issues
Reviews.Author: Clifton Drew Gentle
Reviews.Content: Bought the 60" vizio off of Amazon a week ago. I was a little worried after reading some of the comments about customers receiving damaged TVs, but luckily this TV had nothing wrong with it when I received it. It was delivered on time with no issues. It was easy to set up and easy to figure out how the smart TV function works (this was my first smart TV). The picture isn't as good as I thought it would be, but it's still very good for a TV of that size. I googled different picture setting suggestions for that model TV that I tried and modified them a little to what I thought worked well. So far I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Quality!
Reviews.Author: Soljaboi26 "soljaboi26"
Reviews.Content: I have had this television for about a year and I can say it is AMAZING (A-Z). I seen some of the customer images and seen the ones with the lights in the corner of the display, I too have had those problems too in the first few weeks but after a while it fades. I have had no other problems since then. I do wish they would release an update for it as well as Amazon Instant Vid, and the other apps. The mobile connectivity is wonderful as well. I have always had a reliable connection with not a single problem.The keyboard on the back of the remote is a bit wired to use if you are not directly in front of the television. All in all a wonderful product!

Reviews.Title: My first Smart TV was a SMART buy!
Reviews.Author: JoyDesigns "Owner"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS TV. Picture and sound clear as a bell. This is my first Smart TV and I find it very easy to use and enjoy. The TV remote has easy access buttons for Amazon & Netflix, it has a full QWERTY keeyboard on one side and standard remote on the other. I was afaid that i wouldn't be able to figure out this TV but it was so easy I was watching Amazon Prime in my living room in minutes,Deliver if the TV was smooth and easy. The deliever comapny called and set up a window for delivery, called when they were on the way and arrived as promised. They brought the TV into the house and un boxed it. They were not "allowed" to set it up on the stand but they did plug it in and made sure it worked and that there was no damage to the set before they left. I am VERY happy with the delivery service.Great TV. Great value, Great service.

Reviews.Title: It meets our expectations.
Reviews.Author: Janet Day
Reviews.Content: It meets all our expectations.  We researched other brands and decided on this one because of reputation for quality of manufacture and the recommendations of friends who have this product.

Reviews.Title: Best value for the price under $1000
Reviews.Author: Nom D. Plume
Reviews.Content: We grabbed this TV at an amazing price point, at around $650.  TV is large, sharp, and glare is minimal (although there is not much sunlight in the room we mounted it in).  The sound quality was not great, but a Vizio sound bar did the trick.  We were amazed how light weight the TV was for the size when we wall-mounted it (~50lbs without the stand).  Only cons are the built-in Wifi and Apps, which are slow, clunky, and lose intermittent connectivity, but "built-in" features really should not affect your decision to purchase a TV, as you can easily buy and keep an Android TV stick / Chromecast / Apple TV upgraded.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV!
Reviews.Author: Volarath
Reviews.Content: Excellent Blueray playback quality, and easy to set up.  Well, easy to watch it be set up.  Delivery/installation guy was great, and made it on time.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Warren Redlich
Reviews.Content: Very happy with it.First of all, the matte screen is better at dealing with reflections from the surroundings like windows letting in exterior light. This is one of the reasons I chose it and I'm glad I did.Second, the picture is outstanding. No complaints.Third, ability to access Amazon Prime is a big plus, though we actually haven't used it much so far.My only mistake? I should've bought the 70" model. This is big enough, but I'm kicking myself about not spending a few extra bucks.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Roger Pierce
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV. It was easy to set up.  It has a really nice picture but the sound is not very good.  But for the price I do no think it can be beat.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Luziano Chavez
Reviews.Content: Most definitely one of my top purchases from Amazon! Vizio is a great brand and the price was unbeatable at the time! Nothing wrong with it and the netflix app on it saves so much time =]

Reviews.Title: Great TV after tons of research
Reviews.Author: P. DeHaan
Reviews.Content: This TV is great! After days of research using Consumer Reports, Amazon reviews, CNET, PC World, and a host of other opinions, I settled on this TV, due to it's affordability, features, size, price, back light technology, etc. This is an excellent value.I have a Vizio sound bar set mounted above the tv using two steel brackets I also purchased on Amazon and absolutely love the setup.Perhaps one con is that the screen can't be swiveled sideways, but that's a minor fix of buying a small rotating plate for it to sit on.Other than that, the picture quality is excellent, I love how sleek the TV is, the screen with its matte finish (thank goodness it's NOT glossy!), how thin the edges are... just love it. And I'm usually a Samsung guy.

Reviews.Title: Majestic is the only way to describe it.
Reviews.Author: jason alcorn
Reviews.Content: We got this tv yesterday. I could not be happier. It looks fantastic and the on board speakers sound better than our (admittedly slightly older) surround sound system. The picture is crisp. I feel like I'm watching something entirely new every time I watch something in HD. The Netflix and Amazon loaders work perfectly and transmit in Blu Ray quality High Def. All the settings and menus are easily managed and set up only took a few minutes, The two sided controller is excellent (although a smudge magnet) and pretty easy to use. Could this change? Potentially, however at this point I have never been happier with a television purchase.*A slight note about shipping.*The shipping company Amazon chose was extremely unprofessional. JB Hunt answered their phones unprofessionally and were more than an hour late. When they finally got there I had to help carry my TV in. No way was it a one person job so I'm really happy that I was the one who was there.0/10 for JB Hunt I would NOT recommend.However unlike most people here I'm reviewing the TV not the shipping method.

Reviews.Title: Many Glitches in Software!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: First I will give a positive....great screen!  Now that that has been established, what good is it when you are constantly frustrated with issues.  The main issue is with the Netflix software (may be others, but I only use Netflix).  There is no rhyme or reason as to why the screen will freeze and the audio continues on.  After this, ALL functionality of the TV is lost, including the remote.  Even the power button on the TV itself no longer works.  I am forced to unplug and re-plug the TV and off we go again.  Sometimes this will occur w/n a few mins of a program, other times, could be weeks!  Tech support wants me to reset the TV back to factory (loosing all my WEP settings ect).  I agree, most "reboots" solve the problem, but I disagree with this solution being the end-all.After owning this for about 9 months now, I would say Netflix locks it up at least 3-4 times a month.  Only recently (last two months or so), when I turn it on, the audio/video will be so out of sync, its laughable.  Simply change channels and go back and it resolves itself.These are irritations, but one that has irritated me after 9 months to go and actually write up a review.  If I see anyone carting a Visio off to the cash register, I will give my two cents....at least you have more info b/f spending a wad of cash on what otherwise would be a great product, if they would simply UPDATE IT! Happy shopping!

Reviews.Title: Love this TV !!!
Reviews.Author: David L. Bernier
Reviews.Content: Great look, great features and the reception is outstanding.  Best deal for the money !!! You certainly can't go wrong

Reviews.Title: Very pleased overall...
Reviews.Author: Franklin L.
Reviews.Content: This was a great price at Best Buy, later I even saw it advertised at Big Lots for about the same as it was at Best Buy. Here are the small problems I've had...1. When the screen goes black momentarily between scenes, I can make out a slight trace of the previous scene on the dark screen before the next scene, only mildly annoying. I've tried visual adjustments in settings, nothing fixes this.2. There isn't any 'Over the air' antenna digital information on programs. It will sometimes display what is currently playing, sometimes... An old generic 42" lcd I have displays listings for channels several hours in advance for the shows through 'Over the air' free digital channel broadcast. The worst thing about this problem is when I called Vizio about it, the person just gave me a dismissive techno savvy response suggesting 'WHAT STONE-AGE DINOSAUR STILL USES OVER THE AIR SIGNALS???!!!'. I'm being a little dramatic, but it still rubbed me the wrong way.3. Often the volume up down, channel up down buttons on the remote control will get stuck, this sometimes causes me to fly past the channel I wanted to watch. Overtime, the painted lettering/symbols has begun wearing off on the most frequently used buttons.I had whined about a host of other small problems but I believe uninvited people were on our wifi, an unbelievably complicated password seems to have fixed this problem.The problems are almost always seldom and the benefits have outweighed the cons. A year after purchase, it still has a strikingly beautiful crisp picture, we love streaming movies and shows from Amazon, Youtube and especially Netflix.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: sweet
Reviews.Content: AS expected, VIZIO didn't let me down. Great TV at a great Price. Once you mess around with the settings to get that perfect picture this TV is just as good if not better than TV's that are double the price. The slim border looks nice too. Only negative I had was that when playing movies over any of the apps the sound will not come through the surround sound due to the TV needing an audio out jack. You have to set it up as another source and switch sources on your audio. You will need a digital optical audio cable which you can buy for less than $10.

Reviews.Title: Wait for something better
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Walmart was having a 10%-off and $50 gift card promotion for this TV in August. So I managed to buy one.My family has been purchasing Vizio televisions for a while now. Our first TV was a 42" Vizio. It cost $900 in 2007. I bought a 32" Vizio in 2008 for $550. Vizio HDTVs are cheap and they provide a good value for the buck. However, the black levels on their "value" TVs are atrocious.The black levels on this TV are no better. It's a pity since this TV is beautiful.The TV is still a good value for its price. I look forward to my buying a 80" Vizio in 2015-2016. Hopefully, the black levels should be better by then.

Reviews.Title: piece of garbage
Reviews.Author: Kim springer
Reviews.Content: we have had so many problems with this tv, the main one being, it freezes up all the time and we have to  unplug the tv and turn it back on.  I would not recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture Quality and Customer Service is Great
Reviews.Author: John Q.
Reviews.Content: After about 7 months this TV went completely black during a July 4th gathering (2013) I called Vizio customer service and they instantly made plans for the pickup and replacement of the TV. Some of these TVs were manufactured with defective chips. That being said; I really enjoy this model and it has an awesome picture. The internet connection is a little lagging when it comes to connectivity strength so I get that dreaded spinning symbol when Im streaming videos. And sometimes Netflix will completely freeze up and I have to do a reset to factory default and put all my credential into the TV over and over again for my video apps. (Worth mentioning: The internet is actually connected via ethernet cable from my high-speed router) Overall, this is still a great buy and it's simply beautiful mounted above my fire-place mantel.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Ellie
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this TV.  So easy to set up,  ( Remote, as well) even having a Bose Surround Sound System.  The Clarity is awesome and colors are perfect!

Reviews.Title: Excellent HDTV at such a low price
Reviews.Author: Kathy Cai
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe the picture is so crystal clear.  With regard to the function and quality it is similar to or better than other HDTVs at much higher prices.For all HDTVs of this kind regardless of their brands, the sound quality is poor because the TV is so thin. In particular, the low frequency sound (bass) does not exist. Therefore to enjoy more you definitely need a sound bar or a sound system when you watch movies or TV shows.

Reviews.Title: Bad Chip in a large batch of these TV, great customer service
Reviews.Author: ctb
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV on Black Friday, Nov 2012, at Wal Mart. On 7/05/2013 the TV screen went black, no display.  Called Vizio customer service and they will send out a replacement within a week.  They will setup and take bad tv back.  Customer service explained a large batch of these TVs were put out with bad chips.  These chips would go out after approx 500 hours of use.  I gave them my SN and it was in their list of bad chip TVs.  So, if you buy, call Vizio to determine if you have one of these TVs.  They will gladly replace.  I'm using my 55 Vizio LCD in the meantime (never any issues).

Reviews.Title: 60" Vizio
Reviews.Author: annajo
Reviews.Content: We had a Vizio one size smaller and put that on bedroom wall. This we mounted on family room wall. We've had really good luck with Vizio TVs.

Reviews.Title: Just got it
Reviews.Author: Jim Deli
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is quite a step up from my old 35 inch TV. I'm still having problems getting it online but that was not the reason I bought it. The tech support is very good.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected performance.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We were torn between this Vizio and the more expensive Sharp television.  We decided on this one because of the positive reviews we read and the fact that it was about $200 less than the Sharp.  The entire family has been amazed at the picture quality of this television.  I am sure under lab conditions with actual electronic testing equipment that this one would not compete well with more expensive sets, but for a casual viewer just watching television it is incredible.  We were all blown away the first time we watched the 1970's show Gilligan's Island on this set via Netflix.  You feel like you are looking out of a window instead of watching television.  I have no idea how they can make a 40 year old show look so realistic, but it really is impressive. In fact, at times it looks almost 3D it is so realistic (although this is not a 3D set).  The only weakness that this television has is that the speakers are not very loud, so we usually turn on a sound bar that we had previously purchased from Walmart.  The sound bar supplements the TV speakers very well, especially with the high frequency sounds.  With the bottom/back mounted speakers of the TV the sounds are a little muffled sounding, but the sound bar completely correct that.  Overall we think this television is a great value and we are extremely pleased with the decision to purchase it.

Reviews.Title: A great tv at a great price!
Reviews.Author: MsCaliGurl
Reviews.Content: We upgraded our 3yr old 47in. Panasonic HD tv, and this Vizio was such a great investment. I've had the tv for 5 months now and it is worth every cent I paid. The screen is huge, 60 inches and it has a slim frame which really gives you a sense that this tv is all screen. The tv itself is thin, a little more than an inch thick. Which makes this tv lighter than most 60in tv's. This is a smart tv which means it comes with various apps that you can connect to over WiFi, such as, YouTube, Amazon video, Pandora and more. The picture quality is great and so is the sound quality. I would recommend this tv to whomever wants a bigger screen with a great picture at an even greater price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: AK from Trinidad
Reviews.Content: This TV is absolutely great! It got some bad reviews, none of which I agree with, shipping was great, the tv was easy to set up and picture and sound is very good. This is second Vizio I own, and has experienced no problems yet. My first Vizio is a 42" and is 6 years old, my new 60" is one month old and is has no problems like those experienced by others, most of the problems others have is simply an adjustment issue. I definitely recommend this Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Good TV. But keep the box.
Reviews.Author: N. Hogue
Reviews.Content: TV Looks great. The picture is fantastic and the apps are easy to use, if a little slow. But that's natural with any built in application I'm finding.The only trouble was after 14 days I got a red line down the tv. one of the rows went out. Unable to resolve this though Amazon sent an exchange which I received soon and the company kindly delivered and took the old one same day. They of course offer to take the box when they deliver it, don't. If it happens to you you need this box to return it. Sure the new one might work out as well but if out of stock, out of luck.Other than that this new one has had no troubles, the picture is great, sharp, crisp, the blacks are deep. Once I turned off motion smoothing everything is just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: great buy!
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: This TV has lived up to everything I thought it would be.  The delivery service was on time, not the most knowledgeable guys but effective.  I am still learning how to use everything, but as I said so far so good.  The only complaint would be the sound quality.  The speakers are not that great, but can easily be fixed with a sound bar or surround sound.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO ROCKS!!!!
Reviews.Author: Robert Howell
Reviews.Content: This TV exceeded my expectations in every way. The picture is incredible. I've run 1080p videos directly from the flash drive and the picture is awesome. The setup was very easy and the set is packed with useful features. It's not my first HD TV but by far the best. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: Wish I had Known Before I Purchased...
Reviews.Author: Gwennie
Reviews.Content: Big Screen and Big Sound go together - Right?  Unfortunately, not all VIZIO apps (ie NETFLIX) are compatible with home theater surround sound systems.After speaking with, and confirming this fact with several of VIZIO's wonderfully friendly customer service agents, I was asked to be patient.Apparently, the company is working with NETFLIX on an update to allow home theater compatibility.I'm hugely dissapointed.In addition to the cost of the TV, I invested in a surround sound system that doesn't currently work with a major source of my movies -- NETFLIX.  Given that VIZIO highlights the accessibility of their applications when promoting their TVs, I feel that this is something that should have been tested and worked out before launching the product!  So... I'm unhappily waiting and hoping that there will, in fact, be an update.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV and you cannot beat the price!
Reviews.Author: dandeeswish
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant about getting this TV just because of some problems that people were reporting/experiencing, from forums and comments, etc.. I took a chance though and have never had any problems at all. No lip sync, picture going out, etc.The only thing that I have noticed is a bit of bleeding from the TV's corners, when first starting up the TV, but this is a pretty common issue amongst "The Razors". Once you boot up the picture it's not even noticeable. I would recommend this TV to anybody that wants size, beautiful picture quality, can't common on sound much, as it runs through my receiver, and wants as much bang for the buck. This TV will not disappoint. Some of the Calibration settings that are posted in these comments are pretty amazing. Many thanks to the first woman that posted her calibrations. I have continued with these settings and the Picture quality is just more amazing-Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Great TV...Shipping company sucks!
Reviews.Author: roosevelt
Reviews.Content: I love this TV...I was upset at the fact that it took so long to be delivered and actually thought about cancelling my order. I contacted Amazon and cancelled the order but called back the next day and cancelled the cancelled order and continued shipment. The staff at Amazon were very helpful and I realize that it wasn't their fault. Blame rested with the shipping company (Pilot). But the TV is GREAT! It is scary that it is so clean and crisp. It is a 3D TV without the 3D capability or the glasses. It is truly a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Was great while it worked
Reviews.Author: MM1016
Reviews.Content: I had this TV for just over 90 days. Then it died on me. Picture was great while it worked, but what good is that when it doesn't work anymore. Working with Vizio on getting a replacement but that process is a joke. Going on 3 weeks now and it may be here next week...maybe.Do yourself a favor and spend a little bit more money to a company that supports their products a whole lot better.TV = FAIL (though again picture was good for the 90 days that it worked)VISIO customer Service = FAIL

Reviews.Title: Incredible
Reviews.Author: Just a Regular Guy
Reviews.Content: I cannot imagine that there is a better 60 inch smart HDTV than this one.  The picture is spectacular.  The blur is basically nonexistent.  And I thought the smart TV functions worked extremely well.  I have seen TVs twice as expensive and I can say with confidence that this one is every bit is good.  Plus its Made in the USA, which should matter to you.  Don't waste your money on one of the fancier names.  This should be your choice.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought mine from Walmart.com. It was refurbished and cost only $748.00. I paid an additional $160 to get a 4 year replacement warranty. I am very pleased so far. To be fair, I have only had it 4 days and have no idea why it was originally refurbished. I can tell you that, with some adjustments of the picture settings, it has a great picture. I consider myself a decent judge, I have 3 other flatscreens and am all about HD signal and Blu-rays. The picture is great. The audio of the TV is awful. Sounds very cheap. Luckily, I use a home theater for my sound, so it doesn't adversely affect me. I would recommend this TV for $1,000 bucks or under. I have not used the wifi much, because I have a large house and my wireless router is on the other end of the house. Also, the remote does not have dedicated buttons for each input mode. Irritating! Nevertheless,it has been a wonderful upgrade thus far from the Phillips 47-inch it replaced.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, Good Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Squally Ollie
Reviews.Content: The picture on this tv is beautiful.  The sound could be a little better.  About a week after buying it I noticed a green dot that stayed on the screen.  So I called customer service and sent in pictures and they had the TV replaced.  No problems with the replacement so far.

Reviews.Title: I know TV's, and this is an AMAZING value!
Reviews.Author: Martin Wormley
Reviews.Content: I am a Comcast technician, so needless to say I have seen it all when it comes to flaws with modern-day TV's. When I first started with Comcast, I had seen one Vizio fail after another and swore to never to buy one. Samsung TV's always were so solid with rarely any issues at all. However, over the years I have seen Vizio TV's become more of a popular brand with many people recommending the brand to me. After seeing this TV in Best Buy for the same price as on Amazon, I decided to go for it. I will admit, I was furious when I was getting the HDMI audio-lip sync problem right off the bat when I started watching it. I knew it wasn't a cable box issue because I just swapped from my Samsung 50 inch LED to the new one with no issues before. Looking at the bad reviews, I learned that the old firmware was the source of the issue and after 2 days of waiting, I turned on the TV with the message: "Your firmware has been updated to 1.1.5". Since then, absolutely NO issues whatsoever, the picture rivals if not BEATS my Samsung LED! The smart features are solid although I don't use them very often since I use my XBOX more so for the apps connected to it. Overall, for the value this TV just CANNOT be beat, and you'd be a fool to get any other TV in this size.

Reviews.Title: In-Freaking-Sane
Reviews.Author: BPP
Reviews.Content: I'm loving everything about this TV. If you're reading this review and it's buried under other reviews, you're just like me, you research the crap out of big purchases and especially you're TV. If you haven't seen it already, search this model on CNET for a full video review where they call this the best 60" for the price. On the topic of CNET's review though, I will add that I disagree with them on suggesting that the OS it runs on is wonky. If you want to see a smart TV with a wonky OS, check on LG. That thing is terrible! But I digress. I love this TV and doubt you'll find a better value (price vs product) in the market today.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great deal, Ignore the haters.
Reviews.Author: DanielBond86
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about getting this TV after reading some of the negative reviews, but I finally bought it and I'm glad I did. Shipping was free quick and easy, was delivered right into my apartment with no problems. Waited 4 hours before turning it on due to the temperature adjustment then began setting it up.  Before this I had a 42 inch Dynex and when I set up this new TV I was blown away at how much bigger it is, the difference between 42" and 60" really is bigger then you'd think.  Make sure you can be at least 6 feet away from the TV when watching, or else you'll feel like you're in the first row at the movie theater. The picture is great, incredibly clear and sharp when watching blu rays or even playing 720p games.  Sadly when watching HD cable it doesn't look as good (though not bad) but that is because HD tv is in 1080i and not 1080p like a blu ray is. A number of people have complained that the speakers in the TV suck or are no good, but I actually find them to be just fine, and since the TV is so big, the two built in speakers are pretty spread out so you get a full sound (though I do recommend buying or using additional surround sound speakers for the added benefit of a sub and more power).I didn't set up or use any of the internet apps because come on, that's not why I bought the TV and I have a laptop, phone and PS3 to do all that on. The remote is good enough, and the interface to use while messing with all the settings on the TV is real easy.  The only complaint I can think of about the TV is when you have the backlighting on (which you don't need on if you turn off the ambient light sensor) and the screen is totally black, you can see some kind of uneven lighting at the edges of the screen. This bothered/freaked me out at first because I saw other people complaining about this issue, but as I said before, just turn off the backlighting and it goes away, and even if you don't turn off the backlighting, as soon as something comes on the screen that isn't completely all black, it's gone.The smooth motion (120hz) looks awesome once you get used to it, but some people just don't like it so luckily you can turn it off easily in the picture menu. I've had this TV for a week and I'm still excited to sit down and watch a movie or play PS3 on it because its just so clear, big and makes everything into an immersive experience, and if that's not money well spent, then I don't know what is.

Reviews.Title: The Best Investment Ever!!
Reviews.Author: natasha dennis
Reviews.Content: I give this Vizio a 5 star hands down Product Rating on a customer satisfaction level.I bought this 60" Smart LED Razor thin Monster because I needed to upgrade. So I did.first off it came faster than a speeding bullet, and delivered by very nice gentlemen.  I love the television and the customer service.Everything is working a okay and it couldn't be any better. I will say that I had a Mitsubishi 60" and if this Vizio is a 60" as well the one of these televisions are misleading the consumers because My Smart TV is by far the largest 60" I've ever had LOL. I will be recommending this product to all of my Family members, FB friends, fellow cowers and students, especially to my mom and dad.if you're thinking about getting this Smart TV. . . . STOP and don't THINK just buy it

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV....
Reviews.Author: Akanksha
Reviews.Content: After much research for value and quality, me and my wife settled for this TV. Its great and we enjoy big picture from the comforts of our home.

Reviews.Title: TV turns off
Reviews.Author: Tanya M
Reviews.Content: Bought this at Costco for a great price! But it suddenly, without warning turns off. Sleep timer isn't set or on, etc.I called Costco and they said there's a recall on the tv. Guess I'm returning it and getting something else  :(

Reviews.Title: 60 inch vizio tv
Reviews.Author: Rodney sherrill
Reviews.Content: great tv should have bought it earlier would recomend this tv to anyone who wants a big screen tv . i love it

Reviews.Title: Great TV...it wont Dissapoint.
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this HDTV about a month ago.  I did a lot of research beforehand and almost went with a Panasonic but backed off because of glare issues.  Overall, I'd rate the TV 9/10.  Colors are super vivid, amazing.  Watching National Geographic on PBS is an awesome experience.  There is a lot of negative information on blacks. Well, black are blacks and Downton Abbey is dark show (a lot of dark rooms and black suits) and I used it to tune in the color (black level).  Overall, black level is fine with me.  I could tell from one episode to another that Downton Abbey changes the lighting in each room.  Overall, black level is not an issue with me.  Watching any TV show, sport, or Movie will not disappoint.  The TV show Survivor is so vivid you might as well be there on the beach with them.  Now if TV channel isn't High Def you wont see high definition and you can't blame that on the TV. In regard to sound, I was pleased.  The glare is minimum.  There are a total of five windows in our living room.  I ended up using the pre defined sports option to watch shows and turned off a majority of the options to find a picture that is pleasing. In regard to set-up, it couldn't be any easier. You hook up a few wires and the TV autoscans channels.  The netflix/amazon/youtube options are great.  The Netflix wifi options pulls in a better picture than our ROKU.  The remote is award winning.  You'll see once you begin to use it. The TV is 120 hz and basketball and Daytona 500 came in with precision.  No speed issues.  Personally after reading numerous reviews I can only assume that competitors are posting bad reviews on this specific TV because in my honest opinion, it is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Steven Ross
Reviews.Content: This TV is great there was no problems what so ever with it. Great Buy!!! I would absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Jacob Vasquez
Reviews.Content: Great tv for the price! Super thin, great picture and the smart features are great. Keyboard on remote really comes in handy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy
Reviews.Author: Merle Pierce
Reviews.Content: Great buy, Great Price, excellent running tv, wish I had cable internet cannot use all the features, but it gives me everything I need and wanted... Thanks

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: sk25230
Reviews.Content: This was a great buy online and the TV works and looks great. I cannot imagine a better price point product for a smart TV of this size.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Jason P Mayforth
Reviews.Content: This is a great television for the price.  This tv was easy to setup and looked absolutely amazing right out of the box.  It has a great remote with a keyboard on one side.  It makes it easy to use the tv.  You could not ask for a better 60 inch for the price.

Reviews.Title: Super great picture and price!
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I have had a Vizio 47" flat screen for five years and it has been perfect. I wanted a bigger screen so I went Vizio again and I am not disappointed at all. It is slim, beautiful and perfoms like a rock star. great price too compared to other brands with a 60" screen.

Reviews.Title: Slow Refresh Rate
Reviews.Author: John Lardner
Reviews.Content: TV overall is excellant however there is a slight problem with the refesh rate.  A slight blur if the picture.

Reviews.Title: nice picture
Reviews.Author: suxiaoxiao
Reviews.Content: i like it so far. will see if it lasts long, but the pic and sound are good, I don't feel i should pay more for any other brand name if the brand really means much these days for TVs.

Reviews.Title: Works and Looks Great!
Reviews.Author: Dan Z
Reviews.Content: Amazon brought it into my house and tested it.  I put on the stand and everything works perfectly.  Great picture, connected to my wifi easily.  Works great!  I've had Vizio's for the past five years and I've never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I dont know a lot about electronics but I like it. It's very big and beautiful =) My first tv was a Vizeo and so far that brand has not disappointed me.

Reviews.Title: Amazballs!!!
Reviews.Author: Joseph "joseph curcuru"
Reviews.Content: Best TV ever!!!Recieved it and everything about it is great!!!It looks and sounds amazing!!!I recomend this tv to everyone.

Reviews.Title: 1 month in...
Reviews.Author: Jesse Robinson
Reviews.Content: I paid exactly 888$ and not a penny more for this TV. It looks great, the Wifi works great and it has a nice sleek frame which keeps it from being bulky. Looking for a good value with good results, then look no further. Great Buy!

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Rick Hoss
Reviews.Content: Great picture.  Was easy to program audio and video systems.  I would highly recommend this product as price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy from Amazon warehouse deals
Reviews.Author: Mud
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Amazon warehouse deals. It arrived in a flimsy generic box surrounded by two small pieces of foam. The description said it had only minor imperfections. The TV was bent i.e. concave  by about 3/4". This was NOT a minor defect. If anyone at Amazon warehouse had looked at it for more than 30 seconds they would have seen the defect. Took 4 weeks to get the shipping company to come pick it up and to then get my refund. A huge waste of time.

Reviews.Title: We loved it ....but disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Mandy's Mom
Reviews.Content: We received the Vizio E601-A3 60" tv on Monday, February 4, 2013. We were very excited about it and it really looked great in the corner we set it in. We had no complaints until two days later while we were streaming a movie from Netflix the sound suddenly went up to full volume and the tv started making a loud popping noise. We turned the tv off and started the movie over and all went well. We had no more problems until three days later while watching the evening news, the same thing happened again. We turned the tv off and right back on again and it seemed to be okay. We decided if it happened again we would just change channels and see if that straighened it out without having to turn the tv off. About ten minutes after the State of the Union address came on, it happened again. I used the remote and went up a channel. The loud noise and loud popping sound was still sounding but the screen went blank. I tried to use the remote to change channels. Nothing happened. I tried to turn the tv off with the remote and it would not respond. The remote was totally useless. We had to turn the tv off with the button on the side of the tv. All this happened within eight days after we got the tv. Needless to say, I contacted Amazon and returned the tv. Right now we are just undecided about which tv to try next. We really loved all the features about this tv, especially the remote control with the qwerty keyboard, but we might just wait until the new Vizios come out in March or April and try it again.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV. Couldn't be happier!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: After doing plenty of research, I was zeroing on a 60" Samsung or Panasonic. I stumbled on this TV and never looked back. I wasn't sure about Vizio, but I'm now a loyal fan.There are plenty of great reviews on here, so I'll call out the few things that have really stood out to me:- The cost. Incredibly affordable.- 4 HDMI ports- Image quality- Built in 802.11n- Built in Netflix (especially after hauling the PS3 from room to room)- Full keyboard integrated on the remoteAlso, check out the review by Kris, the one that has the most "helpful" responses, and use those image settings. It makes a big difference.  The picture is much sharper, brighter, and deep this way.One other thing I've learned since getting the TV,  the firmware will be automatically updated once the TV is connected to the internet.  There is no way to manually download or get the firmware pushed to the TV.  My TV updated to the latest firmware within 24 hours of setting it up. Piece of cake!Can't recommend this TV enough!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Zach
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at a local best buy after price matching the 888.00 on Amazon, it's not comparable to the as sings and sonys out there, but for a 1/3 of the price I think I can handle a bit of missed colors and slight balance issues. I had to use some settings I found online to brighten up the picture, otherwise it's a bit dark. Great tv.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV, enhanced delivery service not so much
Reviews.Author: John Richards "John"
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a chance to put the TV through its paces, so this comment is mostly about Enhanced Delivery. It was supposed to include: "deliver your TV to any room suitable for testing, unpack it, ensure that it is working properly to guarantee no damage occurred during transportation, and dispose of all packaging material." The 2 delivery men did carry the package to the desired spot in my house, but none of the remaining services were done. Being a techie, this did not bother me since I enjoy unpacking a new gadget myself. But there could have been undiscovered shipping damage, and I was lucky that there wasn't any.

Reviews.Title: my review
Reviews.Author: Gregory Carpenter
Reviews.Content: works greatjust what I wantedwould reccomend this to any one that wants a vizio or flat screen tv

Reviews.Title: Everything I expected
Reviews.Author: Happy Camper
Reviews.Content: Extremely easy to set up.  Remote is simple and highly functional.  Picture and sound are great.  I have been looking to "step up" for quite some time, I jumped on this when Amazon offered it for $888 with free shipping.  I continue to see this TV advertised for $999 elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Incredible
Reviews.Author: joshua m graham
Reviews.Content: Perfect quality - feels like everyone is on the room with me!!!  Great quality for the price ....get one - you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: fabulous picture
Reviews.Author: OCreviewer
Reviews.Content: i don't understand the criticism of this TV.  We have had this set for about two weeks and it works flawlessly.  The picture is indistinguishable from sets costing twice as much.  One criticism has been that the viewing angle is very narrow; my experience is that it has an extremely wide viewing angle.  we had a five year old Sony rear projection HD set; this one cost literally less than half as much and is a significantly better set.

Reviews.Title: Vizio television
Reviews.Author: Tarrika Alexander
Reviews.Content: This tv is so awesome, I didn't expect it to be so fantastic. It's nice and clear and the motion in it is out of this real, the picture is so real looking it looks like we're watching it right at the movie set.

Reviews.Title: 60 Inch Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: Jim Tiller
Reviews.Content: Wonderful product. At an amazing price, $1000. Thought it would be years before LED prices dropped this low. I now have three Vizio flat screen TV's. They are fantastic, and energy efficient.

Reviews.Title: Great TV! Picked one up last night at a local store
Reviews.Author: J. Haggard
Reviews.Content: I was looking to build up my entertainment room, I had a 32" tv and wanted something much larger. After standing in a big box store last night looking at the various options I came across this one. The picture on it was not good, but I figured it had to be the store had some funky settings. It was next to another LED Tv that cost around $200 more, but I went with the vizio anyways thinking I could change the settings to make it work.I got it home in the back of my honda ridgeline truck, it fit perfectly in the bed with the tailgate closed, we got it carried upstairs easily with the wifes help and unboxed it. The TV is massive and when you first turn it on it walks you through a setup wizard.Once the TV was up and running the picture was good, but not great. At least not for watching Hockey. I went into the settings and found the TV had many sport modes, but hockey was not one of them! Anyways, after flipping through the various settings I found the "Vivid" setting and that made the picture of the hockey games crystal clear, you could see the ice clear as day, including the skate marks across the lines. The player uniforms popped. It was really amazing how clear the picture actually is.I've only had this tv going on 24 hours now but so far I love it. Yes the sound is not phenomenal. It's not bad but I had a sound bar I hooked up to it and use that.

Reviews.Title: Very Good TV
Reviews.Author: Health Nut
Reviews.Content: This smart TV has lived up to its name.  It is very easy to use, and there are a lot of good apps.  With special buttons on the remote you can bring up Netflix or Amazon Instant Video in one click.  There is also a qwerty keyboard on the back of the remote for fast typing.The TV itself is very thin and looks great.  The picture and sound are both very high quality.  Vizio is one of the cheaper brands of TV, but even at its discounted price, it competes with the top brand names.

Reviews.Title: great deal for price
Reviews.Author: Martin L Baroni
Reviews.Content: It's great for it's price. Features on TV nice and simple. VIZIO will really push it's extended warranty on you.  My only issue was about delivery was late.

Reviews.Title: Great deal for a 60 inch Led TV
Reviews.Author: Diharduncfan
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is awesome.  Also the TV is energy efficient.  The only complaints I have was where the component video input was on the TV.  Its a little more than halfway up on the backside of the TV making it to high for my six foot component video cable to fit since my TV is mounted on the wall.  I previously had a 50 inch TV mounted on the wall without this issue since the component video input on the TV were near the bottom of the TV.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've ever had!
Reviews.Author: Jacob Richan
Reviews.Content: The picture looks great, stunning HD quality.To be honest, I didn't buy the TV for the internet features.  I was basically going for size and HD quality at a reasonable price, the internet features were more just a bonus.  After exploring the online content available, along with the general usability of the apps I was actually quite impressed and I'll occasionally use these apps over the apple tv apps.Hands down, I would highly recommend this TV.  I'm throughly satisfied with my choice.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Michael Evans
Reviews.Content: For the price and quality of the Vizio TV it just can't be beat.  Home Theater reviewed it as one of the top TVs for 2012.  This and the 70" version.Vizio E601i-A3 LCD: $1,000Hailed by reviewer Tom Norton for offering great value, the E601i-A3 is remarkably thin for the price, offers built-in Wi-Fi with access to popular sites like Hulu Plus, and sports back-panel connections that won’t hinder wall mounting. Video processing is outstanding and the set delivers a high-resolution image with excellent color, “knife-sharp yet natural detail,” and excellent black-level performance. As Norton put it, “What you get here is the sort of flat-screen performance you couldn’t dream of a few years ago—at any price.” (HomeTheater.com, Read Full Review)

Reviews.Title: Awesome set
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: Had this set for 3 months now. It is very nice. I love the remote and the apps. The kids love Youtube, they laugh for hours. The picture quality is good out of the box and awesome after some setup. The viewing angle is a bit limited, the color changes some and it takes a while to boot up. All in all this was an awesome purchase. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: TV is only half smart - no browser
Reviews.Author: TheDealMaster
Reviews.Content: Bought the tv 1/30/2013 from that big box store because I knew I could negotiate a $75 discount -  out the door for $875. In spite of several reviews detailing problem riddled experiences I took the leap. Of faith... It looked to me like most problems were related to sets manufactured towards the last half of 2012. My set was manufactured in mid January 2013 so felt a sense of confidence.  We will see.Out the box the picture did require some tweaking which was easily enough done using settings kindly posted here by another reviewer. One nice thing about this set is settings are unique to the input used, so your dvd could send different video characteristics than cable or satellite.This is marketed as a smart tv but it is only half smart since it does not have an internet browser. On the other hand using Netflix was easy to launch and streamed flawlessly through my wireless network - no hiccups whatsoever.  Speaking of wireless, that too was very easy to set up if not entirely intuitive but still easily enough done. Signal is very strong since the router is only 12 feet away.  Haven't used the other apps as yet.  I still want to connect the vga but only my desktop has that kind of connection and not practical to use that way.  I guess I'll research a wireless connection.Viewing from extreme angles is pretty darn good.  The resolution can be very sharp and I have to question the DirecTV signal input since my 46in Sony seems sharper on the same channel in some cases. That could be a function of my satellite which has a disengaged stabilizing rod that is causing some minor issues and will be reattached tomorrow. Hopefully that will correct what appears to be inconsistency between the two sets.Sound from the set is not that important to me since I have externalized it so I have no input there.  It sounded ok when I did open it up, though.I did call Vizio support for some question regarding initial setup and they were very helpful.Once again about the resolution, there are some tweaks in the menu settings that you must do to get the full HD experience. Initial viewing gave me some pause which gave way to relief after fixing.Less than a week in I'm pretty happy so far.  Maybe I'll kick to 5 stars after more exercise.  Those darn bad reviews scare me.
