I'm considering an extended warranty through Vizio.And thanks to all the other reviewers here that helped me with my purchase.Update 2/17/2013 - still working just fine.  Discovered that pausing netflix for maybe a half hour (dinner) the tv just turns off.  But no worries, after the 20 second boot up we were right back to where we paused (The Grey with Liam Neeson.  Don't waste your time, btw).  The blacks are not as black as my Sony but I can overlook that pretty much, not overly bothered by it.  Still trying to figure out what code works on my old Sony "learning" remote, RM-VL600.  Learning in quotes because the only way I find it knows a component is by the code only, as opposed to pointing remotes at each other to learn that way.Update 3/20/2013 - TV is still working just fine. As for the Sony remote mentioned above, there is a learn function I discovered and now it is a one button press to everything on and off - TV, DirecTV receiver and surround receiver. Another nice feature is connecting audio output from tv to surround receiver gets sound from whatever programming used.  In other words, if I am watching Netflix sound is routed to my surround.  Without that sound would come through tv because surround had no audio input.  I have directv audio connected to surround and tape monitor button on surround pressed to get Vizio audio.

Reviews.Title: Blank Screen
Reviews.Author: JASON
Reviews.Content: After only two (2) months my new tv screen went blank, with no sound or remote control options.  I made a report to the support centre and i am awaiting a positive response.

Reviews.Title: Love. This. TV.
Reviews.Author: AndrewN85
Reviews.Content: I was one of the lucky ones that got this baby for $688 on Black Friday Amazon Lightning sale and it has not disappointed. A 60 inch smart LED for $688, no tax, and free shipping and setup? Absolutely. The shipping carrier was great as well, came when expected, there were two guys and they took the TV out of the box and placed it where we wanted it.Setup was a breeze as well and after connecting to all of our devices this thing was up and running and amazing us in no time. We were a bit surprised by the clarity of the picture at first and unsure if we liked how realistic it looked. But after watching some shows and movies we were amazed.I cannot comment too much on the sound, it is fine for a TV but we use a Samsung Soundbar. This is my 3rd Vizio around the house and love them all. Never any problems and they just work. I don't feel the need to spend thousands more on comparable TV's. Definitely recommend not only this TV but the Vizio brand.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the HD and picture!
Reviews.Author: Jeff Allen
Reviews.Content: Was not looking for an apps TV but almost all of them have it anyway.  I was most concerned with the picture quality and the design of the TV itself.  It is a very nice looking TV on or off.  Mine is wall mounted, very easily done.  Pop off the bottom stand with 4 screws on the back and attached the new wall brackets to the back in 4 spots.  EASY.Picture is super high quality.  I was used to watching 46" Samsung 1080P LCD for sports, BD movies etc.  Not sure I will turn on the Samsung anymore for this.Best buy and great quality.  Can't speak to the apps but I do not care about this as I use PS3 interface and streaming music on the new Onkyo receiver.Bought it and love it.  Read a bunch of reviews about all sorts of TV's - decided to buy it and if I didn't like it I was going to take it back.  Got it at Costco just in case.  It's a keeper so far.2 weeks in - Streaming Amazon Prime, Directv - football, basketball & tennis, BD DVD's all look fantastic.

Reviews.Title: FADE OUT
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "book lover"
Reviews.Content: BOUGHT THIS TV ON THANKSGIVING AT WALMART WAS WATCHING TONIGHT AND IT FADED OUT AND THAT WAS IT NO MORE TV. IT STILL HAD SOUND BUT NO PICTURE THE BACK LIGHTING STILL WORKS BUT NO PICTURE. WISH I HAD READ KRIS'S REVEIW BRFORE I BOUGHT IT.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for family room
Reviews.Author: Robin Eldhardt
Reviews.Content: Nice TV used to replace a 46" TV.  It was light enough for me and husband to assemble and setup on TV stand.  The SMART TV is the way to go since it eliminated having a Blu-Ray player being tied in with another controller unit (a third controller) needed to operate the system.  The only problem is that TVs today don't come with an instruction book and having to use the internet to view the book is cumbersome.  Al in all, recommend this TV to other enthusists.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with our purchase
Reviews.Author: David M Layton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in the market for a new TV, and after going to the store and looking at half a hundred different models, we settled on the Vizio 60" LED Smart TV.I'm not gonna lie, it didn't have the same picture quality as a Samsung or Sony of the same size and type (LED/LCD/etc), but we wanted a larger tv as our couch is fairly far from our entertainment center, and we weren't willing to break our bank to get a better model.That said - without having the Samsung or Sony immediately next to the Vizio for comparison, I am absolutely thrilled with the picture quality.  This may be partially due to the fact that we were able to tinker with the picture settings, unlike the store display model which was on the factory default settings.We watched some South Park (not like that's a good way to judge picture quality, but whatever) and some Always Sunny in Philadelphia.  I was unsure about our purchase, however, until we turned off the lights and watched a handful of episodes of Game of Thrones with my sister.  The increased contrast you get with an LED tv was immediately apparent - the white wall shining clearly behind the men of the Night's Watch, clad in black.  The picture was absolutely stunning through the 4 episodes we watched.The SmartTV functionality works exactly as I'd expected, and it's very convenient not to have to power up the Wii every time we want to watch something on Netflix.  I read some reviews which stated that the remote and its keyboard on the back side felt cheaply made, though this was not my experience.  The remote wasn't anything special, but I don't feel like it will break if I drop it or handle it roughly.The only con to this TV is that the sound quality of the built-in speaker is pretty poor.  However, if you're spending ~$1000 on a 60" tv, you likely have already invested in an external sound solution.  If not, you'll want to spend a couple hundred bucks on a decent stereo sound system.Another thing to note is that I'm writing this review the day after we purchased it, and as this line of TVs from Vizio only came out last October, it's hard for anyone to really comment on their longevity.  For this reason, my wife and I opted for our retailer's 4-year extended warranty plan, but I will update this review in 3 months and again in 6 months or as soon as I encounter any issues with the product.In the end, I couldn't be happier with my purchase and wanted to add my voice to the others who say that this TV is the best 60" LED tv for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: johnny`s kindle
Reviews.Content: Picture is clear and love the price and that added plus is the smart tv.  The size is great for viewing tv.

Reviews.Title: Wonerful tv
Reviews.Author: Andrew J Peaden
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful tv.  It has a clear picture and is easy to use.  I would recommend to any one looking for a 60" TV.

Reviews.Title: Welcome to the age of Home Theatre for all of us!!
Reviews.Author: Lee Valesquez
Reviews.Content: More than likely CNET or Consumer Reports will say that some other 60-inch flat screen out there has a technically "better" image quality than this Vizio (perhaps for reasons that the majority of us normal folks cannot see or do not care about).  I think the picture is superb, bright, sharp, fast resolution (no artifacts or trailing).  Most importantly, and this is what's really the most amazing fact of all: this home theatre-sized flatscreen is currently priced at less than $1,000.  Considering how much time most Americans spend watching TV nowadays, it would seem like this is as important of a home appliance to buy as say a refrigerator, washer-dryer or other $1,000+ priced home appliances.  Do you want to be the only loser left with a tiny flat screen (or, God forbid, one of those Grandpa-style square tube TV's??).  Get with the times, dude, and get yourself a frickin' huge window to the world!

Reviews.Title: My husband is in Heaven!
Reviews.Author: shelly Rios
Reviews.Content: My husband loves this TV! It is $20 cheaper at Costco, but  worth it if you don't want to deal with getting into your car. We have it mounted on the wall, which makes it a little difficult to get to the HDMI plugs, but other than that, we are very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Technical Problems
Reviews.Author: R. Cummings "reycumm"
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I have been experiencing problems with my TV. It locks while streaming. Then it won't turn off for 15 minutes. When it does it makes a loud popping sound. We are reaching out to Vizio Tech Services. What a let down.

Reviews.Title: defect with the audio sync
Reviews.Author: Albert J. Angelo
Reviews.Content: I have been in contact with representative's from Vizio for over a week, because of a product defect. Still waiting to see what is going to be done about it.

Reviews.Title: A decent LED HDTV... for the price.
Reviews.Author: J. Corso
Reviews.Content: When Vizio announced they were releasing $999 (60") and $1999 (70") LED HDTVs, I'll admit I was excited. I've owned Vizio LCDs in the past and typically was impressed with the picture for the price. So when the 60" became available, I immediately purchased it. Out of the box, I thought it was OK. The picture quality was decent (not spectacular), the WiFi wouldn't stay connected to my network, and the application menu seemed dated and slow. I ended up returning it, disappointed.Fast forward a few weeks to Black Friday... when this TV became available for $688 at WalMart, Amazon, and other big box stores. For that kind of deal, I thought it was much more appropriately priced - so I purchased it again, at $688. Out of the box, the TV had 2 lines through the screen, again disappointed - I called Vizio and their customer service was actually great. They promptly sent me a replacement unit (brand new, not refurb) within a week.The new replacement they sent has been great, the WiFi connects perfectly and no screen issues. Overall, for the price ($688)... I really can't complain. Don't expect top of the line Samsung picture (D8000, ES8000), but more in the 6000-7000 Samsung model range. I've owned many LED TVs over the years, and I can say that for this is one of the best purchases you can make if you can find the lower price. So why the 3 stars? Be prepared for potential issues; lines through your LCD panel, WiFi not connecting, it seems Vizio may have rushed these out of their factory in time for Christmas without properly completing quality checks.Is it the best TV Vizio has made? Absolutely not - but again, for the price... it's tough to argue.

Reviews.Title: Great so far, time will tell...
Reviews.Author: skydiver30960
Reviews.Content: Only been up and running for about two weeks. So far, no problems, everything seems as advertised. Very much a fan of the Netflix and Amazon instant video apps.WRT delivery: I was originally told delivery would be delayed, and that I should email to set a new delivery time. I never received word back, and then the delivery arrived at the originally scheduled time. I'm glad we didn't change our plans after the original email. Upon delivery, the delivery person tried to convince my wife he wasn't required to set up and test the TV, just to drop it off. Fortunately, I had printed out the page on Amazon that explains what to expect on delivery. Once my wife called him on it, he did set up the TV and make sure it worked before leaving.

Reviews.Title: This is really a great TV
Reviews.Author: jpogar
Reviews.Content: Lot's of other positive reviews on this Television here.  I'm very pleased in every aspect of this TV for the price and in comparison to other brands of the same size.  They only minor complaint, if I had one, is the time it takes to turn on.  It's about 20-30 seconds to turn on after pushing the power button.  At first, wasn't sure if the TV was coming on, but now were used to it.  Great value, great TV, just give it a few seconds to warm up.

Reviews.Title: GREAT FOR MONEY
Reviews.Author: Jill Brady
Reviews.Content: GOOD PIC  SLIM DESIGN  AND BEST PART IS THE FRAME IS NOT 2INCHES ALL AROUND  1/2 INCH  SO ITS ALL SCREEN

Reviews.Title: Best TV and TV buying experience ever!
Reviews.Author: Joseph St. Pierre
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV following advise from a friend.  It was the first time buying a TV on line.  Experience was outstanding, TV was delivered and tested upon delivery as advertised.  The picture is the best of any TV I have owned/seen.  Push button NETFLIX feature is awesome.  Best purchase I made in 2012!

Reviews.Title: Best for the Price
Reviews.Author: Meir Sutton
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV quality for the price. The internet apps are ok - your probably still better off using a Roku for $50. The internet is tricky to get working on the TV and is not consistent. Otherwise really a great value buy. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Great Budget-Oriented 60" TV
Reviews.Author: D. Davidson
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty happy with this purchase.  I had some reservations but for the price this thing cannot currently be beat.The Good:- Obviously 60" is a huge selling point at this price.- Picture quality is as good as I had hoped.  With quality source material this thing looks really sharp.- I was worried about the sound quality (since I currently don't have my home theater setup set up) but it's actually about as good as you can expect from an LCD TV this thin.- This thing really is thin and the bezel is slim as well.  It's also pretty light for the size.- The packaging was well-done and the stand was easy to install.- Wifi works well and I have streamed a ton of content so far with zero buffering issues.The Bad:- It really does take a while for this thing to boot up.  Not a huge deal but it can be slightly annoying.- The apps are totally functional but not exactly state-of-the art in terms of their UI and they can be slightly sluggish.- No 3D support (which isn't a huge factor for me but might deter some).Apps:- Amazon app is great but only 720p.  There is also a frustrating thing where, when navigating, the app remains in the side-bar and it would be nice if you could navigate titles full-screen (like the Vudu app allows you to do).- Hulu works really well and the shows look great (though again they are only 720p).  The interface is nice as well and it's easy to load up your queue on your computer then burn through it on your TV.- Vudu is awesome.  The interface is actually pretty polished and you can browse titles full-screen which is nice.  Vudu HDX mode is 1080p and is noticeably better than Amazon's HD content (I bought the same show and compared them back to back).  The only downside is: HDX generally costs more.  I have a lot of content already in my Amazon library so I am pretty invested in the Amazon ecosystem and will not be making the switch.  However, for rentals, HDX is awesome.  A final note on Vudu: it is owned by Wal-Mart which might be a consideration for some.- YouTube looks pretty shockingly good on the YouTube app.  The YouTube app's interface is also pretty usable and it's generally speaking pretty easy to find the content you're looking for.- The other apps I found to be mostly useless.  I don't need to browse FaceBook, listen to internet radio, or check the weather on my TV (since I have other devices that are better-suited for these tasks).  I know everybody has different needs so these features could be important to you.Basically, if you are on a budget and want a huge screen that looks great with built-in wifi and apps this thing is pretty tough to beat.  If you care about 3D but want to stay within this budget you might want to sacrifice screen size and go with a smaller 3D TV.

Reviews.Title: best television i've ever seen
Reviews.Author: Patricia Grindberg
Reviews.Content: i love all the features. of this tv.. including the internet feature.. it's everything i was expecting and more.  couldn't ask for a better television.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: B. Lai
Reviews.Content: I'm not a TV expert, but this TV works great for me.  I have had 2 Vizios already and both are great.  They work better than the Samsung TV that I used to have, which broke down in less than 2 years.  My first Vizio is a 42" that is still working after 6 years and the picture quality is still amazing.  This Vizio TV is even more impressive, and the price is unbeatable.  I would choose Vizio over Samsung anytime, based on quality, price, and durability.

Reviews.Title: 60" TV
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: The picture is outstanding. Having the internet intergrated with the tv is a very nice feature. Anyone looking for this size tv should consider this product.

Reviews.Title: I found it and more!
Reviews.Author: Mo
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a nice TV for a cheep price for about 5 years now. I just wanted a TV that was around 50", LCD, 1080p and 120hz for less than $600-$700 or cheaper. I found it and more! This TV was bigger than what I was looking for. It is LED, 1080p and 120hz. 4 HDMI hook ups. It has all of the Internet apps which was a bouns I didn't care about those. And I was able to get it all for a really good deal on Black Friday. I paid less then the $999.99 but after getting the TV, I would pay that now. It's picture is amazing. The sound is great. I can see the picture from all angles. It is easy to use. Buy this TV if you can. I've only had it a month but so far so good. The only thing I've had an issue with was the remote. The one in the box was defective.It worked for about an hour to get the TV setup then quite. I called in to the support line and they ran through some trouble shooting and sent me a new remote. It was all very simple. My only other issue with remote is that it is not a programable remote. I can't run my cable box and DVD player. Why a TV remote wouldn't be programbable I think is stupid. Having to buy VIZIO's universal remote is just them being greedy. Otherwise I LOVE THIS TV!

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: william carpenter jr
Reviews.Content: Just as advertised Crisp clear picture. Easy to setup. Speakers not the best there is but I have SRS so sounds great now. I could not ask for more!

Reviews.Title: A Great picture
Reviews.Author: Reviewer LTL
Reviews.Content: A great picture....and extremely easy set up....particularly using HDMI cable....one cable makes it so much easier...and less tangles to contend with also.Thus far the only problem I have experienced is the audio not timed in perfectly with the lips moving....and, only on certain HD channels.  I understand there is an adjustment in the menu features that can fix this problem so wil be doing that soon.All in all we are very impressed....I'd do it again!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Music Lover"
Reviews.Content: This replaced a major namebrand DLP 61" HDTV that we've only had for 6 years before the power supply (we think) went out. To replace that would cost more than half of what this new TV cost.  This LCD is much more crisper, less expensive and lighter and more streamlined than the DLP.  It's also a ""smart tv with wifi".  I would say....just do yourself a favor already and buy this.  You won't regret it.  The seller was awesome also!  I requested a specific delivery date and they delivered on time.

Reviews.Title: Nice Addition to our Family Room
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: We have really enjoyed this HDTV.  It is perfect for areas where you need a low profile on the wall, as it is only 1" thick.  The picture is great and works well with our Sony receiver.  The only negative we have noticed is the TV takes a while to come on, or recognize components when switching.  Good value.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E60i1-a3 60-inch tv
Reviews.Author: Bill Garsee
Reviews.Content: The product exceeded all our expectations' great features' great picture' love it and would recomend it to any wanting a new tv

Reviews.Title: Big tv
Reviews.Author: Amfair856
Reviews.Content: It's nice but don't like how slow it comes on other then that love it and would tell a friend about it hope they will get one to

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money.
Reviews.Author: Christopher Brown
Reviews.Content: Great picture and amazing contrast.  The only problem I noticed is that the speakers were facing out of the rear of the set. This results in weird reflection of certain sounds.  I would definitely recommend a sound system or soundbar. Other than that I love the television.  Great pucture and sleak design. This is my second Vizio and I like it.

Reviews.Title: big and nice
Reviews.Author: Y LAM
Reviews.Content: For $999 (12/15/2012), you get a 60 inches flat screen TV. It is still a great deal, if you didn't score one from blackfriday deal.Vizio is not as famous as other Korean or Japanese brand, but it is as good as you can get for this type of TV.Remote feel comfortable and compact despite of its double sides. I was bit worry at the beginning, but this worry went away right after i hold it for few seconds.Some cons:TV start up time is slow, like 10 seconds.Smart apps is bit slow for my taste. But I bought this TV for its size not for the apps. I have other streaming device for that purpose.Factory pre-set default picture setting is not good, you almost for sure need to tune it. See Cnet review for calibration suggestion.WiFi reception seems week.My first unit from Amazon has a very bad blacklight leak on top edge, amazon exchange it for another set which has none of the problem. They shipped a new one and picked up the old one free of charge and get it done within a week, truly amazing and save me lot of hassle. Buying big screen TV from amazon is actually now a benefit not a burden.

Reviews.Title: Best TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: G. Boettecher
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV on Black Friday 2012 and am still ecstatic about it! I am the type who never reviews products either. The picture is amazing and for the $999 price it just can't be beat. I upgraded from an LG 50'' 720p plasma I bought 4 years ago for the same price. Let me tell you the picture quality between the 2 are night and day!! The Vizio blows the other HDTV out of the water I wanted a great picture without spending the $400+ for a 3D capable TV. I now many people who went that route and have only used the 3D feature a handful of times. I used the Cheetah flush mount system and with how thin this tv is it looks great against in my living room. The built in apps for YouTube and Netflix are great and the smart remote makes it very easy to navigate. **The one issue I have is lip syncing between the picture and sound. There is an option in the menu to calibrate this but does not work that well. I find that changing the channel and changing back usually corrects the issue.**

Reviews.Title: Havent seen better
Reviews.Author: Larry Carothers
Reviews.Content: Big and beautiful. Great resolution. Top of technology. Colors are realistic. Easy to use. Amazing how thin and lightweight it is, A sound bar is a must in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Best tv I've ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Terry L Rhea
Reviews.Content: I checked out a LOT of tv's but this tv offers the most features and best picture for the price range......You would have to be insane to go with another tv that doesn't have all these features......the picture is flawless, bright, vivid and breathtaking, especially when watching blu ray.....i just find myself more enthralled with the actual picture quality then the movie itself at times lol. definitely worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: Nice Unit
Reviews.Author: arcelton
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV last week and have it mounted and running.  The picture is outstanding and I have not found any major issues.  The remote seems to test my patience though, not always working on the first or second try. I bought a Cheetah mount and found that there is only 1 position that works with it and this TV.  If you have a limited space to put this in, be sure to carefully measure before putting the mount up.

Reviews.Title: Subpar picture and sound is off
Reviews.Author: Dave Knight
Reviews.Content: TV was returned.  For a few hundred dollars more, you can get a TV with much better picture quality. The picture is average at best (colors very dull and not crystal clear like our sony) plus the sound did not match the picture while watching a football game.

Reviews.Title: A LOT of BANG for YOUR BUCK!!
Reviews.Author: Big Papi
Reviews.Content: I don't think you can find a better picture for the money. I got free shipping and set up with my order and was very happy that they called to see if they could deliver the TV earlier in the day!! The set up was easy and professional. I really enjoy the bright and clear picture. I have only used the smart options a couple of times since I have a ROKU but when I did it was very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Third times HOPEFULLY a charm
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv at a great price back in December 2012.  Since then, when the tv has worked, its been great - but now I'm going to be on my third tv.  In February, the tv went black, fizzed out and that was it.  Called customer service, they were great and set up a replacement tv to be freighted (due to the large size) to me within 2 weeks.  The day that my tv was to be delivered, we got a call that the freight was stolen and they would have to set up another request - therefore ANOTHER 2 weeks.  Frustrating as it was, we dealt with it and had a brand new tv set up a month after the old one died.  Now here I am in August 2013 and the same thing happened to us - the tv fizzed out and died.  So now I am waiting for another tv to be freighted to me in 2 weeks - hopefully this one doesn't get stolen on route.  I told Vizio that the first time I was complacent about the issue, figured these things happen, but now I am pissed.  They replied back this was uncommon, however how does one person get two "lemon" tvs?  I wish I never got a Vizio honestly.  If you're deciding which brand to buy - go for the more expensive brand with a valiant reputation because it is not worth the aggravation!!!!

Reviews.Title: Loved the picture on first one until it died, loved the second one until it died!
Reviews.Author: Brian Carlo
Reviews.Content: First set up was easy with the channel search, time zone, and other misc programming.  EXCEPT, getting the surround sound to work for my tv input on my yamaha receiver.  I disabled the sound on the tv, but that still didn't solve my problem.  You had to go under some menue heading and change a setting that should not involve not having the tv send sound out to a brand new yamaha receiver.  I only found the solution at av forums.  It was such a pain.Second, the first one died after 94 days.  Black screen of death.  Bought it from costco, only 90 day return on tvs.  The costco csr got the serial number and said just take it back they will instant replace it.  She stated these models have a problem.  Awsome since they have like 30 on the shelf and people are buying them right and left.Third, second tv died 37 days later.  Black screen of death.  Called costco again, oh this serial number is not in the list of defective models, sent me to visio.  Visio csr by the book, no empathy, just read off the screen.  Stated will get new tv 7-10 business days.  I told him that was unacceptable.  He then began reading the delivery and process state by step day by day log on how and why it will take so long.  Informed csr that my yearly bonus was used to buy this tv and its the only one I have.  Csr said will not authorize replacement at costco or other retailer.  Asked the csr how he would like having no tv for about 2 weeks.  Csr didn't even say sorry.  Explained to csr that tv got great reviews until they started failling and that it might take months againt to figure out if my particular serial number is also bad.  Csr didn't even reply.  Informed csr that I will write this review and also on cnet.  Csr didn't say anything.I work in a call center, inbound csr.  I was expecting quality service, especially since thye boost its american tech support.  Csr just read off the screen and the scripting.  No emotion in the job, just another call, showed no empathy.  Never responded to anything I said except to reading the scripting on why it takes 7-10 business days to get a new tv.Because costco has the 90 return period, I returned the tv and got my money back in cash.  I will never buy a visio again.  Sad because the price was good, features nice, and image was 3d like.  Now I have to save up another couple hundred dollars to get the samsung.  Kinda hard to do when you pretty much break even.  Now I am out of a tv for a month or two and out a couple of hundred dollars.

Reviews.Title: BSOD (black screen of death) on Super bowl Sunday
Reviews.Author: MDG
Reviews.Content: Purchased tv on Black Friday 2012 at Walmart. Excellent tv for the price while it worked. Failed on Feb 3rd 2013 9:30pm EST!--BSOD. Picture went out,sound still heard. Turned off set,unplugged for 30 min.; restarted tv. Still no picture not even the Vizio emblem that appears on screen when the tv is first turned on. It appears this problem is becomming common on this model as these sets age. -check the internet. Luckily for me mine still falls under Walmarts 90 Day exchange or money back warranty and the set will be taken back today. Set was used approx. 6 hrs a day. First 2 numbers in serial number are 41  Good Luck

Reviews.Title: Awsome!
Reviews.Author: bob curtis
Reviews.Content: Very clear picturee! Couldnt ask for more! Only way to go! Researched all brands, this is the best for money!

Reviews.Title: Extremely Impressed!
Reviews.Author: Nicole M Bolin
Reviews.Content: I got this TV from Walmart...waited 4 hours on Black Friday for it and got it for $688.00. This was not the original TV I was going for. I originally was gonna go for a 50" Samsung which going for the same price because I have always stuck with Samsung as I have always had good quality stuff from them, and I was not familiar with the Vizio brand. My husband talked me into changing my mind and I COULD NOT BE HAPPIER!! I am soo very impressed with this TV! It's only about an inch and a half thick so it takes up very little room, and the picture on this TV in mindblowingly awesome!! Everything from HDTV, to HD DVD's, to Video games, just look so very clear and detailed on the TV I almost can't beleive it! The smart capabilities were very user friendly and work very well. We can do so many things with it we couldn't do with a reguler TV. For a TV that is lower priced than other TV's sold in the same category (which I assumed would mean it was cheaper in quality, of which I was very mistaken)it is excellent quality and value! I will definately reccommend this TV to others!!

Reviews.Title: Grabbed this on BF; best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Bruce
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to pick this up for $688 at walmart, but make no mistake, this TV is most certainly worth the $1k price tag.  The picture is sharp and can rival most 60" class TVs, blacks leave something to be desired, but that is to be expected.  You are going to need a sound bar/sound system as it does sound tinny, but for me a TV is entirely for the picture anyway.  Haven't delved too far into the smart apps yet, though setting up wifi was a breeze and netflix works like a charm.  To be honest I'm still in shock I snagged this for such a good price.  Gigantic, beautiful TV for an amazing price; I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 1080p 120Hz Smooth Motion LED Smart TV E601i-A3
Reviews.Author: WhoMe
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Wow..sets up super easy.  Connects like "right now" to WiFi.  Netflix WiFi interface is EXCELLENT.  Sound is really good on the wall mount.  I do have a JBL soundbar with woofer connected also.  Only use it for movies etc.  Day to day the built in speakers work well.  I highly recommend it.Cons:  This set replaced a Samsung 46" LCD/LED.  The picture is excellent but not quite up to the visual acuity of the 46" Samsung..  However, it is 14" larger so it is quite a task to keep up with the resolution on the much larger screen.  BUT, it still looks really, really good. At $500 to $1000 less than the competition...this set rocks.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E601i-A3
Reviews.Author: Esteban Gil
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item during the Sam's Club VIP event a few days ago. I would have purchased it from Amazon but I heard they will only have 24 available at the sale price (making it close to impossible to get one once it goes on sale)-The picture quality CANNOT be beat for the price I paid. it's simply stunning watching blurays or streaming videos with the TV's SmartTV functions.-Sound quality is BETTER than my old 46" samsung LED but still not very good. (I don't really care about this considering I usually use external speakers)-SmartTV functions are great for the price. No internet access and DLNA hasn't worked for me so far ( I havent spent too much time with it )unfortunately, I am giving the TV 4 stars due to clouding issues. First TV I purchased had some SERIOUS issues. I understand that it is an edge lit LED and not every TV is going to be perfect BUT this one had about 15 clouds all over the screen which made it very uncomfortable to watch in a dark room. Thankfully, I am on my second TV and this one isn't anywhere near as bad as my first.Overall, even at retail price, this TV cannot be beat when it comes to features and picture quality. Would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a big screen under 1000 bucks.Thanks!EDIT: I would highly recommend pairing this TV with the Cheetah Mounts APTMM2B. Just mounted it and it looks AMAZING on the wall.Cheetah Mounts APTMM2B Flat Screen TV Wall Mount Bracket for 32-65-Inch Plasma LED LCD TV

Reviews.Title: Perfectly adequate LED... but the key story is the price
Reviews.Author: BofJoe
Reviews.Content: Impressions out of the box are the TV is lighter and thinner than anticipated.  The picture seems plenty adequate (I am not the type who notices differences in one HD picture versus another).  Only criticism is the "Smart" aspects of the TV are somewhat clunky, and the response times for the set to recognize remote controls are a little longer than ideal.But the key here is the price - this box is priced way below competitive sets.  Margins must be razor thin.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Terrible Customer Service if you have problems with it
Reviews.Author: N3rd_4_Lyfe
Reviews.Content: Got this TV on black friday and everything was great. Fast forward 8 months and the video stops working but audio is fine. Turns out a batch of the Vizio 60 inch TV's had a bad chipset in them. I called Vizio and they knew the problem right away and said they would have a new TV to me in 10 to 12 days. At first i was impressed by how they handled the situation. 2 weeks go by and still i have not heard from the delivery company that Vizio uses (Manna Distribution). After two weeks of calling every other day to both Vizio and Manna Distribution trying to figure out why my TV hasn't arrived yet, and why i haven't received any updates I finally get fed up and ask for a manager. I get a delivery date between 12 - 4 pm on a weekday scheduled because they do not do night deliveries. After taking off work for this I get a call the night before saying the TV was delayed another 24 hours so I would have to take another day off work to wait for this TV. Keep in mind these additional delays are coming Over A Month after my initial request was put in for the new TV. After more calls and complaints i get a night delivery scheduled instead. Finally got my TV over a month later. All in all I spent probably a good 12-16 hours of my own time over the course of the month with Vizio and Manna trying to figure out why my TV was not moving.** TLDNR **Pros: TV Quality is excellent, remote with full keyboard is very handyCons: Customer service is a nightmare, good luck if you have to deal with Manna Distribution - you will need it.

Reviews.Title: Don't expect it to be good, or reliable
Reviews.Author: Lance B. Udasco
Reviews.Content: The TV is thin and light, which is nice, but it is also to be expected with this kind of TV. That is where a lot of the quality ends. There is a lot of hot spots on the tv where the LED backlighting shows through brighter than other spots. It takes a lot of adjusting with the backlight and contrast setting to get this somewhat resolved.Following that, don't expect it to last long. I had a 52" Mitsubishi DLP that aside from bulb replacements is still going strong 5 years later. This was delivered on 10/22/2012. IT BROKE, yes BROKE on 1/23/2012. It lasted a whopping 3 months!While Vizio customer service was very friendly (And in America, which goes a long way) to get a replacement TV is still 9-13 days. To get parts to repair it is 5-6 days. The Super Bowl is 10 days away. Great!This is a TV that will do if it has to, but don't expect to be happy with it. When your friends ask "How do you like the TV?" The best response you should be prepared to give is "Eh, it's OK I suppose."I WOULD NOT buy this again and I WOULD NOT recommend it.

Reviews.Title: crunels
Reviews.Author: crunels
Reviews.Content: I bought this television on Black Friday.  I had actually planned on buying this set at full price, $998, but when the Black Friday deal surfaced I had to jump.  The television was great at first.  I have read a lot of other reviews that stated the audio was faulty and I also experienced this, but I had a sound bar and the tv audio didn't really matter.  The picture and features on this set are great.  Unfortunately it didn't last for two months.  Don't buy this tv unless you plan on taking it off your wall and returning it.  I don't think Vizio has really figured out the whole LED equation just yet.  Hold off for now on their LED products.

Reviews.Title: Just love it!
Reviews.Author: DIANE FURST
Reviews.Content: I'm quite time challenged at the moment but I had to stop by and tell you this is an amazing viewing experience! I was concerned that once it was in my home I'd be disappointed (because it was the lowest priced of all the 60" models I saw) I was actually shocked at how beautiful the picture is especially compared to the LG it replaced. I loved my 40" LG but needed a larger screen for my new larger home. Vizio blows away the competition based on value for your $$. I've only had this a few days but will update if anything changes my opinion.

Reviews.Title: The needle in the haystack, look no further
Reviews.Author: Scott S.
Reviews.Content: This TV truly is the needle in the haystack.  It's only been on the market for 2 months and I was hesitant to buy at first.  I have now owned this TV for about a month and can't say enough about it.  60" Edge-Lit LED for under $1000?  Wow.  Amazing.  After killing the soap opera effect, everything from Movies to Sports to Games and Internet all look great on this set.  I'm actually typing this review using the TV as my monitor.  Out of the box everything worked perfectly, no dead pixels or DOA remote.  All HDMI ports work great.  Great picture from all angles!  It took a lot of playing around with the settings to get everything perfect so that you wouldn't have to change a preset for every different kind of show you were watching (sports, soap, movie or even games).  My settings are:PictureBacklight: 100Brightness: 30Contrast: 75Color: 75Tint: 4Sharpness: 0Color TempRed Gain: 128Green Gain: 123Blue Gain: 118Red Offset: 133Green Offset: 128Blue Offset: 123Advanced PictureSmooth Motion Effect: MediumReal Cinema Mode: SmoothNoise Reduction: LowMPEG NR: LowEverything else is Off.These settings makes the best out of colors; they pop and aren't dull or faded.  Football looks great, no ghosting.  Blu-rays look stunning.Your settings do not carry over to the next Input.  This can be good or bad, but I use the same settings across all Inputs.As for the apps, I now regularly use Amazon Prime's instant videos.  HD streaming is just as good as Blu-ray.  YouTube works well.  Those are the only two I've used so far, look forward to more.  Needs a browser app.The remote takes some getting used to.  Full QWERTY keyboard on the back is just the right size, even for large fingers.  Didn't have high hopes there...it's intended to be a remote, not a keyboard.  Backlighting would help, as using the keyboard in darkness is nearly impossible.  The control side of the remote isn't so bad, main buttons are easy to memorize.  Video control functions on the remote work with the apps so you can pause, fast forward, rewind (etc...) using buttons.Speakers are great, but don't expect them to be the latest and greatest; you can't expect a whole lot with the small bezel and slim-size.The only quirk I have is that it takes about 10-12 seconds to turn on after pressing the power button.Bottom line: this TV is second to none for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Black Friday Pricing
Reviews.Author: Diego the Reviewer "Doug"
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic TV at a great price.  Amazing how much TV you can get today compared to just a few years ago ... for the same price.Watch for prices over holidays however.************************************************************************* NOTE: This TV is on sale at Walmart for Black Friday at 688.00 *************************************************************************

Reviews.Title: Worst Experience
Reviews.Author: Ft. Washington
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV from Sam's Club.  Had it for 3 weeks. Picture was beautiful - sound not bad. By the third week only had half of a picture (picture was totally gone on the left side).  Called tech support - could not help. Was told to send a copy of the picture itself, picture of TV with the Vizio logo, and copy of the purchase receipt. Decided to return to Sam's.  Called for a return pickup - was told I would be contacted in 2 business days by carrier to schedule pickup.  Two days later no - call.  Called again for pickup was to told the same thing.  Called again two days later - was told may hear from carrier after Christmas.  Wanted to order another TV but cannot do so until I receive credit from this purchase.  Will not order any merchandise from Sam's Club that I have to have returned by carrier.  Would have returned to Sam's myself if it would fit in the car. Do not purchase from Sam's any item you cannot return yourself.  This has been a very frustrating experience.Update 01/05/2013:  Called on two other occasions and was told by Sam's the same thing - someone will call to schedule a pickup date. The carrier that Sam's Club used never contacted me for a pickup. Finally I rented a truck and returned it myself.  Have been trying to have this thing picked up since 12/17/2012.  This is ridiculous - never again will I order anything from Sam's Club that I cannot fit in my car for a return.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Worked for 50 days.  It had sound periodically not in sync with video.  Turning off cable box and then back on would fix audio sync for awhile.  Now has sound but no picture.  Vizio says they'll send a new one within two weeks.  Ouch.

Reviews.Title: Hope you love issues and bad customer service
Reviews.Author: Jon Haines
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV in an attempt to start supporting the domestic technology market.I've been a Samsung fan for years and have never had one problem with any of their televisions, but decided that as this was the last american TV company i'd send them my business.I have never been so wrong...The TV is INCREDIBLY short on hardware.  It has very little processing power for the host of apps it intendeds to make use of.  Long delays after button presses to access features, steaming apps will fail to to buffer and stutter or stop, and the TV will crash.The first one I purchased died in the first sixty days. I called the "award winning" customer service of Vizio and was told I could get a "recertified" model delivered to my house a week after I completed the information process.  So basically ten days for them to send me a TV that didn't sell somewhere else(they swear it isn't refurbished) all because the TV I bought blew up.  I instead opted to take the TV back to Sams Club and get a new one there.The new set has all the same issues of the old one, just has yet to die.  I called Vizio again asking about how to stop the steaming apps from crashing and stuttering and they put me through the old "Powercycle it!  No no, Clear the settings!  Set it factory!  Now powercycle it again!" bullcrap.  I tried to explain to the high school graduate technician I was dealing with that software and hardware related issues that were obviously causing this performance problem were not going to be solved by simply rebooting it.In the end, the technician told me "There are no other solutions I can offer you at this time."Basically, "We know it's broken, it doesn't work, sorry, we'll document your issue and maybe fix it later.  For now, too bad, so sad, Vizio."The technician swore the issue was absolutely unheard of by Vizio, despite the numerous posts on their own forums and all over the internet.In short, getting a solid TV with internet apps for around a 1000 dollars is unlikely.  Vizio tried to make that a reality but in doing so shorted various aspects of the process, resulting in this sub-par product.If all you do is watch Nascar and Football and want something huge to drink beer in front of, this may be the TV for you.If you want the full usage of the apps suite that a new age, connected individual would make use of, look somewhere else.TL;DRTV has bad hardware specs and is really slow, if you're just watching cable its fine, don't expect great streaming or functionality out of it.

Reviews.Title: BEST 60 inch for under $1000!!!!!
Reviews.Author: C. Alindog
Reviews.Content: I actually got this TV at Sam's Club during their Early Black Friday sale for VIPs. It was priced for $698 and it was definitely worth the 2 hrs. i stood in line for lol. I decided to purchase this TV since it's been 8 years since I've bought a new set (50' Samsung DLP)and for the price it just was too good to pass up. Not the prefect TV out there (but then again what is?) but for the price it just can't be beat in terms of what the TV has to offer. Smart hub from Netflix, Youtube (my fav.), Amazon, Hulu, just to name a few, 120Hz,LOTS of inputs and the picture quality is just as good as any other LCD tv out there. But the main thing was the PRICE.I ended up paying $810 out the door with tax and it also included a 4year warranty (1 manufacture, 3 year Sam's for $60). But I used a $200 gift card from which my sister-in-law gave me for an early christmas gift so i ended up only paying $610!!!!!! BEST CHRISTMAS GIFT EVER!!!!! So all in all i would recommend this tv to anyone looking for 60 inch for under $1000. Best Deal out there.

Reviews.Title: A Wonderful TV
Reviews.Author: J. Spencer
Reviews.Content: I like many recently got this TV from WalMart on Black Friday for 688.00 and yes it was a total STEAL!!! I along with others got very lucky at this price I admit, but the TV is absolutely worth the 1K that you are being charged here at AmazonThe picture is fantastic....it sets up very easily and the keyboard on the back of the remote is a major plus for entering information. With the thin Bezel it gives a nice clean look and using a low profile mount it looks fantastic on the wall.Now it is easy to expound on all the virtues of the tv which there are many but I will give you SMALL issues I did have with it because that is really what you are looking for right?1) the Standard picture setting you get out of the Box have to be tweaked as they are way too "colorful"....use the settings giving in here from Kris above as they are an excellent starting point and then tweak a little here and there to your liking. The problem I had is that you had to redo them for all the different inputs.....it isnt a one time fix. Once you have done them for the inputs though they stay2) the hook ups and power connector are set a little far in IMO and make it difficult (slightly) to hook things in when you are mounting on a wall. If you are going for a clean install you want to hide the cluster of wires behind the tv so they will already be sitting there and you have hook them up last. A minor issue3) my Biggest issue with the whole thing really is the remote.......it is a great remote to be sure as I mentioned above but I think it was short sighted of Vizio to not make this a Universal remote. I was going to buy a Vizio Bluray player also but found out that even though both of the remotes are basically identical one will not control both pieces of equipment. Something for them to think about......It would make the experience better if they made the TV remote a Universal and also promote brand loyalty4) the access to Netflix and Amazon prime is excellent and the experience with Netflix is what you have come to expect but if you really look into it, the content in Prime streaming is actually surpassing Netflix now. Example (for us 40-50 year olds) you can now stream Friends and the West Wing on Prime and you can not do that on Netflix.....so the issue is that the interface with Netflix is excellent for saving what you are watching and your instant Que......Prime really needs to make the interface better. you have to jumps through a few too many hoops to get back to where you were. Again a smallish thingAll in all a wonderful purchase and if you are in the market for a TV this size you simply can not go wrong with this TVand this is for you out there that think that a 60 Inch TV is too big for a bedroom.........its because you havent tried it. This thing is on the wall in my Bedroom and I am LOVING IT!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV while it lasts...
Reviews.Author: Wesley Davis "stellgod"
Reviews.Content: I researched this 60" for a long while, and eventually bought it on black friday from Walmart of 2012. Boy, that was a mistake. I was impressed, until it stopped working. The TV lasted 5 months until it was hit with the service bulletin outage. April 19th. It took Vizio over a month and 2 weeks to ship me a new one. So, I get my new TV on or around June 6th, and every thing is going great, until January 4th, and I have a green vertical line going through my TV, not every distracting, but I thought I should call Vizio however, and report the problem. Apparently, there's nothing they can do. My TV, which is new as of June, is out of warranty since I bought it in November of 2012. 2 TVs with manufacturer's defects within a year and 3 months. I was rather upset about it, but there's absolutely nothing I can do except warn other consumers over Vizio's HORRENDOUS quality. Google Vizio disposable TV if you want more information.tl;dr: Vizio quality bad.

Reviews.Title: Picture perfect
Reviews.Author: Smooth
Reviews.Content: Nothing else needs to be said about this tv...great quality, picture and sound it's an awesome buy. Get it today!

Reviews.Title: Stop reading and buy it!!!
Reviews.Author: DG Outdoors "Dave"
Reviews.Content: Stop reading and buy it! Best TV I've ever owned and I've owned a LOT of TV's. Mounted over my fireplace and easy to watch from anywhere in my living room. This is your TV!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Shame on Amazon for carrying such an inferior product. Avoid Vizio!!
Reviews.Author: Jasen
Reviews.Content: Remote does not work- sometimes I can't even turn the tv off!Tv pops and crackles with on/offTv displays "No input" even when there is an input.Buttons on the side of the tv do not work. (Esp within Netflix app.)Don't be fooled by this seemingly good deal, and low price. This tv is a piece...

Reviews.Title: Vizio recalled some of these bc TV goes BLACK!
Reviews.Author: Katie Sybert
Reviews.Content: This Tv was very hard to sync up the wifi when we first got it but after it was all set up we loved it.  Fast forward 3 months... We were watching TV one night when the screen just went black.  Went on to Vizio's website and found that there had been a recall on some of serial numbers and ours was one of them.  Vizio said they would send us another TV to replace our broke one.  Its been 2 weeks and Im still waiting.  Not too happy.  It was a great TV before all this extra hassel.

Reviews.Title: Died in 3 months - You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Christopher Glaser
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV off Amazon after I saw the cnet.com review that this TV had a great picture quality for the money.  It also one of the lower priced TVs that was WIFI ready and had a decent selection of apps (netflix, hulu, youtube) to take advantage of the WIFI.  The TV started out great, but there were two major issues:1) (Fixed) There was significant ghosting when watching sports, particularly when the ball (golf, basketball) was moving quickly across the screen.  Support was able to fix this by adjusting the "Smooth Motion" setting to off.2) One day, when we were watching the TV, it just went black.  The sound was still on, but no picture.  After unplugging it, resetting it, rebooting the cable box - everything, no luck.  We had to call support again and after reading them the serial number, they didn't even attempt to troubleshoot the issue.  They knew that this particular serial number had a bad component from one of their suppliers that they were already aware of.  However, no recall and contact was made to the customers.They are shipping me a new TV in 2 weeks as this is still covered under the 1 year limited warranty.  However, the 1 year is not being extended from the ship date of the new TV, it is still dated back to the original purchase date of the first TV, even though it is completely different unit.  They wouldn't extend this no matter how many times/ways I asked.I have 2 Samsungs in my house that have been moved from house to house, room to room over the years and still are working great.  This Vizio died in 3 months.  It had faulty components and they didn't let me know.  Now, I feel like I am rolling the dice with the new one - that it too will die because of some other cheap component that they use in an effort to save money so they can charge less for their TVs.  I understand that all electronic devices have a failure rate, but 3 months for a TV is too short a time in my opinion.  What would have happened if the TV failed in the 13th month after the warranty had expired?  I would have paid a thousand dollars to watch it for one year.I would go with someone else based on my experience.  Vizio did nothing to satisfy me as the customer besides comply with the warranty.  You get want you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy for DLNA streaming
Reviews.Author: pbarry00
Reviews.Content: The picture on the TV is borderline great and the Internet features are pretty good as well.  As expected, the sound is pretty lousy, but an easy fix with a soundbar or surround sound.The reason I'm taking time to write this review is to warn anyone that's looking to stream from their DLNA server to their smart TV.  While Vizio claims they offer this, I'd beg to differ.  Should your fie/folder appear on the third page or beyond when you pull your list up, you have about a 50/50 chance of the correct file being streamed to your TV.  After a call to support, the basically said DLNA is new to their TVs and they have no answer.  Debating whether to buy yet another device to properly stream through or not.  May end up shipping the TV back.

Reviews.Title: TV went dead
Reviews.Author: Tai
Reviews.Content: i bought 3 set of these tvs and 3 month later 1 went dead!!!!!!!Be careful, I bring them to Costa Rica...and now I have to figure out how to fix it..#&%

Reviews.Title: Rated low because of Vizio cust. service
Reviews.Author: sherry7340
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV in December, it was easy to set up and the picture is very nice. It didn't take long for the audio problems to start. First it was a lip sync problem then the sound would just go off then once a day the TV would emit a terrible high pitch sound. I called Vizio customer service and was told to do the reboot and other things but that didn't help. They told me I had to rule out a cable box problem which I did, but even then they would not help me and only wanted to do more reboots and trouble shooting. I called Amazon and found out I was still in my window to return the TV. Amazon was WONDERFUL! No questions asked they just took my information, set up delivery and I had a replacement TV on the way. I have to say that the replacement TV is working well (although there still is the lip sync problem) and I would give the new TV a 4 star rating if not for the Vizio service. But if I could give Amazon service a star rating it would be 5 plus because they were so helpful

Reviews.Title: Vizio screen turns black but sound works
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: It's not wiring. I bought the vizio led 60 inch on Black Friday and 2 months later while I was watching it started turning black from the top left corner then slowly worked its way down to the bottom right. I turned it off and on again and nothing but the sound was working so I knew it took a crap on me. I took the tv back to walmart and exchanged it for a new one, this was a few weeks ago and tonight the day before the Super Bowl it again did it again. I'm having a big Super Bowl party and this happens so I took it back once again to walmart and now they don't have any in stock. After calling every walmart in sacramento just to find out they're all sold out. If you buy one make sure u buy the extended warrenty. Thank u vizio for costing me more then I saved on back Friday and making me look like a fool tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware!!
Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: Let me start saying that yes, at the beginning the price, the seemingly good reviews and all the offers seem like a can miss offer. But it isn't.This tv is an absolutely failure of product. At first everything seems fine. Then you'll start to notice the lip-synch problems and you'll think that it's OK, you can live with that. Then it will be more noticeable and you'll needed to change the channel. No problem, you'll say, only happens while watching TV.After some weeks you'll notice that the TV starts to look a little more obscure at times and a couple of seconds later it will return to normal. "no problem".But, after only 2 months of use you'll be watching TV and suddenly it will turn off by itself and that will be it, it's gone. Then you'll contact service and the best thing they can offer is to send a technician and that can take up to a month.So you contact amazon and let them know that the product you purchased have gone dead before even 3 months and you want your money back. Luckilly, amazon having the great service they have, tells you that sure, no problem, they'll send someone to pickup the tv and they'll refund all the money you paid.So, that's happened to me and a increasing number of other people. The word is that vizio rushed this product to make it available to last (2012) black friday so it wasnt tested enough. Either case, honestly, please avoid the hassle and don't buy this product. Invest a couple of extra bucks and buy a better tv that wont have you feeling increasely frustrated over time seeing how it goes worse and worse.

Reviews.Title: Failed.. Red,green lines after three hours of owning the tv .
Reviews.Author: Brandon Esparsen
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my TV  this is my third 60 inch tv in the past two months the other two were a 60 inch LCD Sharp Aquous and the other a LED Sharp Aquous and this Smart tv blows those two out of the water and its cheaper in price. It has a nice Qwerty keyboard on the back of the remote. the remote has a good feel to it. the apps on the tv are nice and have easy access. The picture is great, my wife was blown away by it,Edit:  we'll I thought this tv was great not even a few hours after writing the previous review the tv failed... It has red,green, lines thru the whole picture it's completely distorted .sending back probably get a Samsung .. Too bad it was nice for a few hours...

Reviews.Title: Warranty
Reviews.Author: Bob F
Reviews.Content: I purchased this VIZIO E601i-A3 TV on Thanksgiving 2012.  For the 1st 68 days it has been superb.  It has left nothing desired as far as an HDTV could provide.  I have found both the video and audio good.  I have not tweeked the video settings as it came to me.  I found no need to seek improvement.  I have the choice of running the sound thru a BOSE home entertainment system, but actually prefer the TV's voice sound.  I especially like the remote.  One of its best features is the WIDE button in the lower left hand corner.  With current TV formats being delivered in different sizes, it is nice to be able to select the picture expansion choices, there are 4 choices, quickly and easily.  One of the main factors in my selecting VIZIO over other brands, is that their customer technical support is in UTAH, USA.  Without prejudice, I felt that if the time should come that I might need to talk to them, I would be able to understand them.  Well the time came, and it was a great experience.  I had forgotten how good customer service could be.  The video went out today.  I spoke to Liz at their support center.  In a 10 minute call, max, she had me unplug the TV, hold the ON button in for 30 seconds, plug it back in, turn it ON and see that the screen was still a deep blue.  From that she determined that they would send me a new TV, via freight, set the new TV up, repack the old defective one and take it away at no charge.  I do not know how I could ask for more.  I also asked her, from her experience, how often does she see this problem.  Her answer is that approx. 1 in 100 experience a bad video card.  I would like to rate this TV 5 stars, but I quess that would seem wrong, since it has quit working.  :-)  BobF

Reviews.Title: Stopped after 2 months
Reviews.Author: AMD0323
Reviews.Content: I bought this at Sam's for a black Friday deal and yesterday my husband informed me he screen went out.  We've owned it just over 2 months.  So we're taking it back to Sam's.  Be warned!

Reviews.Title: Not as impressed.  On to 3rd time around
Reviews.Author: Regular guy
Reviews.Content: After looking at all the name brand TV's for several months we finally pulled the trigger with the Vizio.  We were going to go with the 55 inch but the 60 inch came on sale now before the super bowl.  Got the TV home and it shut itself off within 2 minutes.  In the spam of a 30 minute TV program it would shut itself off 3 times.  While watching the playoff games it shut down 15 times.  After two calls to customer service (which were pleasent)  they could not solve the problem and we took the TV back.  The second one has been fine so far. No problems and the kids and adults love it.What to like:1) Picture quality is quite good.As other reviews state you do have to play with the settings to get a good picture that is specific for your room.  I read several review stating to use the "vivid" mode.  This ended up being way too bright and made the colors run.  We are happy with the standard setting.  Honestly unless you have two TV's side by side it is hard to say that this is better or worse than brand name Samsung or Sony.  Watching sports or HD programming is very clear.  Just make sure to turn off the "soap opera effect".2)  Remote.Having the qwerty keyboard makes typing everything in for internet use and for setup very easy and quick.  Since we have young kids and watch most tv at night having the keys backlit would have been nice but not a deal breaker.3)  PriceHow can you go wrong for the price for a 60 inch smart TvNot so good:1) Time to turn onIt take about 15 seconds for the tv to turn on.  Not a huge problem just something some people may not like.2) Stand.We bought the tv with plans to mount it so it doesn't affect us but for those who are going to just use the stand make other plans to stabilize it.  This is a big Tv and it is very wobbly on the stand and could be easily knocked over by kids or pets  .Summary:  All in all the TV works great.  The picture is good and functions are easy to navigate.  Outside of a couple minor annoyances you can't go wrong.***first update** 11/12/13Up until now the TV has been fine but on Sunday the kids were watching morning cartoons the TV screen went black never to return.  The power light will come on and after 10 seconds it dims but no picture or light comes onto the screen.  After reading other reviews about a faulty video chip we were left with two options.  Either wait around for Vizio to send out a repairman or just return it back to Sams.  We opted for the return route.  I am changing the stars that I gave it initially because this will now be our 3rd Vizio 60 inch and we a not sure the quality of the TV is going to going to make it a good deal from a price stand point. Hopefully this new one will last longer than 10 months.  I have noticed that the picture is good but our 8 year old Phillips does give a sharper picture.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Turbo87
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for 4 months and I have no complaints at all! It's huge and the picture quality is unbelievable! You can't go wrong with this Vizio product!

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Gengarr
Reviews.Content: Had the tv for three months and now the power comes on but no picture.  Called Vizio and they did all the troubleshooting over the phone.  Will not work.  A new tv will not be delivered for 14 days!!! Thats ridiculous.  I will not have a tv for the Superbowl.! Really? Why not refund me my money so I can get a new tv asap...  Also the original delivery company was a NIGHTMARE! Something to be said about buying big ticket itemd at a local big box retailer...

Reviews.Title: Defective TV Replaced With Another Defective
Reviews.Author: Terry keyes
Reviews.Content: I have owned this TV for 2 months now, purchased it on black friday. Right out the box its is very nice. Slim, sleek, shiny, very good looking TV and that continues after you turn the TV on. Beautiful colors, HD, great settings to tune TV how you like it. I am in the middle of getting a replacement because I have no picture or sound anymore. Vizio tech support was useless and they offered to send a repair man out in 6-10 days but I don't feel comfortable having someone who is probably poorly trained opening my TV up and touching things so I requested a replacement from Amazon due to defectiveness.Pros:Beautiful PictureUltra thinSmart TV is awesomeCons:Besides having the defect there are really no cons. TV froze a couple times while using apps but a quick unplug fixed that. And it can be expected by any smart tv. Just a little bummed out I have to go a week without my beautiful TV =(UPDATE 1/25/2013!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!I received my replacement for my original TV that was defective on 1/22 and have already had problem with the new replacement. The audio glitches up and stops works. I turned the TV off with the remote and I am unable to turn it back on until it makes a few *popping* noises that sound like its coming from the speakers. This has happened 3 times in throughout the few days I have had it and I have already filed for another replacement. It my second replacement is not functional I will be returning for a money back refund. Be careful, very high failure rates on these sets. Thank god Amazon has great customer support and policies!

Reviews.Title: Two TVs Both Failed!
Reviews.Author: CTR94
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV at Walmart on Thanksgiving. Two days ago the picture went out. Still had sound, but no picture- even though the screen was still back-lit to some degree (kind of a blue glow). Called Vizio customer service and they walked me through a reset which did not solve the problem. They offered to send someone out to repair it. I said thanks but no thanks. Considering it is only a month and a half old I would return it to Walmart. Walmart, after a little persuasion, agreed to an exchange. We took the first set back yesterday and exchanged it. I set up the new set this morning and, right out of the box, it has colored vertical lines running through the right 1/3 of the screen. Needless to say, I am very upset. I am returning this and getting my money back. I have a 32 inch Vizio that we have had for over ten years without a single issue. I don't know if Vizio tried to rush this product out in time for Christmas or what the problem is, but their quality control department needs to do a better job as this experience has insured I will never buy another Vizio product again!Update - We called Vizio customer service again to report this second failure and they were thouroughly unhelpful and almost rude! Basically just "Sorry, you have that kind of thing with electronics sometimes, deal with it." I'm paraphrasing, but that is the gist of it. This reinforces my earlier statement I will NEVER buy another Vizio product!!01/20/2013 - I have replaced this unit with a 60" Sony Bravia from Hhgregg and I absolutely love it! Required NO modifications to the picture, it was perfectly calibrated right out of the box. The TV speakers aren't great, but when are they? That's what I have external audio for. This was actually an open box, so I got it for $1,169. Almost twice what I initially paid for the Vizio(but $700 off suggested retail for the Sony and around $300 less than regular price), but after the problems I had with the Vizio and the stellar performance of this set, it is well worth it. Just thought this information might be helpful to someone. Sony KDL60EX645 60-Inch 1080p 120HZ Internet Slim LED HDTV (Black)

Reviews.Title: 32 day dead pixel issue/resolved
Reviews.Author: DobeLady "seashell7729"
Reviews.Content: Got it 11/28/12 and it was great, but on 12/31/12 suddenly a fine vertical red line appeared down the mid screen though everything else works fine. Email to Vizio and as of 1/3/12 they are sending out a new set in exchange-takes approx 10 days for carrier to schedule. That's what I call great customer service. This was a replacement for a Samsung that died at age 3 so now too surprised there is a problem with this one, seems to go along with big screen's. This time I purchased a SquareTrade 4 year warranty just to ward off evil spirits. Vizio says they want to hear about problems like this in the first 60 days, and ST says if Vizio doesn't resolve issues then they will get involved so I feel I have good warranty coverage down the road considering the TV cost. Otherwise, I would give it a 5 for the value & great customer support.UPDATE: 1-17-13- Manna Distribution delivered a brand new set in exchange for this defective set on 1/16/13, so only 16 days since first reported to Vizio, can't beat that, and I still have my Square Trade warranty to fall back on. This is a nice TV with good color,sound, ease of operation...works from my Wi-Fi for Internet Apps. I have not felt the need to tweak any settings on the new set at this point.

Reviews.Title: Yikes
Reviews.Author: howard
Reviews.Content: This is my first time working with a VIZIO product. We bought it on Oct, 27th 2012 and the picture quality was decent when it worked. But it just decided to quit working altogether. Oh well, going to call their tech support and see what happens.

Reviews.Title: Poor TV
Reviews.Author: John "John"
Reviews.Content: Pro:BigCheap4 HDMI InputsSmartMinus:Bad blacksBad angle viewingBad for SD sorcesBad colors, screen has no gloss at all and it seems to kill colors.Overall I was very disapointed in this TV.  It does not have good black levels and SD content is extrealy poor.  I also noticed very poor view angles, as soon as you get a few feet off center the picture gets very bad.  I am compairing this to a older LG 42" LCD and a new Samsung 50" LED.  The Vizio had a worse picture SD, HD, etc than my old LG and we compairing it to my new Samsung 50" it was like night and day.This TV is only acceptable if you need size above all else.  And at that you would put this in a theater room that you will watch it only dead on with only HD sorces.  Alot of TV for the money just very poor picture and colors.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Pleased
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: I'm always a bit spectical when it comes to buying an off brand for big purchases, however Vizio has slowly made a name for itself. This TV is great, it looks good and the "smart" option is a definate plus, and it is at the right price.One negative: the refresh rate is too slow, it is not ideal for playing video games (per my boyfriend).

Reviews.Title: Remarkable value at this price point!
Reviews.Author: Graham
Reviews.Content: We are, perhaps, not the most demanding viewers.  That said, we find the picture excellent, with a wide array of adjustments available and feel we got a terrific deal at about $1k.  Rating is based on overall value of the deal.... not that this is the best one out there, just a great one for the money.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: AA
Reviews.Content: I bought mine from Costco for $ 929. Missed it on Black Friday where it was $698 at SAMs and Walmart. I rather pay $200 more than fighting crowd :). Well buying from Costco adds one additional year to warranty. Using Amex adds another and you can buy additional warranty for 3 years for 59.95. This adds 6 years for $60. Nobody can match that try it at Best buy or Walmart. Bought a Visio sound bar for 99 on sale, this is an excellent TV and at power with Samsung, Sony or Sharp. It is not fair of those who are comparing this TV to Samsung 8000/7000 series costing above $2500. This TV is as good as my Samsung 55 inch 8000 series which is $2700, yes Samsung is more vivid but this TV is close. Above all Visio is a very reliable brand compared to others. My Samsung is professionally calibrated by Geek Squad. Even than this Visio is excellent. One thing the stand is weak specially if you have children in the house. Use a wire to tie to wall, mine is going up the wall. Paid $27 for a mount from Amazon. My advise is go for it.....excellent choice and you will not regret.

Reviews.Title: Nice LED 60" HDTV under $1000 -- PROBLEMATIC !!!
Reviews.Author: Gadget Man "Phu Nguyen"
Reviews.Content: *** OK HERE IS MY UPDATE AS OF 4/30/2013.After just about 3 months of use, the Vizio TV has vertical dark line right at the center of the screen. These are probably dead pixels, or bad display driver. Brought back the TV to Costco, and guess what. They don't accept return after 90 days. They told me to call Vizio for support. Had to haul back the TV home. Today I downgraded by rating to 2 stars/5.Keep tuned!==================================================================================================Got the Vizio from Costco this weekend of Dec 2012. Brought home, and replaced my 52" 4 year old Samsung TV. Didn't buy another Samsung because of the service and LCD panel problems, but that's an entire different story. For the short term, no more Samsung TV please.The Vizio picture quality is stunning, both in terms of contrast clarity and vibrance. Watched ESPN football on this, and wow - amazing colors. Used its scanner feature to scan off air channels from HDTV antenna.Then tested the apps, Netflix worked beautifully, amazingly sharp pictures. The kids love watching Netflix on this TV. My son as I am sure will play PS3 COD ... and will love it.The audio is pretty good too, considering it comes from this 1" thick TV... not much room to squeeze in decent speakers. Hooked up optical audio to my audio booster, and wow- got home theater 6 channels :-)What I liked about the TV:1. Picture quality with sharpness, clarity and vibrance.2. The best 60" you can get under $10003. Smart features including Netflix, Youtube, etc4. USB ports that allow me to watch photos, videos, and listen to music off my USB thumb drive.5. Wifi and internet hook up.6. Low power, only estimated $17 per year electricity usage.What I hope Vizio will improve:1. The base/stand should swivel some angle so we don't need to move the base with the TV. The screws are kinda flimsy and weak.2. The mechanical design overall could be better, smoother, and more sexy. The outside plastic looks plain.3. Boring look, and cheap appeal.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: Wow.  What a great TV.  Picture and sound quality are excellent out of the (huge) box.  Easy to set up.  The 2-sided remote  is a very convenient way to access the Internet apps. (One side of the remote is a QWERTY keyboard that's easier to type on than my iPhone)  4 HDMI inputs are a big plus, too. An unexpected bonus: I was also thrilled to see that the estimated annual energy cost is only $17.00.There may be more expensive TVs with better-rated picture or sound, but after watching this set, I doubt that it's anything I could see or hear.  A terrific value.

Reviews.Title: My first ever BIG SCREEN TV
Reviews.Author: Anthony Stoner
Reviews.Content: Day 2. I bought mine at Target November 28th 2012. $1149.12 with tax and 3 yr in-store warranty. First one i got was damaged so i took it back and returned it the very same day i opened it up. Easy as pie return. this thing is huge. It will fit on a smaller stand as long as you think it will hold the weight. over time your stand may sag so in my case i reinforced my press wood  china thing i already had. if you get this tv and it's in the open or you have kids you would be better off getting a 60 inch stan so people will be forced to walk around the stand thus keeping someone from hitting the edge and possibly knocking it off.i noticed some people say the apps are slow to load. in a way i guess they are. BUT, are they comparing it to their phone? i personally do not have a cell phone at all so maybe,maybe not. the apps are not quick and scroll at the bottom of the screen and load times for those i would say are 30-40 seconds. when you decide the one you want to use there is a load time to consider. in this case i would say another 20-25 seconds. it does "seem" like a lot of time but for me i'm ok with it.my living room is 19 feet by 13 feet wide. the sound out of this thing as great for me and it's not even half-way up. i got a blu-ray surround sound home theater system on the way and now i wonder if i really needed it. also this tv has the hdmi (arc) feature on it. an audio return component i think it's called and if you want to use that feature MAKE SURE YOUR HOME THEATER SYSTEM HAS THAT FEATURE ALSO.packaging is easy to remove and all there is is a stand and 3 screws to put in....your done. mine is hard wired to my router for internet so i don't have problems that other people
