That was around Dec. 17.  The vizio died on Feb.14 as I was watching.  The picture simply disappeared and gave way to a dark blue background.  However, the audio remained.  At first I thought it was the signal from the satellite, but when the tv would no longer respond to remote commands I knew there was a more serious problem.  I had experienced a problem with audio sync early on with only one channel, but that seemed to resolve itself.  Lately, the sound seemed to be fading as I had to keep turning it up to hear the dialog in shows.  After I lost the picture I went through a number of trouble shooting processes to no avail.  I lost the audio during one of the processes leaving me only with a blue screen and a tv that would only respond to on and off.  I proceeded to the online reviews and was shocked to discover that many experienced the same problems as me.  I had done all the research prior to ordering this product and had I accessed the reviews just one more time on Nov. 26, before pushing the order button, I would have found the first indications of what was to come.  I contacted the service department at vizio on the morning of the 15th and was pleasantly surprised with the reps responses.  He acknowledged the problems and assured me they would not occur with the replacement tv coming my way in the next 8 to 13 days.  On Feb. 28 the new tv arrived.  Two servicemen mounted it on the wall and took the old one.  I'm a little disappointed with Vizio because they will not begin the warranty on the new tv with the installation date.  The warranty remains one year from original date of purchase.  I remain a skeptic and will likely purchase a warranty extension.  In the end, all I can say is buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat the price or the picture!
Reviews.Author: M. Young "Eye Write 2"
Reviews.Content: I got this in a Thanksgiving Day Lightening Deal for $688!!! I was blown away!!! I really just wanted a 42 inch because that was all I thought I could afford. Lightening Deals are so tought to catch, I never expected to get one, or get this kind of price. The Internet apps work great - which was my main reason for wanting this set. I don't have cable other than a few local channels, so I usually just stream content from Netflix. With this TV I can also stream from Amazon Prime (which I love!), as well as other sources. The picture clarity is such that it almost appears 3D at times. I am using the wireless connection until I purchase a cable, and my only issue is that for some reason when the set is off it loses the connection. Each time I have to go to the menu and have it look for the connection. Once it finds it, it connects automatically, but I usually have to test the connection a couple of times before it 'takes.' The only other issue I have had is that a few times it has turned itself off. I still have to check and see if it has the function built in to turn itself off when no one is around. I sit very still with my laptop while watching - maybe I need to wave an arm from time to time. ;-) Oh, almost forgot the delivery service! AWESOME!!! One reason I was going to purchase a smaller TV is because I figured (being single) that I would have to carry it, and my back doesn't do well at more than about 40 pounds. Amazon provided free delivery, AND the guy unpacked the set, put it on my table, and we tested that it was working. I did the actual hookup of the cable, Internet, and Blu-ray player - which was not a problem, but it was so great having a delivery that wasn't simply dropped at the door! Huge blessing all the way around on buying this set!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV...but..
Reviews.Author: qst
Reviews.Content: Ordered this TV from Amazon after hours of research, comparing other models, features, price, and places to purchase.First, the TV itself is really nice.  Setup was easy although the built-in wi-fi has not connected to my network yet as it states the signal is low from the router (showing 1 bar vs my other devices showing full strength in same location).  Not a major concern since I will probably not use it often anyway.  However, the picture is great compared to the Sony Bravia it replaced.  The sound is not as strong though, but considering the size of the unit, I did not expect it.  The unit is really thin and complements the space around it.  I am still adjusting the settings to get the optimal picture quality and with looking through other reviews, I have a starting point to play with.  But all-in-all, good quality HD picture.Now, the "Enhanced Delivery" service...By ordering this TV through Amazon, the order qualified for the "Enhanced Delivery" service based on the detailed terms below:"We offer FREE Enhanced Delivery through one of our specialty shippers when you purchase most HDTVs 48 inches or larger from Amazon.com. A representative of a common carrier will deliver your TV to any room suitable for testing, unpack it, ensure that it is working properly to guarantee no damage occurred during transportation, and dispose of all packaging material."Ok,Delivery..Yes, Free.Carrier..Yes, they did contact me (via Email with a contact number to call them to schedule a delivery date/timeframe)Carrier..Yes, they answered the call quickly and scheduled a time that fit my schedule.Carrier..Yes, delivered within timeframe and were friendly.Carrier..No, they did not unpackCarrier..No, they did not 'test' the unit (which i thought would be plugging in to see if it at least turns on) to ensure no damage occurred during transit (I did a visual inspection for any physical damage)Carrier..No, they did not dispose of packaging material (this may be a good thing, as I still have the box in case I need to return the unit)So, delivery was "Standard" considering other big box stores will "deliver" and ensure there is no severe outside physical damage to the packaging.Bottom line:  The TV is working and looks great-(I would recommend).  Just be mindful of the "enhanced delivery" service (which was a purchasing factor for me).

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: The shipping people are horrible. Not amazons fault but they are garbage. They were 2 days late with the TV and did not update their online tracking system at all. Plus the TV came damaged. There was a noticable light coming from the bottom left hand side of the screen, so when the TV was on you would see something kinda like a flashlight poking out of the TV. Amazon was EXCELLENT on return service. They sent a new TV to me right away and all we had to do was pack up the damaged one and when the new TV came we swapped them. Easiest return i've ever done and thats with a TV. So excellent job amazon!Now the quality of the picture is great. Some people might notice that black levels are not impressive but i dont notice them. I followed CNET's guide to setup the picture and its wonderful. Picture is bright and vivid and really stand out. Smart TV UI seems outdated to me but thats my opinion, nothing too severe.Design is excellent as well, the TV looks amazing in our living room.Overall great TV! Really impressed with the price of it. Reviews.Title: You can't go wrong at this price for a wall full of screen in Full HD
Reviews.Author: GameWarden
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV up and running for 2 days now and when my wife has a smile on her face and actually says "you were right, honey!" well I can't imagine anything better than that when it comes to my geekiness. PURCHASE: Amazon was out of stock so I purchased it from Amazon merchant, TigerDirect which made it ineligible for the 2% rewards promo and Prime shipping :-(. Standard shipping cost me $49. And after some confusion AIT shipping actually delivered, albeit, a few hours after the scheduled delivery time. OLD TV: Was replacing a Vizio 37" 720p LED. RAZOR TV: Beautiful slim design with a great picture. All I needed to do was change the default settings to the settings recommended by CNET. See the Kris review #thanksKris. My test movies were Avatar and Avengers from my PS3 slim. FULL HD 1080p, WOW! There may be better pictures out there, but not at this price, or at 60", and NOT BY MUCH!!!  SOUND: The sound is adequate, but not home theater worthy. Small complaint as solutions to this issue exist. We have AMPs and speakers in the room, but I wanted to limit the # of components in the room and cables to the TV. We are going to mount this over the fireplace in the great room, making it even greater (sorry), but my wife's concern is the obvious. Cables everywhere!  So I also purchased the Vizio VHT215 Sound Bar. This solved 2 of my concerns. First, the sound bar, with wireless subwoofer, provides a full home theater experience so much so that while I was in the kitchen, which overlooks the GR, I had to turn around at one point because of the BOOM! And that was at a setting of 10. Second, the sound bar has 2 HDMI ports for components and 1 HDMI/ARC for the connection to the TV, which means the TV needs only 1 HDMI/ARC connection to the sound bar, instead of an HDMI cable for DTV receiver, game console, home theater, etc. etc. LESS CABLES. Maybe this is a topic for the sound bar review, but I'd thought I'd mention that this addition was a great solution to these 2 concerns. TV CAUTION: 1, HDMI interfaces are all on the left side (looking straight on) so keep that in mind for cable management. 2, WIFI is only N band without backward compatibility so it will not connect to my G router. No worries for the hardwired, but I'm not ready to purchase a N band because my last attempt caused problems with my many wireless "Toys", and wired is not an option in this location, says the wife. So, for now all my Amazon content streaming is via the PS3, which worked wonderfully. 3. ARC - Audio Return Channel - The TV HDMI port connecting to the VHT215 sound bar must support ARC. SUMMARY: You CAN NOT go wrong with this purchase if you like a BIG picture with FULL 1080p HD support at this price. The internet applications are nice to have, but not my main reason for this purchase so no need to upgrade to a N band wireless router just yet.

Reviews.Title: Be prepared to be wowed!
Reviews.Author: Deal Fanatic
Reviews.Content: Bought the TV as part of the Black Friday deals and couldn't have had a better TV for the price! Once it was placed on its stand and turned on, I was instantly blown away by the size of the screen and impressive picture. The setup was incredibly easy -- TV channels were added automatically. OTA channels were incredibly crisp and vivid. I've never seen that much detail before! Thanks to the keyboard on the remote, wifi setup and app setups were incredibly painless. I was quickly on my way to watching my Netflix/Amazon Instant Video. Streaming video worked flawlessly and given that it's a single unit, it's one less thing to dust. Since I am coming from PS3 as the primary media player, there are some things that I do miss. Firstly, I would like to turn off the screen without turning everything off and going back into the app and selecting my movie and finding my place. Secondly, this unit lacks a bluetooth remote control, which means I do need to pick up the remote and aim squarely at the TV. Overall, I am very pleased with my purchase and would recommend this TV to anyone!Update 12/31/2012:I really wanted to like this TV. The BIG clear picture wowed me and at that time, I was incredibly happy with my purchase. Then only 2 days new, I woke up to a brighter than usual TV screen. The backlight on the TV was on (with no picture) and I saw the indicator light saying the TV was on. I kept on pressing the on/off button and it didn't respond. After pressing the button 6 more times, the TV startled me by turning off with a loud "crack" sound coming from the speakers. I tried turning on the TV again and it also had a "crack" sound. The TV functioned normally for a while and over the month, it happened again 2 more times. Like I said, I really wanted to like this TV, but I am going to return this TV as having the backlight coming on randomly (and staying on until someone notices) is sure to decrease the lifespan of the TV.

Reviews.Title: Not the best, but will do -- In response to the black out issues with the screen...it's a chip problem.
Reviews.Author: Dr. OCD
Reviews.Content: Nice reviews everyone, thanks for taking the time to write it. In reply to, and aside to, a lot of the black out issues, you should know that the reason Vizio ranks so well and have decent tv's is because the LCD, chips, motherboard etc are all made by S.Korean giant Samsung! In fact, these screens are Samsung's "step-child," batches of screens. I have family members that work at Samsung. So the inside scoop is, well kind of obvious if you're familiar with the industry and production of screens, but kind of like processors, when they "bake" up the batches some come out great/perfect while some come out "not so quite," so when they cut up the screens and test them, the ones that don't meet the original production criteria are then sold off to companies like Vizio (and many others like Sharp (Samsung owns a portion of Sharp) to use in their tv's/screens. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, but sometimes it can be a headache. I had a 50 inch Vizio bought from Costco croak on me just before Christmas. Opened her up and everything was, sure enough Samsung, except the piece that fried LOL, which was made in China haha. Go figure. This is the problem with the batches from LFTRNWAN3800001 to LFTRNWAN4805300 for Model E601i-A3 and LFTRNXAN4500001 - LFTRNXAN4702936 for Model E701i-A3. The demand was so high for Samsung that Vizio outsourced it to an "el-cheapo" of a company in china. It's not surprise. Wrong poker move on Vizio's part and now they and "us" the consumers have to deal with the bluff hand. - The only reason I buy Vizio is because at heart it is truly Samsung guts, which is pretty darn cool. Kudos to the Korean giant. I also own Samsung TV's which are flawless, but when I need one for giggles in the gaming room or whatever and to use as my screen for an extra monitor for stock quotes etc....Vizio will do all the while allowing me to save a few hundred. After all it is Samsung's step child parts clothed in a Vizio badge. Better than buying another less of a brand... Hope this helps. (btw, don't listen to Vizio customer care, they don't know crap and keep in mind they are only just people who answer phones with scripts. No knowledge at all. They don't know the inside scoop, only what they are told and to say. You're better off asking your pet.)

Reviews.Title: Non-repairable TV's from Vizio
Reviews.Author: mgoss
Reviews.Content: Be sure to read this article before buying a Vizio TV.  It is a real eye opener.  Sounds like there are a lot of unhappy people.  [...]

Reviews.Title: Nice Upgrade!
Reviews.Author: Wes
Reviews.Content: Purchased TV to replace the 42" LG that we've had for a few years now.  Using HuluPlus, Netflix, and Amazon Instant Streaming right from the TV is great because I don't have to fire up any other equipment to watch a movie.  Apps actually work rather well, and are not watered down versions of the console applications found on the Xbox 360, PS3, or Apple TV.  Picture looks great in a well-lit room, and for the time we've had it we love it.

Reviews.Title: Had a few issues
Reviews.Author: Martin Scheuer Jr.
Reviews.Content: Had a few issues with it fighting with my Macbook Pro over the wireless network causing it to freeze and then make a loud popping noise. I had to turn off printer sharing for some reason on my computer and then the freezing and popping issue stopped and has not happened again.  I have had this tv for almost 6 months and that was the only real problem.  Apps are pretty slow and not much of a selection on them but for $850 for a 60" LED "smart" TV I would most definitely buy this tv again.  Looks pretty darn good and does what I need it to do! Buy it and use it.  Picture is great but blacks could be better...again, it was $850 bucks.  What are you expecting?  I love it for what it is.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work with Amazon Instant Video
Reviews.Author: MMitchell74
Reviews.Content: We like the picture and it works fine, but right now it doesn't work with Amazon Instant Video; you just get a screen saying Amazon is "working hard" to fix this, but it's been like that for a month now. I called Amazon tech support and they said they are working on a fix for this problem and the updated ap should be out soon, but they didn't say how long it would take. I don't regret buying the TV but I am sad that I can't watch Dr Who on it.

Reviews.Title: ViZIO LED 60"!!!!
Reviews.Author: mircea teodorescu
Reviews.Content: WOW!! amazed with this tv!! its freakin awesome!!! GREAT PRICE AND ........ITS H U G E!!!!!!!!!!!!!! wow, thank u for such a great price!!!!! picture is awesome, and my Ps3 games look out of this world!!!!!! Football has never looked so good!!!!! along with b-ball and everything else!!! go GET IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: remote control or physical buttons wont work
Reviews.Author: rod
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv on March 2013, the tv is great but,  in several occasions crashes. I disconnect it from the power and works again.Now, by surprise the remote or the physical buttons wont respond.  The picture still perfect but you cannot control anything, settings, volume, on or off, etc.  I have to disconnect it from the power to turn it off. Its useless.  Thank God I have a 2 year warranty on it. If I can get the cash back would try another brand. An update; disconnected the tv for about half hour and finally worked. I dont believe have to do this to be able to watch tv

Reviews.Title: Best investment ever!
Reviews.Author: C. Spratt
Reviews.Content: Wow. Of the many screens I reviewed before buying, this was the sharpest, best color saturation, and best looking of them all.The internet apps are still in their infancy, and some don't work, but some do, and it is a nice touch to be able to use things like facebook while you are watching TV. It would be great to be able to Google, but perhaps that will come in the future. But many You Tube videos are as sharp as a tack on the 60 inch screen.A snap to set up, too. Love it.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E601i-A3 60-inch
Reviews.Author: jim
Reviews.Content: Great TV, especially compared to the old Projection 60" we replaced. Picture and color is excellent, just had to make a few slight changes in the color adjustment. Speakers are just so-so, but I use surround sound so it isn't a problem. Very easy to set up, only took a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: Get what u pay for
Reviews.Author: Patty Grubbs
Reviews.Content: As long as u r in front of the television the color is okay. But when u go to the side and further away it fades and looses it's color. U get what u pay for but I would rather pay more for quality

Reviews.Title: Cheap, you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Rstaniec
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv due to the low price and good reviews on cnet. I was instantly dissatisfied. First the tv has very noticeable bright spots on dark scenes. Secondly the tv picture is not that bright. I bought the tv for a window filled family room and during the bright part of the day the screen is very washed out.  It is really no brighter then my Samsung plasma. Lastly the color is horrible I have trying to adjust the color settings and have not been able to get realistic color. Lastly it is poorly made. I have had it one year and it has needed repair or replacement twice. This is not a good tv. I would never buy again. Stick to Samsung and save yourself trouble

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Hagios
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about buying a "low end" TV but I'm glad I did. Overall, it's quality is higher than the high end Phillips LCD TV I bought about six years ago. Even my wife loves having a 60 inch TV and she's not gadget person. So if you want to step up to a bigger TV but are nervous about the Vizio brand, don't be. Vizio is the Toyota of TV's - an upstart that makes high quality products at low prices. I'm sure that video-philes have a million reasons to buy something more expensive, but for the rest of us, this is great.I do have a few tips.1. If you have a room to dedicate to your TV, then simply move your couch as close to the TV as you can stand and save the money.2. If you have a basement, man-cave, or any other consistently dark room for your TV, then buy a plasma instead. They are slightly cheaper and have a better picture than LCD/LED TV's. (Burn-in on plasmas is no longer a problem). The downside is that you get more glare in a bright room.3. Turn off the Smooth Motion Effect (Menu -> Picture -> Advanced Picture Settings). Smooth Motion Effect makes the picture look creepy, at least for some people.4. Consider buying a sound bar to go with it. That's the cheapest way to get decent sound (and audible dialogue). You can save even more money by getting a sound bar without a subwoofer if you only care about hearing the dialogue and aren't as interested in explosions that rock the whole house.The biggest downside to this TV is that the Amazon Prime app is terrible. You can't login so you can't access your watchlist of Amazon shows. Instead you have to search. So I use my PS3 for Amazon Prime.

Reviews.Title: NICE TV BUT BE AWARE OF VIZIO RECALL
Reviews.Author: Frankcr
Reviews.Content: I HAVE TO SAY THIS SET IS QUITE NICE, EXCELLENT RESOLUTION, SOME UNIFORMITY ISSUES AS POINTED BY CNET.COM, LOUSY SOUND.EVERYTHING OK, BUT, I WAS AWARE OF A RECALL MADE BY VIZIO INDICATING THIS SPECIFIC TV ALONG WITH THE 70" HAS A SHIP FAILURE AND ARE TO BE RECALL OR EITHER REPLACED.  UNFORTUNATELY, I READ THE RECALL AFTER I PURCHASED IT FROM AMAZON.COM.I AM REALLY DISAPPOINTED THAT AMAZON CONTINUES TO SELL THIS TV WITHIN THE SERIES THAT COULD REPRESENT A FAILURE WITHIN WEEKS OR EVEN MONTHS OF REGULAR USE.BE AWARE, SO FAR I AM OK, BUT WHO KNOWS...

Reviews.Title: Vizio
Reviews.Author: Juanita
Reviews.Content: I would not recomment this name brand, my Vizio TV keeps turning off all by itself, several times when you first turn on the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great.
Reviews.Author: Pedro J. Otaduy "loretoki"
Reviews.Content: PROs: Meet all expectations. Easy and reliable connection to the internet.Only CONS are related to its Smart-WIFI software: (1) It does not include a Web Browser; (2) Navigating the Smart menues is ackward, and (3) Apps that do not use the internet while running will not run unless the internet is active and connected. As if the App was not stored and needed to be reloaded,

Reviews.Title: great picture quality and great price
Reviews.Author: smart shopper "archtist"
Reviews.Content: The tv is the perfect size for our great room and has amazing picture quality. Its so simple to stream you tube and use other apps.We are extremely happy with our purchase and would recommend friends to buy it as well

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRICE....GREAT TV!!!!
Reviews.Author: BIG ROR
Reviews.Content: BOUGHT FROM AMAZON FOR $888, WHICH WAS CHEAPEST AROUND. GOT DELIVERED THE DAY I PICKED AND WAS SET UP FOR ME IN 10 MINUTES!!! GREAT PICTURE AND SOUND AND THE APPS ( NETFLIX,AMAZON INSTANT VIDEO, VUDO, PANDORA...ETC) ARE FANTASTIC!!!!! COULDNT ASK FOR ANYTHING MORE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: sk
Reviews.Content: TV is excellent. I have no complaints with it. Picture is great and hdmi ports ae easy to get too

Reviews.Title: Great Value, Great Picture, Solid Internet Features
Reviews.Author: Amazon Addict
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to order this TV due to some of the bad reviews I read, but the reviews were overwhelming positive so I went for it. I'm glad I bought this. The picture is crisp, the size is awesome, and the internet features work very well. Prior to owning this TV I used a Roku or a Wii to access Netflix or Amazon videos, but now I'm using just this TV. It actually works very well. At first when I got this TV the picture wasn't that great, then I starting playing with my settings and realized I was watching in 720p, when I changed it to full 1080p it looked great. Make sure you take some time to play with all your settings so you optimize it. There are some great tips in other reviews of this TV here on Amazon with regards to settings.

Reviews.Title: A word to the wise is sufficient.
Reviews.Author: M. Gaines
Reviews.Content: Vizio has great products when they work properly. But when they don't, dealing with their technical support staff will have you seriously reconsidering whether you should have ever done business with them.

Reviews.Title: My 60 inch TV
Reviews.Author: Roger Duval
Reviews.Content: I got just what I ordered.It is great,love the 60 inch ,HD pic is great,sound is great,I just love it.

Reviews.Title: Great but not excellent.
Reviews.Author: Ibrahim Alani
Reviews.Content: The picture quality if phenomenal but some of this smart TV's applications such as Hulu routinely freeze up or have streaming problems.Netflix is fine 95% of the time but sometimes get's stuck streaming which can only be fixed by closing the netflix applicaiton. However, when Netflix is stuck, everything is stuck. Even the power button won't work at that time. You will have to turn the power off by holding the button on the tv for 10 seconds or so. I even had to unplug the power once.

Reviews.Title: Visio e601i-a3 fail
Reviews.Author: kevin r morgan
Reviews.Content: My vizio e601i-a3 60 inch razor tv failed at 60 days. In the beginning it would freeze up on netflix. When I would reset the power it would crack loudly like a big firecracker was behind it. Then when we were watching one night the picture went out. I called Visio. The lady was polite but told me the she new it was nonrepairable before I told her what was wrong, it was just by me telling her the seial number. She said they would call me in 2 days to schedule an exchange. That was last week AND I HAVE HEARD NOTHING.

Reviews.Title: No Picture
Reviews.Author: Phill "Phill"
Reviews.Content: Got the TV on Black Friday and the day before the superbowl the screen died. Called Visio and they are going to send someone out to replace it. Not sure if I'll ever be confident of the quality of this model now... Looking at the other bad reviews looks like a design issue. We used the TV about 6 hrs a day, so moderate use... Buyer BewareI'm guessing -due to the low price- they are aware of the issue (but won't admit it)... They are trying to get rid of them as soon as possible...

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied!
Reviews.Author: D. Harris
Reviews.Content: I have to say the picture on this HDTV is very nice.  The menu system is very easy to use, as well as the remote for the different functions.  I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for an amazing experience at a good price.

Reviews.Title: vizio e601i-a360
Reviews.Author: del baldwin
Reviews.Content: the picture is great but the sound sometime jumps ahead of the talking  the sound come ahead of the track i have to go into the menu and reset  the sound

Reviews.Title: Defective out of the box
Reviews.Author: jertomsi
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived and was defective out of the box, Vizio says they will deliver a replacement TV in 8 to 13 business days so hopefully we will have a working tv 5 weeks after it was ordered...

Reviews.Title: Very impressed with this t.v.
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I am impressed with the quality and clarity of the image.  Setting up the t.v. was super easy.  The screen size goes well in my 19x30 greatroom.  I am going to get a sound bar, but have no complaints with the stock speakers.If I had to find a complaint, it would be the amazon app...kind of cumbersome to have to scroll through list of prime movies, that appear to not be in any particular order!!! Definitely easier to use my tablet as a "tv guide" then just go straight to the movie.A word about my purchase experience. The t.v. was not delivered on originally scheduled date.  I was very disappointed.  An email to amazon, and their quick response, and I was happy.  I am very impressed with amazon customer service... On the few occasions I have had to contact them, they are very prompt and easy to work with.Thank you Vizio for a great television, thank you amazon for a great price....

Reviews.Title: This TV is great.
Reviews.Author: Julio Lopez
Reviews.Content: i love my Vizio 60inch 1080p TV. This TV is better than any Samsung TV. I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Lip Sync is really bad
Reviews.Author: Brian J. Muldowney "Brian"
Reviews.Content: The lip sync is really bad.  Several times a day, I have to try and adjust it or shut the tv off to reset it.  I have had the TV for 2 weeks and the problem seems to be getting worse every day.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 60 inch led tv
Reviews.Author: michelle aros
Reviews.Content: Its okay.  Guess I can"t complain too much.  60" led for under$ 1000.00.  But if I did it again, I'd pay the extra money and get a Samsung or Sony.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Damon Perry
Reviews.Content: Purchased tv for the parents to replace a 32 inch CRT.  The tv is great, picture is sharp, apps are cool and they are very happy.  I have to pry my dad away from it on sunday.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Mark & Shannon Baughman
Reviews.Content: Amazing TV for the price! I actually convinced 3 other people to buy this exact same TV set from Amazon.com after I bought it! The white glove shipping left TONS to be desired, but the TV is amazing! A+++++

Reviews.Title: Netflix App Issue
Reviews.Author: cgtennis
Reviews.Content: It's pretty slim. Very nice picture. Sound is Ok. I hook it to a Vizio soundbar with wireless subwoofer.There is only one problem with the Netflix app. If I run Netflix app for a certain period of time, it will suddenly start to reload and freeze at about 20% of reloading process. And remote will stop working and TV will eventually shutdown. Note that I hardwired RJ45 network cable from my router to the TV. It's not a problem with my router. At the time of freezing, I still have internet connection from the router. I also tried streaming Netflix from Xbox to this TV (also hardwired from the same router), I never experienced the problem of freezing.So I think it must be the netflix App of the TV itself. Other than the Netflix issue, everything else is fine so far.

Reviews.Title: Perfect fit
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: For the price it was a great TV but not as good as my Samsung at twice the price.It is the perfect ticket for my man cave for football games and saved me a lot of $$$.I would buy it all over again.

Reviews.Title: speakers
Reviews.Author: wayneo
Reviews.Content: This is a great T.V. from the Wi-Fi to a great picture i have a 47" vizio and 2 35" vizios is the only T.V. i will buy and it does not get warm like my 47" but after spending 1,256.00 for t.v with tax and warranty the sound is so bad because the speakers are in rear i now have to buy a sound bar.

Reviews.Title: Bought this set on black friday and its great!
Reviews.Author: J. McDaniel
Reviews.Content: I first saw this set advertised at my local walmart for 688. I did my research. I at first was gonna get a Panasonic ST50 but I just couldn't beat the price. I admit this set doesn't hit the level of blacks you're gonna get from a high end plasma and you don't get the 600 HZ refresh rate but you still get very good blacks for a budget LED such as this. Also keep in mind that sometimes the real bright colors with dark scenes don't feel as vibrant. It just doesn't have such a wide color spectrum as a high end Samsung or Sony, but again, for the price you just can't beat it. Also as with all extremely thin tv's (this one is just an inc and a quarter at its thickest point) the sound sucks so I definitely recommend a sound bar or surround sound system. So if you're on a budget I highly recommend this tv. If you can afford it, go high. I'm a gamer so I really wanted a high end plasma but I just can't afford it right now. Just a note, I haven't experienced no such problems as some of these other negative reviewers have stated.

Reviews.Title: Unbeatable value for a pretty good TV
Reviews.Author: Steven Le
Reviews.Content: I got this TV from the Lightning Deal for $688. I was replacing a 42 inch LG LCD. I've owned the TV for about 3 days now and I must say I'm very pleased with the quality of the TV. The TV is smaller than I expected. Extremely thin and fairly light for the size. As many others have stated, the blacks on this TV are not great. If you're watching dark scenes, you will notice it, but I don't think you can expect perfection for this price point. I highly recommend using the picture settings found in other reviews. It definitely improved the quality of the picture. The apps are fine. The control is somewhat slow but it does its job adequately. The startup on the TV is quite long. 10-15 seconds approximately. Not a big deal but somewhat annoying. The buttons on the remote are pretty small and can be troublesome, but I expect that to get better as I get used to the remote. Overall, I think the TV was well worth the price and performs well enough to make it an incredible value.

Reviews.Title: Great value and picture
Reviews.Author: rocky41102
Reviews.Content: I got this from the lightning deal. Delivery was quick and easy. The TV has a great picture using the pre-set options Vizio has. It's even better with the settings given in a review here. It seems much bigger than what it is and it looks great being so thin. For us, the picture and TV is perfect. It's not as good as the Samsung TV's we looked at but it's very close and definitely better than expected for the price.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture
Reviews.Author: Scott "Scott"
Reviews.Content: I bought this on the Black Friday deals and by far leaps and bounds better picture than my old Aquos 46'' TV.  First show that was on was Finding Nemo and I swear I thought I was in the theater.  Since then regular TV shows, sports and movies all look fantastic on it.  Madden Football looks even more lifelike.  Anyone looking to buy a 60'' set would do well with this one.

Reviews.Title: A solid TV for the price I paid
Reviews.Author: Just another reviewer
Reviews.Content: So I got it delivered y'day and hooked it up and calibrated as per the CNET provided calibration settings ..here are my thoughtsThe TV's build is amazing. Very thin and sleek.If the source is HD i.e 720p or 1080i or 1080p the picture rocks.But anything less than that it sucks(true for youtube as well ). The apps are pretty good ...not as bad or slow as mentioned in some reviews.I connected my cable to HDMI3 and I do not have any lip syncing issues.( some reviewers said they had these if they connected to the HDMI 1 slot ).The sound is pretty good to me (I am not an audioholic ) and the surround is good as well ( atleast for HD cable tv ).The app interface and menu interface is bad ...it just looks cheap.That's expected I suppose.The remote is pretty good for what it's supposed to do.You tube works pretty well ... but some videos do not play the first time.Good news if you own an android phone or tablet is that you can use that you can use it as a remote for youtube. ( same as the ps3 youtube app )Set up DLNA but it doesn't recognize all my folders... will do some more research today.4 stars because of the Menu interface . For the picture and the build quality ( and the price :P ) I would give it 5 stars!!!

Reviews.Author: NewJersey
Reviews.Content: Stood in line for 2 hours just to get this tv from Walmart on black Friday, I must say $688 was a great deal even purchased a surround sound system and now my living room is like a theater.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: M. Meitl "Matt"
Reviews.Content: Beautiful TV, wasn't even considering getting a TV this size until we saw the $688 Black Friday price at Wal-Mart. Even at the normal $1000 price tag this thing is a pleasure to view. Vibrant colors, the TV design is nice and thin. Overall really impressed by the TV. Cable looks great. Running my Xbox games on it has been stunning(it does have a Game Mode), it shows off the colors in the games really well. We are using the stand that came with tv, makes sure you have it on something stable though as it does seem the vulnerable to Falling.ProsEasy to set upBeautiful ScreenMovie AppsNetflix, VUDU, and Youtube look great on it.Great for gaming.Great Price.ConsStand could be more stable.Update 12/12/2012:TV still running great.Having Lip Sync issues?Did find that the TV did have lip sync issues on our cable box, contacted Vizio support on the issue, found out that the cable box needed to be set to output PCM audio. We did that and haven't had lip sync issues since.Will update more as needed.

Reviews.Title: Best 60 inch LCD LED HDTV Value!
Reviews.Author: Adam W
Reviews.Content: I've only had the Vizio E601i-A3 for several days but wanted to give a review of early impressions. I will try to update this review in about 6 months. As others have pointed out, the picture quality and thin design are very good. It may be a minor consideration to some but I really like the understated Vizio logo on the lower right corner. Previous models have had brightly lit Vizio logos that are distracting and annoying. The sound is average; because the speakers are rear-facing, if you mount the TV against the wall, that muffles the sound. The remote-with-keyboard is a good idea with some issues: You have to learn not to hit any of the keyboard buttons when you are holding the remote with keyboard facing down. When you are using the keyboard, the keys will not register unless the "left" of the keyboard is pointing at the TV. This TV has an excellent selection of connection ports including four HDMIs.  Here are some additional comments:1) Unboxing: I was annoyed that the box had no opening instructions. I'm sure most people ended up cutting the top and either flipping the box and spilling the TV out or struggling to lift the TV out. The safest way to unbox is to unclip the four plastic clips near the base of box and simply slide the box up and away from the base.2) When I first powered on and connected to the Internet, the TV automatically did a firmware update. I was surprised that it did not ask for my approval to do the update. However, everything appears to be working correctly.3) If you look at the marketing info, this smart TV is suppose to have Pandora. It does not have it preinstalled but you can install it from the online Store.4) The Netflix app has subtitle support! This is the first non-browser Netflix app that I have seen with subtitles. This is big plus for my family.5) I'm using this Vizio TV with a Logitech Harmony universal remote with no problems.In summary, it's not perfect but it is very good and IMO, the current best value for a 60-inch smart TV.

Reviews.Title: great viewing tv, but not perfect- Eventually died
Reviews.Author: JJ "JJ"
Reviews.Content: things i like about the tv:internet apps like netflix*GREAT PICTURE. Good viewing angle*light*thin*minimal frame! This was important because my entertainment center is really only meant for something 54" wide.*price. I bought it at costco because i wanted it now...too bad amazon charges tax in TX or i would have waited and bought from them.things i dislike:*sound...terrible. Luckily I had an old surround sound system i did not use and hooked it up*DNLA support is crappy. I have a WHS with tons of media. The DNLA server has issues with large folder structures. for example it took about 20 seconds to load a folder directory with 27 folders. however, once it did load it did play some movies. could not play H264 encoded movies. I tried to load my music folder ( folders by artists ) and it locked up... VERY crappy*start up time is slow ...about 10 seconds.*No SLACKER music app?  that really sucksupdate--after 2.5 months, this tv died and picture did not turn on. it went back to costco

Reviews.Title: Great TV & Brand for the price
Reviews.Author: Bryan Jerutis "Bryan Jerutis"
Reviews.Content: For the value, no other brand comes close to the Vizio. Features are comp to many higher / popular brands.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv
Reviews.Author: Jackie Taylor
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this tv & I got it onsale black friday! I still have not been able to find the skype ap If anyone knows where it is or if I have to down load it from somewheres please help! Again I would recommend to everyone I love it!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: MilfordChris
Reviews.Content: This TV has the picture quality of many that cost far more.  The picture is bright and very clear.  Sports (what I think HD is best for) looks as good on this tv as I have seen on any other.  What a value!  The only Con that I can come up with is the fact that the factory picture settings are HORRIBLE.  But, there are some good tips for changing them in the reviews here.  Overall, this TV out-performs those that cost quite a bit more.  Way to go Vizio, assuming the quality is as good as should be expected, I think you have arrived.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 60"
Reviews.Author: Fernando DaCosta
Reviews.Content: This product arrived just in two Days, in excellent conditions, i installed in my Conference rooms and looks great, even has wifi, so you can watch You tube and others chanels online without a Computer.Excellent product for the Price. I will recomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Turns out not to be a compromise
Reviews.Author: J. Michael Sabre
Reviews.Content: So when we moved in together we planned on the one TV.  Needless to say we started looking for a smaller TV for the bedroom.  The size difference of our 42in living room TV and smaller models made us look at a new living room TV.  The three of us ended up with the 42in TV for the bed and this beauty in the living room.  Besides making my DVD players internet stuff redundant its packed with features.  The presets are much better and much easier than the infinite settings especially for viewing movies.

Reviews.Title: WOW !!
Reviews.Author: john b
Reviews.Content: We love this TV ! Clear picture, good sound,and great features! Value was great too, under $1000.00 and delivered to my door....you cant beat it! mounted on the wall and looks great.

Reviews.Title: Great Value!
Reviews.Author: Donga Lope
Reviews.Content: Just bought this TV from Costco and I am impressed. I struggled between this and a 55" Samsung. Well, I returned the Samsung and bought this. I am thrilled with how much faster the smart navigation is, however I am disappointed there is no browser. The QWERTY keyboard is easy to use, as well as the on screen keyboard. Sure, the Samsung is a tiny bit brighter, and the black may be more black, but if you find one on sale it is still roughly $500 more. Yeah, I can buy a TV for my bedroom with the $500 I save.

Reviews.Title: Few Thoughts
Reviews.Author: Vic K. "Vic K."
Reviews.Content: 1st of all the TV is huge. I wanted to go bigger and put this in the place of a 2+ y/o 50 inch Panasonic plasma. Honestly, this TV can't match the Panny's black levels. The Picture is fine .... very good actually but not at the Panny's level. I have another 47" 240 mhz Vizio that to my eye has a better picture as well. The biggest thing is the viewing angles. If you get right up on the set from the side in a well lit room the pic isn't the best (but who really watches TV like that?). Not to nit pick, the set is great from viewing at all angles when you are a few feet back, and has a very good picture. Thanks to the reviewers below that listed the custom settings because you definitely want to change it from the default soap opera mode it comes in. It is a very good budget big screen, period.****Update****Overall I am happy with this TV but when watching sporting events I notice the classic LCD blurring. Do any of you who own this set know how to tweak the settings to fix this outside of the Smooth Motion Effect setting? I was worried about it being 120 Mhz vs 240****Update****The TV gave out and there is no more picture. I am returning it for a complete refund. It will be interesting what the return rates will be on these sets. It's a beautiful set but the quality isn't even up to the higher end that Vizio offers. I will get a plasma. Once you go plasma black you never go back. I wanted to like this set but the picture quality is just average.

Reviews.Title: GOOD TV. But Vizio needs better qualiy assurance
Reviews.Author: Kayman
Reviews.Content: The only reason why Im giving this a 2 star because Amazon customer sercive is a 5 star.  The tv it self is a 1 star.I had to return this TV TWICE because:1: there were bright uneven light bleeding across the sides of the first TV.2: the 2nd tv had the same issue, plus audio issues on the first HDMI connnection.  The audio would have a 5 second lagg begind immage while HD.  This was happening only on the first HDMI slot.THE GOOD:-Amazon customer sercive and CEVA delivery....excellent-Picture is amazing-TV looks clean and minimalTHE BAD-They need to run and test these TVvmore before sending it out of the factory-Remote function and menu could be more user friendlyTHE UGLY-Some of the apps and built in programs take a little time to load up.-You will need to get an aftermarket speaker system, as this TV has rear facing speakers which sounds bad, but is able to keep the low profile and clean look in face of the TV.

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: jessdenice
Reviews.Content: I hate this TV. My boyfriend wanted it and we got it and it is just horrible. The pixel/picture quality is pretty good but everything else sucks. The sound is bad, randomly a horrible awful sound will go off that sounds like it is about to blow up. The smart tv built in apps are garbage. Not comparable at all to other similar products.Bottom line. Would NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: Sam's Club $888
Reviews.Author: Gina5296
Reviews.Content: Sam's club sells this TV in a bundle with the wall mount kit for $888.00.  A much better deal than any other place I have seen.

Reviews.Title: For under $1000, there is nothing that compares..
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: The picture is wickedly good on this TV.. I was surprised actually. But you NEED to input the rightpicture settings in order for you to experience what this tv is capable of.. DO NOT use the CNET.com settings,they are horrible.  I am surprised that the so called "experts" there actually have no idea on how to set picturesettings..  There is one reviewer on here that posted the right settings, just scroll down and you will find it,, i believe it's under the "vivid" picture mode.. There is light bleed on pretty much all these set's but its not noticeable in 99% of the scenes.. You really only see it as the tv boots up and its on an all black screen, and all leds do this to some extent...  Don't waste your money on a plasma tv, It's a dying technology, and its not worth the hassle, they still have image retention problems and are power hungry. The only reasons I would recommend a plasma is if you need to watch your tv at extreme angles..

Reviews.Title: Beware.
Reviews.Author: Risuli "Risuli"
Reviews.Content: TV was delivered on Nov. 27, 2012.  Died on January 30, 2013 (about 60 days in).Check out AVS Forums for a thread on "how long you've had Vizio E606i-A3" as it discusses the apparent high rate of failed LCD's and the audio lip sync issues with this model.My unit had a great picture, though it did have occasional lip sync issues.  Then, the LCD just went black, no menus, no display of any kind, though the sound still worked.  I have yet to contact Vizio support, but the reports I'm reading are that they will try and deny a defect, then tell you they will have it repaired (a several week process), then when that fails will ship you a remanufactured unit with only a 90 day warranty.  Again, I am reporting only what others have said.***UPDATE***Vizio has acknowledged a manufacturing issue with component chipsets installed in earlier production runs that would fail at about 500 hours causing a black screen (no picture) but with audio intact.  Vizio is now providing a 2 year warranty (vs original 1 year) and reports are that they are replacing stocks with newer production TV's that do not contain the problem chipsets.  Very glad to see VIZIO standing behind their product!

Reviews.Title: No Picture Then No Sound
Reviews.Author: I'm a fuzzy dog... arf arf arf... "keikothedog"
Reviews.Content: This same model was purchased through Costco and 87 days later the same problem that many others had happened... A loss of picture (black screen) then a loss of sound.  A hard resest (unplugging then holding the power button on the side of the set for one minute failed to correct the problem)  Instead of having to wait for a new one to be shipped out it was returned to Costco where another customer in the return line was returning one for the exact same issue.  Costco handled the return with no problems including the extended warranty through SquareTrade where we purchased another Vizio of the same model.Note: The new model appeared to have a different operating system or software upgrade as the menu screen had a different layout and was much more streamlined and easier to navigate.The new set has only been operating since January 03, 2013 with no problems so far.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, but has audio sync issues....
Reviews.Author: Walt Bower
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on the Black Friday special and was really looking forward to it. Once I got it, I was impressed with the picture and options, but started to notice audio delays (audio starting before video) and it became rather annoying. I will be returning this TV because of this issue.

Reviews.Title: Great television, shady sale practices by Amazon.
Reviews.Author: R. Raigosa
Reviews.Content: I had my eye on a new LED set for the holidays. I read reviews and compared many models before deciding on this one. I owned a 42" 720P Vizio very briefly, before an accident happened and cracked the screen. I remember being impressed by the display quality and purchasing it for a good price from a local retailer. Afterwards, I was forced to go back to 32" LG TV for gaming and such. But as the years passed, I decided it was time to turn it up a notch.I'm a heavy gamer and I play split screen online with my friends a lot. Our household also has movie and sports night events throughout the week. Whether it is playoff time or the mid season finale of the Walking Dead; people tend to come over and congegrate. I decided a big screen was a necessity at this point. I knew the right time to purchase was around Black Friday, so I set aside some money for the annual sales season. Walmart and Amazon were competing for the best deals on big screens and both advertised this model for the sale price of $688.00 Of course Amazon listed this in their lighting deals section and advertised the heck out of it. I thought I could stay home and get a great deal without having to deal with the relentless crowds and strife. So at 5:25 PM PST, I logged onto Amazon with intent to buy this 60" Vizio panel.On Thanksgiving day, I excused myself from dinner and logged on the Vizio E60 product page at 5:27 PM; clicked F5 and refreshed it until I saw the price change from the usual $999.00 to the sale price of $688.00 It changed a few seconds after 5:30 PM, but I was unable to add it to my cart at the sale price. I got a message saying all the lighting deals had been claimed. In less than 15 seconds, the big black Friday sale was over. At this point, I decided to purchase it anyway, thinking that perhaps Amazon would honor their sale price afterwards. No such luck. If I could do it over again, I'd have tried my luck with local a Walmart or another retailer instead. More than likely I would have gotten the cheaper price, even after paying CA sales tax.So a few days later, the 60" Vizio was delivered to my house. Out of the box, the picture was good. The store display mode had a crappy soccer image that did not do the panel justice. After hooking up an HDMI connection to my X-box 360 and cable box; I played around with the picture settings. The CNET color settings that another reviewer posted were okay, I found it to be too dull and washed out, the backlight needs to increased much more.  The advanced picture settings were correct though. Smooth motion makes everything look a crappy daytime soap opera. Turn that option off immediately. Gaming on the new panel is a pleasure. Some arcade HD remakes such as Rez HD, look phenomenal. Newer titles like Forza Horizon, Batman Arkham City, and Dead or Alive 5 really make the screen pop vibrantly as well. Four player split screen gaming on Sonic Racing Transformed and Halo 4 is a great pleasure as well. No longer do my fiends and I have to huddle around a small LCD.My Timewarner cable box is another story. Of the available HD channels; only about a handful at anytime look decent. After adjusting my cable box HDMI output to 1080i from 720P ,broadcast video improved slightly. Non HD source material looks like crap. I've gone to downloading only Bluray rips or 1080P encoded mp4 video files. It really makes me want to drop my cable and find a better HD provider. The occasional NFL games in HD and Science Channel documentaries look pretty good though. I noticed people on the sidewalk pausing to watch events as they pass by. The picture is that sharp and detailed from 15 feet away, even through window blinds.Short story: Great television for the price, shady business practices by Amazon. I really wished Amazon would not lead customers on about sales that last only a few seconds. Find a local retailer and pick it up yourself, it will be cheaper and you will have instant gratification. What is even more infuriating is that the price on the product page was fluctuating during the big sales week. This only added to my frustration and buyer's remorse.  Quite a shame though, as I used to love Amazon Prime and everything about it. At least I can watch Dawson's creek in glorious lifesize HD and cry alongside James Van Der Beek.P.S. I will post some pictures when I get a chance. I need a better camera than the 8MP one on my phone.

Reviews.Title: A good tv with issues
Reviews.Author: Charlie199
Reviews.Content: While the price (979.99) at Costco and the picture are great some of the customer useability has been lost.This is our 4th Vizio product and that sets the stage for certain expectations. In two instances this product fell short.For those of us that want to place the TV on a cabinet be aware that the pedestal is barely adequate for the job. My old sets had pedestals that were at least half the width of the screen and provided a stable platform. The E601i-A3 has an 17" pedestal attached with 3 screws. No matter how tight the screws the TV rocks side to side and front to back. When Support was asked about a possible wall anchor (not a wall mount) to help secure the TV from tipping their response was they offered no options either with the set or at some extra charge. You are on your own.A feature I had on my old Vizio's and was surprised not to find on this one is a free air digital channel guide. All that's left is a little info bar in the upper right corner that identifies only the channel/program you are on. According to Support Chat it doesn't matter which set you buy Vizio no longer provides this very useful feature at any price.Not the customer oriented company I'd come to appreciate."UPDATE"Our particular situation requires a broader viewing angle than this LED panel can handle. Ended up replacing it with an LG 60" Plasma. It has a much wider viewing angle.And oh by the way it cost $200 less than this Vizio. Of course it's not "Smart" so no Internet access. Since we weren't subscribers to online pay services that won't be missed.And the LG is much more stable. More grandkid proof.

Reviews.Title: Low quality
Reviews.Author: Ehsan Salek
Reviews.Content: My first Vizio (Plasma) which I bought in 2006 was great. This one has been problem after problem. I have exchanged it twice already.The most troubling issue is when I do not get any pictures and I have the unplug it for 10 second and replug it and pray that it works. Next time I will get a Samsung Smart TV.

Reviews.Title: Does not have a browser
Reviews.Author: Nick kassouf
Reviews.Content: At the time of purchase i didn't care about having a browser for one of the apps but if you dont have cable or anything like that a browser would be nice so you can stream sports and other things off of the providers websites. (rather than hooking a computer up to the tv to do that)

Reviews.Title: avoid this product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This product is a complete failure.  I have never been more disappointed in a products performance or reliability.  The problems are far to many to list, but include stopping during viewing and a red line down the middle of the screen.  I paid far to much money for a TV that does not last more then a year.  So very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E601i-A3 Review
Reviews.Author: ZL
Reviews.Content: Bought it from Amazon in Nov. 2013.  Overall color is not as good as Sony 52" LCD TV.  There are small shadow (dark) areas at both left and right lower corners. Also had problems with the remote.  When "up" or "down" arrow key was pressed, highlighted selection kept cycling even after the key was released.  Not doing this all the time, but quite often.  Called Vizio and got another remote, but still having the same problem sometimes.

Reviews.Title: easy to hook up and great picture
Reviews.Author: Sara West
Reviews.Content: it took 5 minutes once we had it installed to get through the internet stuff and be watching tv, it has an awesome picture and lots of fun options for the family

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Chris Giddings
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for two months now and over the 40inch Vizio I had before, this one is even more of a dream.I tend to sit about 10 feet away with a viewing angle that's not straight on, but rather maybe a 40-45 degree angle and viewability, color and definition are all wonderful.For my Playstation 3/4, Wii U and Xbox 360, this TV has been nothing short of wonderful. Also works well with my AppleTV.I do not tend to use the built-in smart apps as they're replicated across my other devices.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Donald R Hill
Reviews.Content: Great tv at an excellent price point. Love the USB ports and multi media options. Can't beat out for the price.

Reviews.Title: Amazing value!
Reviews.Author: T-bone
Reviews.Content: I bought this when it was on sale for $800 and it is simply the best deal out there bar none at any price point under $1000. I researched extensively before purchasing. I think many of the negative reviews on this Vizio HDTV are based on the REFURBISHED and EARLY PRODUCTION units, not the current new ones. The early production runs did indeed have issues, but it seems to be all sorted out now. Picture is amazing, but I recommended turning down brightness/backlight/color settings to about 50% or less for an unhyped, balanced picture.PICTURE = Awesome.SOUND = Not good, but I expected this because its extremely sleek and thin, there is simply no room for good, bigger speakers. Run it off your home theater setup or get a soundbar and you'll be good.

Reviews.Title: My Friend Loved her  Christmas Gift
Reviews.Author: Kevin Swart
Reviews.Content: This Vizo 60 inch TV was a Great Christmas gift, and it will keep on giving foryears to come.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Taheerah Q. Cobb
Reviews.Content: Caught this tv on sale. WHen delivered they opened the box, placed on my mantle, and set it up for me. I couldn't be happier with this purchase especially since I bought it for such a great price.

Reviews.Title: The picture is fine but the sound
Reviews.Author: Mark Humes
Reviews.Content: The sound could have been better I had a smaller older TV with better sound so by me up grading I thought sound would be the least of my concern

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: bj williams
Reviews.Content: Purchased for gift to myself.  Very pleased with the picture and sound.  Haven't played around with all the "gadgets" yet will soon.  All in all, pleased with purchase.

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality not good
Reviews.Author: Amazing Buyer
Reviews.Content: Get what you pay for. there were black circles/ripple effect in the middle of the screen -- not good picture quality, black levels not good either. very dull picture even after enhanced.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: Gissie
Reviews.Content: works great beautiful picture 3d aromatically sets it self couldn't ask for a better tv. Try it you will like it

Reviews.Title: Great Color
Reviews.Author: jbert
Reviews.Content: I received my tv on Monday.  The delivery was good. Every thing was working, no problems. When my husband set it up..the picture was fantastic. It is bright and clear.  I am still working with the settings for the best  picture.  Every one is different on how they like it.This tv is replacing a DLP that was also a 1080p, 120hz  60 inch.  I though that color was really good, this one is much better.The only problem I have is that with my computer on, some functions won't work with the remote or the side buttons on the tv.  I had to shut off my media sharing.If you are looking for a good tv at a great price, you will be happy with this tv.  I will update more later when I have had the tv longer.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Jeff Daspit
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the Price. Picked it up from Pauls TV for $580 with a 5 year warranty and tax $850. Have only had it for 2 weeks or so but sound and pic are better than what i would have expected. Sound is good enough that i disco'd my sound bar and the pic quality is HD no doubt.

Reviews.Title: Great features, great price...
Reviews.Author: Curtis K. Davis
Reviews.Content: I can not complain with this TV. It is thin, throws no heat and has great picture. The other features are cool, and my games are nice!

Reviews.Title: Great picture and customer service.  Customer service located in the U.S which is a huge plus.
Reviews.Author: Richard           kaiser
Reviews.Content: Picture is awesome.  You feel the shows and sports are going to come out of the tv. Its that clear. Customer service is excellent and is located in the U.S.  You can call customer service at Vizio for free for the life of the tv.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture, Decent Sound ...
Reviews.Author: Glenn Bridges
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV, sharp pictures and the sound is pretty good from a flat TV. The remote buttons are a little  small, but I find this a common problem in many Asian products, even with the higher quality products. The stand is a little wobbly, but it seems to work OK. I would recommend this TV

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Pat McCain
Reviews.Content: It is just what we wanted for our newly remodeled basement. Great picture and sound!! Very good value for the money!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for any price
Reviews.Author: Michael Sering
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because I wanted the best bang for my buck and it has certainly delivered. I have my PC and Xbox 360 hooked up to it and my games and movies have never looked better. The remote is amazingly designed and works perfectly. The smart apps all do what they are supposed to and load quickly.

Reviews.Title: I love the TV
Reviews.Author: Julie A. Prestridge "Working Grandma"
Reviews.Content: A beautiful picture, Easy to connect, easy to work, Easy to hook up.  Delivery person was going to drop it off and I asked him to take it out of the box and set it on the stand, they did for me.  They didn't hook it up or make sure it worked as I thought they would, however I purchased a square trade warranty to cover it for 5 years on Amazon when purchasing the TV and knew it was covered during shipping as well.

Reviews.Title: This is a deal!
Reviews.Author: David J. Marks
Reviews.Content: This is the best TV that I have ever owned. It is bright and makes programs look live. I replaced an eight year old DLP projection TV that was dark and had a $400 bulb that needed replacement every 5-6 years. I hate the internet apps that Vizio provides. They are a pain to access and use and some require paid subscription. I didn't buy this for the apps.

Reviews.Title: Impressive for the price
Reviews.Author: CabGeek
Reviews.Content: The picture is very clear, and the viewing angle is wide enough for my needs. The case is thin and the border around the screen is narrow, so it does not take up a lot of wall space. Basically it is all picture. The sound is not very good but given the lack of space in the cabinet for good speakers this was expected. I bought a separate sound bar to provide better sound. If you already have a receiver than this would be a non-issue. I have notice the flesh tones are off on some content. I have not had time to fine tune the adjustments to see if that takes care of it and some of it may be due to the media type. Overall, I am very pleased with the picture.

Reviews.Title: Man the picture was awesome... for less than 60 days!
Reviews.Author: sightseer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this unit at Best Buy back in March.  Today the TV video just quit. Still have audio, just no picture. Searching the issue this seems to be fairly common.  Called customer support and at first was told no problems it's within 90 days we can get you a new tv out right away.  Just verify purchase and we can move this process along.  Got back on phone with customer support and they tell me after viewing my receipt that alas they are only able to REPAIR???? my brand new tv??  I find it comical that as I'm waiting on hold to talk to customer service I hear how they've won awards for customer service, lol, guess once you win no need to continue.  I'd say stay away from this tv and company all together based on my treatment this evening.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and apps.
Reviews.Author: Joseph J. Johnson
Reviews.Content: The set up was easy and picture quality is great.  I love the apps feature.  It allows me to watch Hulu and Netflix right from the TV.  No more switching to my Blu-Ray player to see Netflix.

Reviews.Title: YOUTUBE app doesn't work
Reviews.Author: S. Sweat
Reviews.Content: Long story short - this tv works just fine for the most part. the YouTube app does not work, however. Netflix works ok. YouTube is just WEIRD! videos you know are there don't come in on search. searches seem limited to ten or so results (????) half the videos that do show up have no picture once you start them, only sound.Don't buy this tv for the apps!!! hopefully they'll upgrade eventually.

Reviews.Title: Awesome sauce...or TV
Reviews.Author: E. Barger "BH-117"
Reviews.Content: I had a Samsung DLP before this and that one made watching TV like Alderaan exploding constantly on screen. But the Vizio...one word: AMAZING. Two words:TOTALLY AWESOME. Three words: LIFE CHANGING EXPERIENCE. TV was easy to set up, light so I could pick it up myself and put it in the entertainment center. I have a Sony 3.1 so it was easy to plug all my peripharies into the Sony and one HDMI right into the TV. The television also walk ed me through the initial setup. I literally took my hand and talked to me in order to do it. Plus it had great reviews for Men's Journal and Men's Health.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Tracy
Reviews.Content: We are very much enjoying our 60in vizio. So many features as a smart tv and great viewing. Makes a hugely wonderful PC monitor as well.

Reviews.Title: Not a Samsung
Reviews.Author: kp1 "king"
Reviews.Content: Bought a Vizio because of price and some reviews that I had read.  Definitely not as vibrant as any of my Samsung tv's.  The Vizio lasted a month and had the usual failure that they are known for.  I read more reviews of their failures and decided to just get a refund a get another Samsung.  Cost a little more, but as always, you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV! So Glad We Bought This.
Reviews.Author: MirandaMowbray
Reviews.Content: So far, my boyfriend and I absolutely love this TV. We've only had it for a few weeks, so I can't speak to how it will hold up over time, but as of right now, it's great.He loves the big size and how the colors look on it, but my favorite part is that we can access Hulu and Netflix right from the TV! No more having to switch over the Xbox to do that.We also like that it has FOUR HDMI ports — no more stupid HDMI switcher for us. The only thing that I can find to complain about with this TV is that, while you can get to Hulu and Netflix and Amazon from the TV, you can't get to HBO Go. It's a bummer, but not a huge deal.

Reviews.Title: best prduct we have fouhd
Reviews.Author: M. D. Bruneau "RAGMAN"
Reviews.Content: picture is wonderful, price was very reasonable, shipping and setup was very well done. would recommend to anyone interested in a 60" TV.

Reviews.Title: Still looking for the problem
Reviews.Author: Hopkin Greenfrog "Hopkin"
Reviews.Content: I'm the the type of person who will find the minor imperfection in everything. I've only been looking for 3 days but I still haven't found it. I returned a 70" Sharp "smart TV" in exchange for this one. I was instantly satisfied with the Vizio in comparison.  I put "smart TV" in quotes on the Sharp because in comparison the Vizio smart functions are actually usable. In addition to being a superior television, buying a large screen TV from amazon is like being treated as royalty. The free delivery service and set up were excellent and more than expected.  I am very pleased. Thanks to the folks on the Woot.com forums for pointing me this way.

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: hw
Reviews.Content: Sound quit in 2 hours good looking tv but when sound worked it sucked returned it and bought a panasonic

Reviews.Title: Wow! The picture!
Reviews.Author: Jinx13US
Reviews.Content: This was a great deal. Having Amazon Prime was great - they made a specific delivery appointment and showed up right on time. Also carried it up to our 3rd floor walk up. The picture is just fantastic, the price is right. This is our 2nd Vizio - our first is still going strong after 7 years. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: This is a great bargain on a super cool TV. Everyone who comes to my house thinks I spent thousands of dollars on the TV. It it like having my own personal movie theater at home. The quality is amazing, there are 4 HDMI ports, and a component hook up. Unlike older tv's it does not have the red, white, yellow hook up. It have the HD component which is Red, White, Green, Blue, and Red Again. If you need to hook up a system that has Red, White and Yellow, just put the yellow plug into the green plug. The "Smart TV" component is a little slower than I would like, typing seems to have some lag, but I consider that a bonus feature anyway. The in-board sound is acceptable, but I got external speakers pretty quickly. If you plan to have a 60" tv in your home, get some good speakers, don't ever expect the on board speakers to match the quality. If you are looking for a large tv at an affordable price, this is your ticket!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Slicknut
Reviews.Content: Found good reviews on Cnet so I bought this one.  It doesn't have a ton of bells and whistles, which I like.  How often does anyone use any of that the ridiculous extras TVs offer today anyway.  Has shortcut buttons to Netflix and Amazon, both of which I use.  Best thing is the full keyboard on the back of the remote.  If you use Netflix a lot, this is an awesome feature.

Reviews.Title: Afraid of reviews
Reviews.Author: Adrián Brenes Ramírez
Reviews.Content: 3 stars so far... is an amazing TV, V:10 A:4 (is a led!), anyway, I have no complain, should be a 5 stars, but, after read like 20 reviews of the TV not working after a couple of months, I have my doubts. I'll update it to 5 in 3 months :P

Reviews.Title: 3 months then went blank
Reviews.Author: Michael Buckley
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed this tv until it just stop working... Now I have to get it fixed and I've only owned it for 3 months. Buy a samsung...

Reviews.Title: bad tv
Reviews.Author: pilotman
Reviews.Content: Bought this 60 inch for myself for christmas. I was very happy until like many thers the picture went out recentlt. It still has audio, just no picture anymore. Amazon picked it up and now getting the 65inch. The 65 doesnt seen to have this issue according to the reviews.

Reviews.Title: Easy Fix to Lip Sync Problem
Reviews.Author: D.G.J.
Reviews.Content: I liked the TV but was frustrated by the crazy bad lip sync problem. Finally found out I had to set BOTH the TV and the input device  audio (PS3, XBox, Apple TV, and Cable Box) to L-PCM instead of surround or Dolby.

Reviews.Title: Blacked out and bummed out
Reviews.Author: Blee0922
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in November at my local SAM'S Club on sale.  I was so excited to put it up in our brand new house, it was our big purchase on our new living room.  For a few months it worked great, only got light use here and there.  But, came home early from work last Monday and the samae thing as everyone else happened; sound and no picture. We unplugged and replugged and gave it a few minutes, but nothing.  This was my first Vizio and my last, my Phillips flat screen still working great after 8 years.  No tv should just break after 2 and half months.  Not only that, but this seems to be a pretty regular occurence.  As soon as I called vizio it took 2 minutes for them to tell me they would replace it.  So they say they will send you a new tv, but beware it will take weeks.  Then the local delivery company stated they'd only delivery Tuesday / Thursday 8-noon.  Do they think no one works, who is going to take a half day just to sit there for a tv. After several phone calls over a few days I did get Vizio to agree to an after hour delivery, which means 4 pm.  My television is set to come today.  I hope that this time it last more than two months.  And I would advise anyone to consider another model. Nothing worse after buying a brand new tv to suddenly have an expensive blakc objecton your wall instead of the working television you thought you bought.

Reviews.Title: Bad buy
Reviews.Author: L. Ontiveros "Cooolbreeez"
Reviews.Content: I bought this model from wal mart on Black Friday. Had to return it just after Christmas do to the picture going out. You could still hear the sound, just no picture. Took it back and they had another one there that someone else returned. The tv was great while it worked, the whole family loved it. Really slim, I thought the picture was really good. Would not buy another one though, not with so many people having the same problem.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV. Beware of defects
Reviews.Author: Nar "duhidunno1"
Reviews.Content: Bought the TV from Walmart Black Friday special. Overall, pleased with TV in terms of picture, features and price. TV worked well for approximately 60 days. Suddenly, the TV flashed and turned off. The TV would not turn back on. I immediately chatted with Vizio who had me try a couple of things. The TV was dead. They gave me the options of sending it back to Vizio or taking it back to Walmart. Luckily Walmart had a 90 day return policy. That's a different story. Needless to say eventually I was able to exchange the set for a 48 serial number. My previous set was a 43 serial number. A separate review mentioned board problems with serial numbers less than 46. I have my fingers crossed.Set is easy to set up. DLNA works pretty well. Wifi works well as do Netflix and Amazon Instant Video. If you use a receiver for audio, you will need an optical audio cable to send audio from TV to receiver for Netflix, Amazon, YouTube or DLNA streaming.Picture quality is good if you follow the CNET post regarding calibration.  If you don't do this the picture is somewhat artificial with a smooth pseudo 3D look. I didn't care for this look. Too artificial. Many Vizio sets do this. Some people like this look.I have a new 90 day clock. Let's see how it fares.  It still is a good set for what I paid. Approximately $200 less than the current price.

Reviews.Title: Great Value for this TV
Reviews.Author: Andrew Z Jones
Reviews.Content: CNet was right when they rated this TV as "Very Good"Pros:  Smart TV, 60 inches.  I think the picture looks very good.Cons: None really that I have found so far.Note: It took a little bit of set up to make the picture look how i wanted it to.  The biggest thing you need to do is turn off the smooth motion feature to make DVDs and Blu-Rays look normal and not like they were really CGI (fake looking) or what some people call the "Soap Opera" effect.  Once I got that turned off it was much easier to watch.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture, great size, functionality, and price
Reviews.Author: David Renz
Reviews.Content: We bought this from Amazon a few weeks before Black Friday.  Aside from a few offered as doorbuster at Walmart, I didn't see it cheaper anywhere else.It was delivered right as scheduled remarkably fast, in about a week as I recall.  The delivery was great.  They brought it right to the TV room in the basement and set it up for me.  Couldn't have been better.The picture is great!  Better than my 46" Sony LCD.  The depth of field is so good it almost feels like 3D at times.The smart TV features Netflix and Hulu Plus (among others) and is far easier to use than through either of my Blue Ray players.My only wish is that the remote had backlit buttons.  The buttons are fairly small and it is almost impossible to use without the lights on.  In the remote's favor, there is a full keyboard on the back that makes it much easier to enter passwords and perform searches.Don't hesitate to buy this.  For the price it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Good value, some issues with universal remotes and sound
Reviews.Author: MsEE
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as a substitute while my larger plasma is in the shop.  My comments:Many inputs, more than usual for the price.Image is good, better than the price would imply.  However, the viewing angle without noticeable color fading is about +/- 50 degrees, not the advertised value.There seems to be no code for the Verizon FIOS remote that works the on/off/vol/mute/input-select functions.  The best I can find (and I've gone to the web and tried over a hundred now), is one that will work the on/off/vol/mute.  Input select just doesn't seem available.  Annoying as it requires keeping the TV remote handy.The speakers are small and tinny.  The TV is intended to be sold with a large subwoffer which may fix that, but since I already have a high end sound system, I don't use the TV speakers.

Reviews.Title: buen producto por el precio
Reviews.Author: Belkys Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Excelente producto. Buena calidad transmisión de imagen. El precio mas competitivo del mercado comparado con las funciones de la tv, el tamaño, entre otros elementos.

Reviews.Title: Visio experience
Reviews.Author: Stosh
Reviews.Content: This is just a increditable tv. I had to learn how to adjust the picture size to eliminate the white lines top& bottom, and once I learned how to change to color settings, this tv is just an incredible experience to watch.
