I decided to buy a Visio sound bar and sub wolfer and it is like setting in my own theater. The tv speakers are in back and they are not very easy to hear. Only draw back that I have found so far. Learn how to make all the adjustments and you will truly not be sorry buying this tv. Remember this tv is really like a computer. It takes time to come on because it's booting up. I am really enjoying my purchase!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!
Reviews.Author: Erik J.
Reviews.Content: This TV was bought to replace a less than 2 year old Samsung that failed.  It has been great, with a much better picture quality than the Samsung it replaced.  All of the issues with lip syncing can be fixed but adjusting your settings.I have not had any issues that others seem to complain about regarding this set and would highly reccommend this TV to anyone looking for a great TV at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 60" Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Vicki Kelley
Reviews.Content: While I am very happy with this purchase, my husband feels that the picture could be better.  Other than that, there are no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great for price but several issues
Reviews.Author: P. Platt
Reviews.Content: I got this for $688 on a Thanksgiving Day special so I can't complain.Pros:Thin bezelNot very thickLots of features including builtin internet connectivity, many apps, DLNA for media serverCons:Lip sync is a BIG problemCan't handle viewing files from large directoriesCalibration out of the box stunk with a dark pictureWhen I first got this I was thrilled with the unboxing. I had expected an older, thick, stripped down TV. This was bought because the price was so great. I was surprised to find a modern design with a thin bezel and a thin back and a lot of internet connectivity. The remote lacks backlighting and isn't programmable but I love the keyboard on the back. A pleasant surprise compared to the TV it replaced was that all audio in is routed to the optical out. That includes analog audio from the component input. This greatly simplified the Sony soundbar hookup since one optical cable is able to handle everything.Once the TV was set up I began to see issues. The picture was dark and two dimensional. After a LOT of playing around the picture is acceptable if not great. I had to disable the auto dimming and crank up the backlight. Boot times for the TV are around 20 seconds. This is on the painfully slow side and required placing a delay into my Harmony remote. I have to lay the remote so it stays pointed at the TV for the 20 seconds to make sure the proper input gets selected when turning the system on. As the system boots it is obvious that backlight uniformity is mediocre but during day to day viewing it isn't noticeable.YouTube looks great and it is nice to have the apps on the TV. Using them is pretty straight forward. Unfortunately I can't use the TV's DLNA features to view files on my media server. I have ripped my collection of over 1,000 CD's and the TV chokes on the large directory. I can eventually (and I mean after tens of minutes) get my video files to show but the process is too painful to be useful. This is a big disappointment because it means using the PS3 for media files and accepting the many limitations that brings.I can easily live with all of the issues previously mentioned. The one that continues to annoy is lip sync. As time goes on it gets worse and worse. The result is that every now and then I turn the TV off and back on to reset the sync. It's never really correct. The slow boot time makes resetting even more painful.Am I glad I bought it? Yes. At the price I wish I would have gotten a second one but this is a value buy.  Going from my old 52" to a 60" is very noticeable.

Reviews.Title: All I can say is "Wow".  Color me impressed!!!
Reviews.Author: Gary Mac
Reviews.Content: I just picked this up yesterday - and although I buy a LOT here at Amazon, I ended up getting this from Target because of the amazing sale they had combined with my son-in-law's discount but I can honestly say that even if you pay a couple of hundred more than I did you're still going to be VERY happy with this TV.We have been watching a six or seven year old Toshiba 42 inch LCD flat screen that we've had mounted on the wall.  It has a good picture - certainly nothing wrong with it and at the time we bought it I thought it was one of the best pictures I had ever seen but it was showing its age and I wanted something new since we just bought new furniture and will be repainting and moving everything around anyway.I had decided I wanted something larger and the 60" sounded like a good size - and in the store it really didn't look all that big - but in my room, it looks HUGE (in a very GOOD way).  Combined with the surround sound it really does feel like you're in the theater.Now, I'm an electronics/gadget guy - always have been and always will be.  My wife is decidedly NOT.  She has never been "wowed" with any electronics I've purchased (she may like them, but never wowed by them).  This TV changed that.  Last night we watched several different things through cable, Netflix, Huluplus, games on the XBOX and a Blu Ray on the PS3.  We were even streaming from the iMac upstairs and the picture was phenomenal.  On every single occasion she kept saying "I can't believe how good that picture is".  When we were watching "The Dark Knight Rises" on BluRay she must have said it seven or eight times during the movie - and coming from my wife that's high praise indeed.We had been able to watch Netflix, Huluplus, etc. through the PS3 or XBOX previously but it makes it much simpler to be able to do it directly from the TV itself and cuts back on the amount of power used since the only device that will have to be on to use it is the TV rather than the TV plus the other device.In short, we are thrilled with the quality of the picture on this TV and would strongly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded from 50" plasma insignia
Reviews.Author: Marcus
Reviews.Content: Upgraded and couldn't be happier. Played with color and me and my family love it. We love the large screen size while watching and looks like my old 50" when off. Very happy with purchase. Picture is great with no issues of quality.

Reviews.Title: Nice tv with wifi, but I could never adjust the color to my satisfacyion.
Reviews.Author: F. Woodard
Reviews.Content: I liked the tv alright but I just coundn't get the color adjusted perfectly. Couldn't get the deep rich color I desire in a set. Maybe it was just me. Also had trouble a few times with the tv not responding to the remote. Tried another set of batteries and it still wouldn't work. I returned the tv.I know a lot of people rate this tv really high. Maybe I just got a bad one, or I just need training in how to adjust color. I always heard Vizio was a great tv, so I wouldn't discourage anyone from trying it.

Reviews.Title: Everything is great
Reviews.Author: cj
Reviews.Content: Except once in a while there is ghosting on fast action... AND the menu items are not crisp and clear the way you would expect. They look fuzzy and soft like a jpg that has been optimized too much.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E601i-A3 60 in LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Bones
Reviews.Content: I loved the 60in size, the thin chassis, 4 HDMI inputs and the keyboard remote.  On the weak side was the screen brightness, I had to make sure the room was always on the dark side to get a good picture that was not washed out by morning sun shine.  Would have liked at least 2 RCA inputs, and the start up time for the screen to light up is way too long.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Value for the Size and Quality
Reviews.Author: E. McNeill
Reviews.Content: So far I have been very impressed with this television, especially at the $688 price point from the Amazon Lightning deal.  While it clearly isn't a top end Samsung or Sharp, it is very close in build quality and its picture quality can only be beat by their top models.  The Vizio's bezel is very thin, at 60 inches it simply looks gorgeous.  Vizio made several moves on this television that I commend them for.  The Vizio logo does not light up, and is on the bottom right.  This makes makes the TV look very clean.  The only indication light is very small and on the bottom left corner.  It shines through a foggy plastic so it doesn't shine directly at anything or light up the room.Now on to the picture quality.  Well, its good.  For the size the quality of the picture really is fantastic, I am often unimpressed by skin tones on brighter films and TV shows.  The black levels are good, not great.  I noticed some uniformity issues in the lighting, but its more of a clouding not light leakage.  Its only noticeable on an all black screen and even then, its not that bad.  Overall its very good, watching high definition movies and sports is as close to a movie theater experience as I've ever had.  It also performs very well with ambient light, my living room has windows all across the opposite wall.  Despite having blinds, my previous projection LCD television really lost its picture during the day, this one still looks great.I haven't played around much with the Smart TV capabilities.  I connected to my router and tested Netflix really quick.  It was a pain free process and seemed to work well.  But I will admit, I have almost no interest in this feature but at the price point its a better value than TV's without it.The remote is nice, but I prefer the longer profile and the keyboard on the back provides me little use while not using the Smart capabilities.The speakers are pretty much crap, but if you expect quality sound out of a TV 2 inches thick your dreaming.At $999, I might consider looking at finding the 60" Sharp on sale instead.  But you can't go wrong with this TV, the picture quality and build quality are inching closer and closer to 1st tier.  Vizio is changing the game in this industry.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: This TV is replacing a 46 inch 4 year old flat screen and the difference is amazing.  The quality of the picture for the price is amazing!  The built in apps and netflix are equally awesome!Update-Had the TV for a month now and I can say this is the best TV on the market.  Amazon video works flawlessly, and Netflix is so easy to use on this set.  I was worried about the wifi connection not being fast enough but I have had no problems at all.  I am very impressed with this TV.  I got mine at $688 with the lightning deal, but even at $999 you will not find a better TV on the market right now.  Best of all there are updates to the app store that keeps the TV current.  The keyboard on the back of the remote is a great feature for typing in search items or updating facebook.  Also the weather apps are great and you can easily get to everything you need on this TV with just pushing the "V".  I have never been more excited about a new TV!!

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Beckey James
Reviews.Content: This is a good TV for the money. My Samsung still has a better picture. I did not think I would care about the web but it is a very nice feature to have. It is a large TV so it is only appropriate for a large room.

Reviews.Title: Very good deal
Reviews.Author: Derrick Veeder
Reviews.Content: I got this TV on the black friday deal.  It is a very nice TV and a major upgrade from my 35" tube TV.  The ONLY con is I was expecting a Skype app, but it isn't there.  I assume it is coming soon.  Even with the lack of the skype app, I highly recommend this TV.  Colors are vivid and there is NO ghosting.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Michelle V.
Reviews.Content: What a TV. The shipment was three days later than the scheduled arrival date. However, the TV is crystal clear, wonderful contrast. Looks like real people. The apps and internet is great the remote is out of Star Trek. Just flip it over and it works like a mini keyboard. Still trying to learn everything. Just thought I would let you guys know that this is a great buy for the money. It was so thin. I thought it was going to be thicker. This was great. I bought the Cheetah mount that mount worked great and it kind move in all kinds of direction. Another great buy. Love the internet connection and everything was so easy to set up. Wow I got a whole lot (60 inch) for a reasonable price, and I didn't have to stand in line for it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: KIBILL
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is amazing! Set up was a breeze. Can't wait for Sunday football! Watching TV feels very real with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!
Reviews.Author: StationMike
Reviews.Content: The new 60' LED by Vizio has a gorgeous picture with a very narrow frame that makes it look like all picture.  Decent sound quality and easy to get to Netflix, Amazon, etc.  This is my fourth Vizio (37', (2) 42" and now the 60").  Best value among all TV brands.

Reviews.Title: WOW !!! - update 1/1/13
Reviews.Author: NC10735285
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on 11/16/12 - Let me start by saying I've been shopping for a new TV since August 2012 - doing my research both online and in person.  When it comes to a major purchase, it's not something that I can do "at the drop of a hat".Before I purchased this Vizio, I also researched Samsung, LG, and Sharp - all the same size (60)with the same "smart" features.Understanding that my previous TV was a Sony DLP - while it too was also HD - there is no match between the two sets - the picture quality on the Vizio is sharp, clear and stunningly crisp. I have the set mounted on my wall (used the PowerBridge TWFP-WW thINWALL Solution Cable Management Kit and Advanced Slim Tilting TV Wall Mount for 32 to 60 inch LED, Plasma, LCD, and Televisions).  I would reccomend running and connecting 4 HDMI cables  - even if you only use one currently, you may want to add later.UPDATE # 1 - well all was good until Sunday 12/30/12 - just in tme for bowl game week - the whole TV went Kuput!!!  It was fine one second and then the picture went away - then no sound - - attempted every recovery I could think of  - Contacted Vizio support - - long story short they are sending a new TV - had the choice of having a repair service come and fix this one or a new one being delivered. I choose to get a new one - but.......... it could take 2 weeks -  guess I'll be watching the games on a smaller TV (wife doesn't care but.......)The set was 45 days old - so the location I purchased from has a 30 return policy - then it's the manufactors responsibility - so Vizio it taking full responsibility.Here are my thoughts - the main board (mother board) has gone bad - no warning,  - reading the reviews from all over the internet - seems that Vizio got a batch of bad board adn they know it - but the sets are out among the general populationDuring the 45 days, the picture quality was excellent - internet apps were good - sound from the set itself is OK - but go ahead and buy a sound bar it's worth the $$.UPDATE # 2 - 1/16/13OK, so I finally got my replacement TV from VIZIO - it took exactly 12 days (including the new years day holiday).  The replacement came in a new box and seems brand new - divlivery agent (manna) unloaded it from the truck, and un packed the TV in my home.  Took the "old" TV and repacked it into the box.The new TV has worked better from the initial setup - internet connections were quicker - signal is stronger, or at least the connection seems to be faster without any new hardware on the wireless transmission end.  In the few days that I've had the TV back everything on the internet works better.  Therefore I'm guessing the old TV was a lemon.Previously mentioned - TV is wall mounted with all cables and wires behind wall - While the TV was down, I went ahead and ran two additional HDMI cables (total of 4) and one VGA cable. So now that the new set is back up and runnig I'll be able to add any devices I want in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Lynne
Reviews.Content: This TV was a great deal!  We shopped around and this was best price for all the options.Amazon offered free shipping with enhanced delivery, means it arrives by appt and the person takes it out of the pkg and makes sure it works.  We were able to set it up pretty easily (we have no clue about these things) so had to buy a few new cables to make everything work.  No problems so far, we love the TV

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it for the price
Reviews.Author: Richco
Reviews.Content: For $1 under a thousand bucks you get a 60 inch led screen, apps and 120hz refresh rate. This is my first Vizio but it certainly won't be my last.

Reviews.Title: Purchase NOW!!!!  Amazing
Reviews.Author: John F. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Owning Tv's for several years Vizio is the perfect balance of Cost/Price. Picture quality is Amazing and having internet apps where you can watch youtube videos and connect this tv with Facebook and other web applications is great. For $999 you will NOT find a better TV, purchase and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Great Price - Excellent Service
Reviews.Author: James R. Getten "Jim"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this set to replace a 42" Vizio that I bought in '08 and still works great. We moved to a new home with a large family room so it needed a larger screen. The 60" set arrived in three days shipped from Virginia to Idaho. The delivery service unpacked and set up the TV to be sure it worked properly. The picture is awesome and the WiFi setup was a breeze. My Sunday football has never looked so good. Thanks Amazon!VIZIO E601i-A3 60-inch 1080p 120Hz Razor LED Smart FHDTV

Reviews.Title: The Most Affordable Large 60" LED Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Chi H. Cheng "Chi H Cheng"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy to read the information of this new model from the news paper.I ordered this TV for a waiting period about 2 weeks. During this period I am very anxious to read the User Manual and download the PDF Files and get familiar with it.The package was securely packed and delivered to my home and opened at the designated location and tested with proper care.The performance of the new TV is very nice and everything is better than what I expected. The Remote Control is more convenience to use when you need to input the Text or Password etc.I am very happy with this choice and purchase.For peace of mind do not forget to get the Warranty from the Square Trade.At least you can get a 5 Years Long Trouble Free Warranty.

Reviews.Title: So bad I returned it
Reviews.Author: Mark Schweber
Reviews.Content: I am not in the habit of returning items but I returned this one (thank you Amazon for making it easy and free). Nor am I in the habit of writing one star reviews. But this product is inferior and I think I need to share my opinion.This TV has very poor picture quality. Even with extensive adjustments it looked washed out and unclear. The viewing angle was narrow. Even a bit off center and it stated to fade. Also motion on the screen was literally making me feel ill.Instead I got a 60" Samsung. Yes it was $500 more but it is well worth it. It is clear, crisp, viewable from a wide angle and the motion is smooth.That the Samsung is so much better just makes me even happier I got rid of the Vizio and confirms to me that the Vizio is an awful TV.If you want a 60" buy something else. If you can not spend more you would be much better with a smaller screen with a better picture.

Reviews.Title: Lots of Minor "Pros" but Too Many Major "Cons"
Reviews.Author: unkqty
Reviews.Content: It's only been 48 hrs but there are too many issues to warrant keeping this one.Would love to give this item a higher rating but can't.  Maybe it's just a lemon...(?)Pro: Easy setup, wide viewing angles, variety of customizable picture presets, 4 HDMI inputs, simple WiFi & working apps, interesting two-sided remote (instead of keyboard) that allows for texting-style inputCon: Quality concerns; although HD, picture appears "filtered" (not sharp); limited connections for other-than-HDMI componentsSettled on this unit based upon input from Consumer Reports and other user ratings, plus it was in stock at major reputable retailer.Initial connections were intuitive.  Wireless fired off right away and indicated better reception than Kindle Fire and the TV it replaced.  Variety of apps worked right away.  Electronic user manual complements printed version, which is more or less just a quick start manual.Despite several positive aspects and favorable reviews, can say that I'm not impressed.Issues:1) Red lead for component connection initially didn't work.  A bit of working with the wires seemed to fix it.2) "Vivid" setting made everyone look orange on the first day but could be edited.  It seemed to settle down a bit by day #2.3) Picture appears muted/grayed and a bit fuzzy.  Although it's a high resolution/HD unit, the lines aren't clear and sharp, as though viewed through a filter (hence the need to use modified "vivid" setting).  Sometimes the picture is great, other times not so much.4) Sound drops off randomly for 30-90 seconds - sometimes just a bit, other times altogether - then returns.  Doesn't seem to have anything to do with large changes in sound levels (as in a suspense/action movie).  Changing volume control doesn't help.  Suspect faulty sound amplifier (already).5) Although I suppose it's nice to have 4 HDMI connections, I'd trade one or two of them for the ability to connect more than one "legacy" component (i.e., another set of RCA jacks).Have owned this for a little over 48 hours; it's going back.I thought about giving this a 3-star review until the sound issue resurfaced.Read through the other 1 & 2 star reviews and consider the quality you need, balanced against the possibility of the pain you'll encounter when the unit gives out at the 7-day/60-day/just out of warranty period as detailed by other reviewers.If you DO choose to purchase this one, I'd pay the extra few dollars for the extended warranty.ORYou can put that and a few more dollars together to purchase a more reputable unit.

Reviews.Title: Poor customer service
Reviews.Author: Robert Andrews
Reviews.Content: I bought a Vizio E601i-a3 from a box store ( 1.5 hours away )because our TV went out. After getting our old projection TV moved, stand in p;ace and everything set-up hit the power button on the renote and the TV would not power up. Tried new set batteries, stood right in front of tv, TV would power up by power button on TV but you can't program it and it defaults to store demo mode without the remote working. First this is poor design and second customer service said they were sending a new renmote but when I asked when I should get it they said it would go out in 7-9 days. I said you have to be kidding. They said that was their policy. I tried contacting again and got the same response its out policy for accesorries. Its not an accessory if its the only way to get TV working. This just made me never ever want another Vizio product due to extremely poor setvice!

Reviews.Title: Broken item !!!
Reviews.Author: sky
Reviews.Content: TV does not work!!! When I turn it on there is no picture!! This item is broken !! I need a different one

Reviews.Title: Three TV's in Less Than a Year
Reviews.Author: Jeffery M Soule II
Reviews.Content: Vizio really didn't do their best on this television.  My first one had a red line going down the right side of the screen within the first 3 months it was purchased.  When I reported this to Vizio they blamed Amazon's shipping practices and provided me with a "refurbished" one.  That TV worked for another 3 months then the pictured went out.  I went back and forward with Vizio and 3 weeks later I'm still waiting on my "brand new" replacement.One another note, the wifi streaming is limited at best (even with turbo cable internet), both TVs repeatedly lost the login information for my home network, BUT the remote works well enough.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E601i-A3 Dead in 3 monts!
Reviews.Author: neno
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv in February 11, 2013.  This TV dead in June 2013. I called customer services and they told me that this fail is present in a group of these TVsThe fail is that the sound is in the low position and the menu functions do not answer.You can see the video in http://youtu.be/beIZKL8ea_EDo not buy this brand

Reviews.Title: over all a good tv
Reviews.Author: Kieth
Reviews.Content: this was a good choice for the bedroom.rear firing speakers make you turn the volume up quite a bit to hear good.you have to remember that this is 120hz and fast moving images may not show very clear.surround sound wil improve the volume problem and setting the TV back a bit improves the picture.

Reviews.Title: Used means Really Used
Reviews.Author: Brent Juhasz
Reviews.Content: Check your Tv with the Shipping carrier twice... Then recheck everything again before you sign. My tv looked great because I was so excited to get it I overlooked that my tv was bent on the top and the side... Make sure you also change the input to something that will display a actual picture to make sure that all the pixels are displaying and there are no discolorations. My tv came slightly bent and has minor discoloration but it still is a great tv for 700.00 used; if your okay with a few minor details. The only down fall of this tv if it was brand new would be the wireless connectivity... It will sometimes disconnect and if your internet is running a little sluggish your tv wont even know what the internet is.... Also I wish there were more apps to choose from you are a little limited on what is out there....

Reviews.Title: the BEST TV
Reviews.Author: Bece "bbbc904"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE IT!  I Went from a 27" Vizio to this 60". Picture looks like the people are in my living room, the control is tooo hot!  Keyboard on one side, regular stuff on the other. Purchase, delivery and product all FANFRIGGINTASTIC

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: vvixzio
Reviews.Content: Picture quality was average at best. It stopped working altogether within 2 weeks . The mounting hardware came with no instruction.

Reviews.Title: No Picture
Reviews.Author: Think
Reviews.Content: Received new Vizio 60 inch razor thin TV on November 27 1021. It was installed middle of Dec by the Geek Squad. Love the picture and sound for about 6 weeks - then on the same day as the Super Bowl the picture went away. Not able to get help from anyone! Very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: Stunningly beautiful picture.
Reviews.Author: anne patrick
Reviews.Content: We love our new 60 inch Vizio.  Everything about it is amazing.  This is our third Vizio tv purchase.  Recently added a  new dvd recorder to it and the dvds we have recorded have amazing picture quality  too.  Be sure to read the specs and see how much higher the picture resolution is on this one when compared to the Vizio 50 or 55 inch models.  Get this model.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Picture - Lips Never In Sync
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful TV, with amazing picture quality and the smart TV apps work 9 out of 10 times (it crashed a couple times requiring me to unplug the TV).I have nothing negative to say about how movies, sports, tv shows look on this picture, however, the lips are out of sync with the sound way more than I would like it to be. I've spoken with their tech support many times and they asked me to switch my receiver to PCM setting and set the TV to PCM settings. Even so, if you plug your fiber optic cable directly from the TV to a receiver you will never get the sound to be in sync with the lips.The closest thing to getting it right is plugging the fiber optic from the cable box to receiver, but it still isn't perfect. If you're using multiple devices - Xbox, PS3, Blue Ray, you will have to switch your fiber optic cable each time or have a receiver that allows multiple inputs. If you use the smart app and plug TV to receiver, you will get a delay in the audio, which makes watching the smart apps pretty useless.I'll rate this TV a 5 for the picture, but a 1 for the audio problems giving it an average of 3

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Ed "Mrs.Ed"
Reviews.Content: We love our new Vizio. The remote has an amazon button and Netflix button so you press it once and it lists the shows youre watching. Great feature.

Reviews.Title: 60" VIZIO LED TV will blow your mind.
Reviews.Author: Bill Smith
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the other review are talking about with the bad sound, lines, and light leakage. I pulled this TV out of the box, put it on the stand, plugged it in and was blown away with the picture and sound. The value I got it for was amazing, I wouldn't pay $999 for it. It replaced out 52" Rear projection Tv. I am so pleased with our purchase I would recommend it to anyone. The apps work great for me and it was easy to connect it to my Wireless home network. Wonderful TV.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Value
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: I was given this TV as a gift, and let me tell you, it rocks!  The picture is amazingly crisp and clear - even at side angles.  I love the Vizio Internet apps, which allow Amazon Video, Netflix, Yahoo! apps, etc...  You would be hard pressed to find a TV in this price range that provides this value.  I spent a lot of time looking at TV's, and had settled on this very model which was a Christmas gift.  Overall, I could not be happier with this TV.  I've got numerous TV's in my home, from Samsung to Westinghouse, etc...  This TV blows them all away.

Reviews.Title: I am happy with this Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: Aboobacker M. Cheetha "aboo"
Reviews.Content: I bought this VIZIO E601i-A3 60 inch from Costco since my 46 inch LCD SONY TV broke.All my electronics are SONY brand and I started loosing my confidence on SONY due to its poor quality on the products it produced lately. Many of my friends are shared the same opinion and it is sad to see such a brand is losing its name.My new VIzio is a 60 inch TV and the price is less than $1000(after rebate) which makes this TV more attractive. But Costco calculating the tax on pre-rebate price. I paid $1200 approx  including 5 year warranty (Costco + Square Trade). My family loves this TV and we have watched many movies via Netflix and YouTube. I have flinged youtube from my computer and it works as expected.  I have only one concern which I am not sure whether it is a problem or the way TV works. When I switch on the TV and watch a HD movie, the picture does not come up in HD mode instantly and a takes a little time (4-5 sec) to show in HD. Is it an issue?. Anybody has experienced this?. Please reply to this post or email me bflabu@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: Black Friday Deal was a JOKE! But the TV is solid.
Reviews.Author: Dr. Space
Reviews.Content: The TV? Love it. Bought it from Walmart Black Friday (They did a great job of lining people up and letting us know how many were available.) SO much lighter than my old 60" plasma and the picture is creepy life-like. As my son said, "every show looks like a soap-opera"! We dialed down the colors to "movie" setting and it took some of that away, but I will admit it will take a while to get used to the amazing refresh rate. It has every sort of feature except...YOUTUBE! What IS the deal with YOUTUBE? First ROKU, now Vizio! YOUTUBE is clearly displayed on all advertisements, but when I pull up the channels it is no where to be seen! Minor but annoying as I subscribe to several YOUTUBE shows and thought I'd finally get to see them in on a glorious 60" display. So far, not so much. I would definitely buy this TV as I love it and the remote. One other minor complaint, the wall-mount screws are crazy short and are useless with any of the heavier mounts. Frankly I'm not sure how they'd reach the threads even if the mount plate was paper-thin.Pros: Picture, remote, price as Walmart sale, weightCons: wall mount screws, lack of YOUTUBEDefinitely a "Buy"IMPORTANT NOTE FOR AMAZON BLACK FRIDAYTried to buy this on Amazon's Black Friday. I have a fast connection and was ready to go when it went on sale at 8:30 Thursday. I would LOVE to know how many TVs were allotted for the sale to "match" Walmart. One? Four? What a scam! When I clicked the box the instant it went on sale the screen said "waitlist full". But on the regular $999 screen they had plenty of the TVs for sale (just not at that amazing price of Walmart). I shop Amazon a ton for the convenience, but I do not like the way they run their holiday sales. They should SHOW how many of each thing they have for sale (like they normally do) - not the nonsensical "percentage sold". Brick and mortar stores used to pull the same scam. They'd let 100 people line up to buy 5 X-Boxes or whatever - knowing full well that the last 95 people had no chance. After a few minor riots from rightfully indignent customers they stopped that nonsense and let people know exactly how many sets are available so the consumer could gauge when to show up or if it was even worth their time. I love my new TV from Walmart - where they told us how many they had and sold them at the sale price until they were OUT of stock, but as far as I'm concerned Amazon was intentionally vague and misleading since they had plenty more in stock - but chose not to sell them at the advertised price. This is the first time I've noticed them doing this sort of thing. I hope it's not a trend.12/10/12After a firmware update it now has access you Youtube. Which is good. The down side is on many programs I'm still getting a white flicker/line across the top. Have tinkered with setting to no avail. Only seems to happen on Dish, never on Blu-Ray. Bumping up one star for they Youtube update. Waiting to see of the white line goes away.6/14/2014 Another firmware update eventually removed the white flicker. And the Youtube software seems more responsive even tho I have not upgraded my internet. The picture is still terrific and the remote appears to be indestructible (3 kids 3 dogs and one relative who can't seem to watch where he steps later...). Adding a star for the number of times the remote has be bounced across the hardwood floor without dying...

Reviews.Title: Great TV For The Money
Reviews.Author: Dan Carver III
Reviews.Content: I had waited to purchase at least a 60 inch LED TV since last Christmas.  I just thought the prices were too high last year and was hoping they would come down a bit.  That's when I noticed this TV for sale a few weeks ago and could not pass it up.  I upgraded from a high-end 40 inch Sony LCD TV but the screen just wasn't big enough.  So I purchased the TV and it was delivered for free with enhanced delivery.  The enhanced delivery meant that a guy showed up during an appointment window that I set up, unpacked the TV, and helped me put it on my tv stand to make sure it worked before he left.  He was very nice and professional.  I can tell you that I like almost everything about this tv, the "smart" feature makes it easy to watch Netflix, the picture is huge, and the picture is great, at least when you're watching HD channels.  I have 7 other led tvs in my house and none are this large; however, the other tvs seem to be much more clear and precise when watching regular cable channels.  The other TVs are not as large but the picture on this Vizio looks terrible in standard def.  The other issue is that the picture when watching standard def. is that the normal picture is about half the size of the screen and the picture quality gets even worse if you stretch, zoom, etc. I have HD channels with my cable subscriber so I just changed my DVR to record all of my programs on HD channels and its great.  If I had standard definition channels only, however, I would hate the picture quality of this tv.  Like I said, it may have a little to do with the size of the screen, but I think its partly the tv picture quality as well.

Reviews.Title: Love the picture, hate the problems ***UPDATED***
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "Farshooter"
Reviews.Content: It took a week to get the TV after I ordered it and when it arrived, I was surprised how thin it was and how awsome it looked once I got it on the wall. Not much bigger than the 47" I am replacing...then the trouble started. As another reviewer mentioned, the TV started powering off randomly as well as other problems;PROs- Great Picture- All the apps I use on a regular basis on other devices in one place- Digital Audio is better than previous TV- Easy setupCons- Won't hold wireless settings- Both Netflix and Amazon cut out after about 10+ min of playing (could be my network, but I really don't think so)- Random deactivationsAmazon is sending me a free replacement, but it will be another week before it arrives. If that one does the same as this, it will get returned completely and I will have to either go back to my old 47" Sharp or get something else. Needless to say, I am not real happy with Vizio right now.***UPDATE***Got the replacement a few weeks ago and it is much better than the first one. One new issue was lipsync. On some of the HD channels the lipsync would start out fine and then stray to multiple seconds off. The lipsync option in the menus only went to the + side, not the -, which is where I needed to go. When I had finally reached the point of returning it yet again, I did some research and found that the way I had my soundbar hooked up might have been the problem. I had my cable box going to HDMI 1 and Optical Out to my sound bar from the TV. What I read said to have the cable box go directly to the amplifier (soundbar) and have the hook up from the amp go to HDMI 1. I made the change HDMI to Soundbar, Soundbar HDMI to HDMI 1 on tv, no more sync problems!!!Pros- Same as above + no more light bleedCons- WiFi is still a little wonkyOther than the one con, it is a great TV for the price. If I could have afforded a Sony or another Sharp, I would have purchased one of those; but I am pretty happy with the Vizio now. Not for the non-power user I really the only caveat I would add :)I will update the review as soon as I get the replacement.

Reviews.Title: Did not buy this from Amazon
Reviews.Author: T. James "T.J."
Reviews.Content: I did not buy this from amazon but it's the same 60 in Vizio.  I have played with the picture setting but the quality of this picture cannot light a candle to the plasma I replaced it with.  Who ever said the picture is stunning must have never had a quality set.  I had it mounted over the fireplace. I guess I am going to have to take it down. I can't settle for the quality of this picture.  What a waste of time and money.TJI wanted to add that there are two more issues with the TV.  Most LED' screens do not reflect the light. This one does, also if you look at the screen from an angle the picture quality degrades.TJ

Reviews.Title: Warning do not buy this tv!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: All i got to say is what a piece junk this TV turned out to be. Had it for a whole TWO months and it stopped working on me. Will go to turn it on and it will flash the Vizio symbol for a second and the TV will go black. Can hear music or television shows going but no picture whatsoever.People can say that this is a great TV and all but don't take your chances. I did and its gotten me nothing but frustration. Save yourself from stress and go with a model from LG or Samsung or Sony. Had a LG 46 inch model and had no problems with it. Heck even my cheap Westinghouse out lasted this TV by 6 years!!! Come on Vizio! You expect people to spend $1000 dollars on a TV and two months later it stops working??? I will never buy a Vizio again.There are a number of things you expect to work for a long while after you buy them and a TV is one of them. So as a future warning to all who are thinking of buying this TV and thinking you are getting a great deal, you aren't, go with something else. Anything else for that matter!!Hope the supposedly great customer service of Amazon will pull through so i can get this out of my house and a better TV brought in.

Reviews.Title: Great Flat screen
Reviews.Author: MOO
Reviews.Content: This is a really great T.V. with a great picture. I like the smooth picture feature. I use the vivid picture feature and it really works great. I have only owned Sony products in the past and was hesitant on purchasing a Vizio, but the quality is pretty good.  Before I purchased I was using a 46" Sony LCD 1080p. Compared to the Vizio the Vizio is Better. And for the price your cant beat it. I paid much more for my Sony a few years ago than I did for this new  Vizio. I am very happy with my new purchase on black friday for 700.00 bucks. I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but.....Not Skype Friendly
Reviews.Author: Zosomon
Reviews.Content: Bought the TV a few weeks ago and had Skype app installed. Just received the Vizio camera and when I tried to use Skype I discovered the app was missing. Apparantly the last automatic firmware update removed Skype compatibility with this model only. All the other Vizio tvs with Skype were not affected. Vizio techs say they are working on the problem but cannot tell me when or if Skype will be working again. Very disappointing!!! In regards to the tv itself, In LOVE it!!! Great picture, sound, easy set up, and best of all was the price. Worth every penny and would have gotten 5 stars if not for the Skype glitch.

Reviews.Title: Met my expectations
Reviews.Author: Ike
Reviews.Content: The CNET review for best TVs under 999 says it all.  Delivery was on time and everything met my expectations.  I got the recommended wall mount (tight to the wall) it worked great, just needed a 2' screw driver to finish.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: james buettner
Reviews.Content: Good if you have cable but does not show future programming on over the air digital signal.  The guide button does the same thing as the info button on the remote(shows current program info),  So, you do not know what future programs are coming using the television.  Called the company help line and they had no explanation other than it would not do that and the remote is used on several different sets.  If I had know that upfront I probably would not have bought it.

Reviews.Title: The BEST OF the "BEST"
Reviews.Author: K. M. ward
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best LED 60" HD TVs there is bar none. GO VIZIO, BUY ONE AND YOU WILL LOVE IT, IT IS THE BEST!!!!!!!!!!!!! KEN IN WASHINGTON STATE. HOW COULD you WANT MORE!

Reviews.Title: Bad Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Mo Hazar Mulafer "Mo reviews"
Reviews.Content: This TV was nothing but problems from the day I plugged onto an outlet. Issues with audio, from broken speaker noises to sudden mute, I think its a common issue with this brand, I did some research, Will NEVER buy low end brands anymore, Should have stayed with Panasonic.  Got this because of the price, not worth $990. The Panasonic was $400 more, Big Mistake buying Vizio.  Very bad Customer Service from Vizio, My Friend  had similar issues with vizio

Reviews.Title: 2 Strikes Your Out
Reviews.Author: Seabee
Reviews.Content: Received my first Vizio and the remote would not work for volume and menu. Received my second Vizio one week later and the same thing, returned it.. Amazon customer service is a 5 star rating. The Vizio does not even get a 0 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Product Was Defective, Vizio Customer Service Did Not Help Much
Reviews.Author: Charles "Phone User"
Reviews.Content: Issues:* Remote failed to operate properly upon delivery.  It kept repeating whatever button was pushed.* The next day, the remote failed to operate completely.* Another universal remote experienced that same issue as the day of delivery.* It was almost impossible to remove the battery cover, and hence remove the battery, which is what Vizio customer service requested.* Vizio customer service was not knowledgeable about the product.  They agreed to send another remote in 7 to 10 business days.* Vizio customer service never acknowledged the television had an issue, even after telling them about the universal remote experience.* If the remote operated, it looked to be overly complicated and non-intuitive.* The buttons on the side of the TV were small and difficult, if not impossible, to read in normal light.  These buttons are intended to be used in place of the remote.Thank goodnes the product was purchased through Amazon, which agreed to take back the product and provide a full refund.  Pass on this TV until Vizio improves it and provides better customer service.

Reviews.Title: You may add several hundred $ to price for when it breaks!
Reviews.Author: J. Knight
Reviews.Content: My Vizio TV broke down a few months after the warranty ran out.  I did some research online and this looks to be pretty common.  The lifetime technical support was laughable. The repair company asks twice as many questions as did Vizio.  You get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: LOVE !!!
Reviews.Author: Christine J. Warren
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome TV! Haven't quite figured out how everything works as of yet...not thats its hard, just haven't had the time to 'play' with it as of yet ! This has been mounted in out downstairs family room that is still under construction, so looking forward to see what this tv all does ! Everything so far is amazing !

Reviews.Title: Greater
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel
Reviews.Content: I love this product cos it great nd I love it its got clear picture perfect than I thought and also it got clear sound

Reviews.Title: Its big but leaves a lot to be desired
Reviews.Author: dan maltese
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is just OK.  Not great for sports.  The lip syncing is off during live games as well.  Despite having a lip sync adjustment, I could not get it to match up.  Also disappointed by the smart TV features.  You are better off saving the money on that option and spend five bucks on a cable to hook up your laptop.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy!!!
Reviews.Author: Jeff Patton
Reviews.Content: I had purchased a different model/brand.  The sound and picture were bad.This TV is such a good deal.  I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my vizio
Reviews.Author: David Crookshanks
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my Vizio No happy when I found it at walmart for 688.00 for black friday. I should have waited

Reviews.Title: great tv so far
Reviews.Author: JoE
Reviews.Content: I was able to get it at 688 on BF lightening deal. The TV set came yesterday. So far so good. It's huge next to the 37" sharp one. The color is satisfactory. I don't use the internet feature, so no complain about that. Definitely worth the money. For $688, its a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Christmas Present To Myself
Reviews.Author: jaida
Reviews.Content: I waited in Walmart for 11 hours and was first in line to get their Black Friday deal for $688. This tv was a good buy at $999 but even better for what I paid. The panel is so thin and the picture so crisp. It was so easy to setup, that my teenage kids did it themselves while I was still out shopping. Add the sound bar and subwoofer combo and I've got a movie theatre in my living room. Video games in HD...who can resist that? I finally got the big screen I was looking for for what others charge for smaller sets. Go ahead and purchase yours today.

Reviews.Title: Big TV!!
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Bought this on the Black Friday deal at Walmart.  $688 for a 60" LED smart TV?  WOOOO!!  Got it set up in no time, hooked up the surround system to it, fell in love instantly.  Nice TV for the 1k, even better at $688!!

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Patricia Whisenhunt
Reviews.Content: LOOOVVEE IT!!Works great.Looks great.I use it for watching tv, playing the two playstation 3, playing the wii, and internet.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Walter Stobaugh "Boomer 48"
Reviews.Content: Great delivery and set up.  I looked at a lot of 60 inch TV's, this is the best.  Great picture, enjoying Netflix connection.  Good bargain.

Reviews.Title: With Android built-in?
Reviews.Author: Clouds
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV for weeks. Now I still stay up late every night for its excellent picture/video quality on the big screen. I heard that this TV has Android TV built-in. But I am not sure about it. I can watch Netflix, YouTube and Amazon instant video through single remote click, no more hassle of the HTPC things. 5-star definitely.

Reviews.Title: Power
Reviews.Author: D. Barker
Reviews.Content: I've had a few different LCD and LED TVs.  I'm only making this comment here due to various people making comments about the TV turning itself off.  Though it's very possible that is ALL because of your TV it's also possible that this could be in part your power outlet.  I have an outlet where I can plug various items into without any problem, but if I try to plug in my 47" 1080p LCD, the TV won't even turn on.  I could imagine that if I tried a big LED there that it might come on because it would use less power than my 47" LCD, but it could possibly turn off if anything happened to the input power, such as a fluctuation.So, for any big TV, I think I would first replace the power outlet if they are more than 15 years old and have had a lot of use, or at least check the wiring inside to make sure all wires are tight.  If you aren't an electrician or used to working with home electrics then have a person who knows how to do it check it.  On top of that I would have this going through a surge suppressor to help smooth the power going into the TV. These TVs do use a bit of power and are more sensitive than home appliances.Anyway just an idea.

Reviews.Title: Not what I thought it would be.
Reviews.Author: denniscurnes
Reviews.Content: I own another brand of Smart TV and I have no problem getting "Internet Explorer" with it.  On the Visio I can not get this and it is the real reason that I ordered this TV for my church.  I am pretty disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Terrible USB Playback support
Reviews.Author: jdroadie
Reviews.Content: The TV seemed OK but we needed to play video's off the "multimedia" USB port.....the information on this feature is almost non existent...the manual seems to indicate it only plays pictures. The only other source of info comes by using Chat on Vizio's website.There they tell you it does video in VOB (really ripped DVD's) AVI (no codec specified, we went 0 for 5) and WMV...pretty mainstream, we went 0 for 3 on three different methods. We even had JPGs that wouldn't display.So IF you need to play back materials from a USB stick THIS IS NOT THE TV for you. It has TWO USB ports wasting time & materials. There should be a class action suit suing them for using that in the marketing as it's a far cry from other manufacturer's USB playback feature set.The picture is far less bright then our Sharp's too and they play almost anything on USB.

Reviews.Title: Good value, a bit over average overall
Reviews.Author: zerochaos
Reviews.Content: I have a Samsung 55" that is superb.  Adding a 60" has been a pain.  Tried the world's top rated Panasonic Plasma and it does not provide a crisp picture, returned it.  Tried a mid-range Samsung, killer picture, no features, poor skin and earth tones, returned it.  Went to the Visio.  A good value, good picture, poor sound.  The stand leaves the TV 1/2" low at one end.  Pretty poor fit and finish.  Had to shim it up.  The apps, user interface, navigation are poor.  The input device/remote/keyword thing is terrible.  No way to rehome cursor, go back, etc.....simple functions.  Often I find myself restrating the internet apps and retyping things on this terrible thing.  Would be better to allow me to use my laptop with some type of wi-fi direct to the TV or usb connector to the remote so i can type/mouse/navigate properly.It's pretty good for <$900 so I guess I'll keep it.  Really leaves me conflicted though.  I will want a higher end Samsung or something but the quality of those is so erratic right now.  Can't any TV manu produce a top flight product without lots of issues and shortcomings?  Oh well.As for this Visio, it is good enough.

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: W. Redmond "tech maven"
Reviews.Content: The first comment from my wife was "the people look like they are right here in the room".  This TV has a great HD picture.  It has lots of features, many of which will never be used in my house, but all of the things we need are there and work extremely well.  It has really good brightness for a plasma (almost as good as the LED TVs) and nicely saturated colors.  The blacks are solid and the picture is crisp and clear.  I am impressed with Visio's quality, this being my first one.  The controls are high quality and accurate.  I am really happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Wi-fi connectivity isn't strong enough
Reviews.Author: Brennan "Brennan"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my living to replace smaller TV on which I had been using a Roku to stream media. I as excited to get rid of the Roku device and stream with the smart TV, but the wi-fi reciever wasn't strong enough to catch signals for some reason. My iphone, ipad, laptop and Roku all work just fine in teh same room, so I returned the TV and will have to find another one that has a stronger wi-fi receiver. Otherwise, it was a beautiful device, great picture, good remote and a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: Could have been Better. Am I Spoiled? Missing lots of functions
Reviews.Author: Lab Tech Mom
Reviews.Content: I moved into a new house and waited 2 months before I bought a TV. This was it.  I wanted SKYPE and I wanted Smart tv function, because why spend this much money unless you get it with function right?.  Over all the tv is nice, great picture and does the job, BUT what is with all the unfinished functions? Such as this M GO. They have an entire Intro about how great this is, a button that pushes other button's buttons.  Coming soon.  As someone else stated NO Skype.  It is possible it comes in the firmware for the camera.  My wife, said... what is the point of a smart tv with no internet browsing.  All I could do is look at her and say.. AHHH. You got a laptop.  As smart TV's go a 4 year old plasma Philips tv had more function and internet browsing.  I think it is very misleading for them to put the SKYPE icon in the advertisement on their website and then say on the phone OHHHH we don't have that, YET.  There are about 5 or so functions promised. Or coming soon, I am not a big fan of It will be out. Sometimes they never show up.  As far as I could tell, Skype has been an issue for Vizio for over 2 years now from the forums I have found. TV picture nice,  and it is LED edge lit.UPDATE 04/11/2013  no M-GO, and many other functions still don't work yet. STILL coming.

Reviews.Title: No service techs available - thats their policy
Reviews.Author: cantbackup
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Walmart.  It was not working properly; many remote functions did not work, and they changed from Google apps to Yahoo.  I had lines across the tv.  I was on the phone with "support" 5 times for a total of 110 minutes.  That included 3 techs who terminated the call.  Bottom line, I kept asking for a service tech.  Guess what, they have no service technicians.  If they don't fix it over the phone (and they couldn't)you are out of luck.  And none of the techs could fix it.  One of them had me rename HDMI 1 (who knows why) and now I have no picture at all.  Sheesh.  Stay away!

Reviews.Title: Should have stayed with Samsung
Reviews.Author: Daffers
Reviews.Content: When time came to get a new TV, we looked at a few options, this being one. We have always had Samsung, and have never been disappointed. When pricing the TVs, we wanted to get the most for out money, but still have a have a quality product with the best picture we could get. I am a firm believer that you get what you pay for, and have stayed away from lower end lines because of this. This was our first venture with Vizio, and will most likely be our last. I'm not sure if most of the reviews for this tv are from people that have never owned other brands or not, but I was much happier with the picture from my much older Samsung 52" LCD. The picture was a lot clearer and cleaner.I have tried many of the different custom settings I have found online, and still have yet find one that really gives me a picture I am satisfied with....that "WOW....it's like being there!" feeling. The picture is always lacking, always has a grainy look to it, if that makes sense. Watching sports, with the Samsung, it really was like being there.....with the Vizio, I can't get that. Very disappointed. I mean, it's an ok picture....but to me, certainly not a high def picture.Now on to the apps...this is supposed to be a smart TV that can stream movies and TV Shows through wifi. Again, a let down. We bought this so my family could use Netflix and Hulu without needing one of the game consoles (which we have always used previously, with zero issues). I travel for a living, and carry the game console with me for entertainment, so this was supposed to allow my family to enjoy their shows when I am gone. The Vizio is the ONLY device we have in the house that doesn't get a good signal. Hulu and Netflix both lag, and Hulu stutters while trying to play. They are so bad, we can't watch anything on them....a waste of my hard earned money if you ask me. We don't have a huge house, and out router is not a cheap one. Our house is a small 3BR Ranch style home, the router is in our bedroom on one end of the house, the TV is on the other end of the house in the living room, in a direct line from the router. Still doesn't work. Our game console is directly under the TV, and has  no problems streaming anything we want to watch.Bottom line, I wish I would have paid a little more and got the 55" Samsung I was looking at. It was a little more, and we would have a little less TV, but I know we would have been happier. I am more than like going to return this TV for a better one.

Reviews.Title: Still waiting on Vizio to replace the TV after 6 days of it not working properly!!
Reviews.Author: W. Carl Harmon, PsyD, LCPC
Reviews.Content: I received this TV 6 days ago, and couldn't get it to accept the co-axial cable cord so I couldn't get it going.  Called Vizio, and had to fight to get a replacement.  Originally, they said they were going to replace it, and now I'm still waiting....they have delayed the replacement for some unknown reason on their part.  My interactions with them have not been very pleasant.  My recommendations would be to purchase the TV locally so that if something goes wrong you can work with someone face to face.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Big Guy
Reviews.Content: Great looking-Every option-Perfect picture-Great price-I would recommend this TV to everybody ! Fast shipping and was everything that I expected and more.

Reviews.Title: No HBO GO ! ! ! !
Reviews.Author: Heatmizzer
Reviews.Content: I made the big mistake and didn't do my research before I bought it. I just assumed that all Smart TV's had the same programs didn't realize that each TV brand had their own APP's and what they have to select from. Hands down my Samsung is my best Smart TV. The Vizio brand lag's an doesn't have HBO GO. Seems that yahoo doesn't like HBO GO.

Reviews.Title: JUNK

Reviews.Title: Signal Processing Delay made this TV unusable for me
Reviews.Author: Greg Visscher
Reviews.Content: I purchased this this TV to replace a 5 year old 50" plasma that was starting to flicker.  At first I was really excited about this TV.  You simply cannot beat the size and quality for the price.  Unfortunately, after setting this TV up yesterday and hanging it on my wall, I am taking it down and returning it today.  There was a perceptible delay between the signal sent to the TV and its picture/audio.I set up my TV downstream of my receiver and let the receiver do all of the switching amongst the various components (cable box, DVD, computer, Xbox, etc).  The primary reason is because the receiver also drivers the 5.1 speakers in my room.  Where my 5yr old plasma had no problem, this TV had a very slight but noticeable delay that put it out of sync with the audio on the receiver.  It probably was less than 1/10 sec but still very noticeable.  With the TV speakers turned up, the delay would cause an echo so bad that made it sound like a bad concert hall special effect.  Even with the TV speakers off, you could notice the delay on the video when people were speaking.I tried messing with various settings including turning features like "Picture Smoothing" off or increasing "Lip sync" settings but nothing would improve the delay.  I suspect that it is a side effect of the time the TV takes to process and analze the incoming signal.  When I called Vizio support their suggestion was to take all the components and HDMI them directly to the TV which would also disable my surround sound speakers.  Not a solution.I am sorry to say that this TV is not going to work if you plan to have it downstream of your receiver/amplifier.  If you are simply hooking it direct to your cable box and not planning to run it off your receiver then the delay is probably not an issue.

Reviews.Title: terrible lip sync issues
Reviews.Author: M. Davis
Reviews.Content: I have edited and updates my review below with additional information and a log. I have now owned two of these. My first purcahse and then a replacement unit. Quick summary:Pros:- Beautiful Picture- Lots of Features for a Low Price- Smart Apps Built In (if you need them or don't have Roku or Xbox etc)Cons:_ Default settings create a Soap Opera effect that can be annoying- Video delay that leads to audio getting out of sync (like 3 second delays on my first one, about 1 second on the second on. These are from ALL sources, so it's a problem with the TV, not the source)- Takes about 18 seconds to "boot up" from power on- Some ghosting and jittery motion (this was not prevalent on my first set, but is really bad on my second. You can see motion artifacts and jitters with fast moving objects)11/15/2012TV has a great picture at a great price but there are terrible lip sync issues. The audio and the picture are constantly out of sync. It is frustrating and annoying to watch TV when the sound is out of sync. Multiple people who have watched TV at my house have commented about the problems. This is definitely a really annoying bug. Can't recommend this product until they fix these issues. I think I am going to return mine to Amazon.UPDATE: 11/20/2012I called Vizio support to see if they could help me get to the bottom of the issues and fix it. Did a complete factory reset on the TV. Reset everything and still seeing major problems. Problems from Cable Box to TV, XBox to TV and even delays just watching the smart apps on the TV (no input or hdmi at all). Vizio support didn't have a fix. After 35 minutes and all kinds of trial and error attempts, they gave up and said they will have to send a technician. I think I'd rather just send the TV back. :/ My only question is... did I get a lemon or is this TV just bad? I don't want to exchange if I'm still going to see these issues on a new TV of the same model.UPDATE: 12/27/2012Sent original set back and got a new unit. Really bad audio sync issues went away on new unit. There is now a slight delay for video to process, but there are some workarounds. Second unit has video problems though... jittery motion blurs and artifacts. This is a bug with the TV because it wasn't there on my first unit and is there on my second one.I am returning my second TV. I think this could be a good TV, but VIZIO has some serious quality control issues. Both of my sets had major issues that made the TV really annoying to use.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Amazon Customer Service costs it two stars
Reviews.Author: Mike Green Jr
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this TV and have had no issues with it. It came when it was schedule to be delivered, the packaging was in perfect condition and there is nothing wrong with its performance. I did adjust the color settings per another review for this product and it does enhance the picture. However, 15 days after I received this TV which I bought for $999.99 it was a lightning deal for $688.00. That is a $311.99 discount or roughly 30%. My brother-in-law bought this TV on the lightning deal. I later found out we had the same TV, but he bought his two weeks after mine and paid significantly less.I was hoping Amazon would be willing to work with me and give me some sort of price matching, I emailed customer service and they told me about their TV Price Matching Program. The link didn't work. I called customer service and they explained that lightning deals are not covered by their price matching program. I understand this issue, but I am just dumbfounded by the fact that they were not willing to make any sort of offer to take the sting out of this situation where I overpaid $300 on something I could have gotten for $700. That is just really poor customer service in my opinion. I asked if they could give me an Amazon credit for less than the full price match, or a coupon for a certain percentage off other purchases, or anything - and they were unwilling to provide any sort of compensation. Go buy this TV from Costco, its cheaper there anyway.I will not buy any big ticket items (over a few hundred dollars) on Amazon unless it is a Lightning Deal or Gold Box Deal of the Day. I advise the same for everyone who reads this review. I would rather buy an item like this at a brick and mortar store knowing full well the price I pay is the best they will or can provide for the near foreseeable future. Amazon claims to be the "Earth's Most Customer-Centric Company" yet they refused to provide any sort of assistance in this situation. I am extremely disappointed in Amazon's stance in this situation and it will curtail my use of Amazon in the future.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE! Internet TV without the Internet
Reviews.Author: Jason Beckmann
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this TV but it was a huge dissapointment.How do you have an "internet" TV that is almost completely unable to access the internet?  There is no web browser included which means that you cannot stream content direct from providers.  Forget about going to CBS.com and getting the latest episode of the Big Bang Theory.  Instead you have limited access to paid services such as Vudu and Hulu Plus through the built in "apps".  If they do not have a built in app for a web service you use, then you cannot use the service.I contacted Vizio support and they told me that not only do they not include a web browser, they have no plans to add or allow one.  The Vizio representative suggested I spend $99 on their set top box that will convert a normal television into an "internet" TV.  For the record, their set top box has a chrome web browser built in.  It seems utterly ridiculous that I would need to buy an add on to convert my internet TV into an internet TV.If you want a real internet TV, buy something besides a Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but Streaming Capability poor compared to roku/special delivery does not cover smart tv connections
Reviews.Author: J. Sutherland "giftbuyer"
Reviews.Content: First of all the "Special"Delivery at Amazon is not that special.  The description leaves out that the delivery person just makes sure the tv works with your cable box.  After that the rest of the set up is up to you and it is extremely difficult, complex, and almost impossible.The internet connection to work the apps and smart features is left to you. We had more problems than you can imagine getting this worked out.  The remote keyboard shows a ' SIGN in the keyboard but it does not work.  Therefore we had to change our entire wireless network name to remove a ' in the name.  So after resetting and changing our computers and 30 minutes later we tried again.We were able to pair with the wireless network, however it took forever to hook up to Netflix.  Slow slow slow, every step was a pain.  Finally after another 30 minutes we get into our netflix account.  We try to watch a movie.  What a disappointment.  The wireless connection times out continuously and does not even compare to our roku connection we had with our other tv.  Roku in the same exact location always worked fabulously.  Never a time out and clear streaming.  I am so disappointed.  The tv works great with cable, but I use Netflix and Amazon a lot to stream movies and tv shows.  I contacted support so maybe I will get help, we shall see. Otherwise I have to hook up my roku to this tv and I hope it works as well as my other tv did.The tv has a beautiful picture when hooked up to the cable box.  The remote features take a bit of learning to work through, but it works well too.
